original: gang dag ma 'ongs pa na 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa myong ba rnams dang ldan pa dang bral bar 'dod pa rnams kyi ni 'dod pa na spyod pa nyid kyi yod par srid pa dang med par sred pa rnams dang / gang yang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i ste /
analyzed: gang dag ma 'ongs pa na 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa myong ba rnams dang ldan pa dang bral bar 'dod pa rnams kyi ni 'dod pa na spyod pa nyid kyi yod par srid pa dang med par sred pa rnams dang / gang yang gzugs dang gzugs med pa na spyod pa'i ste /
translated: Those who desire to possess or to be separated from what is desirable or undesirable in the future have craving for existence in the realm of desire, and craving for nonexistence in the realm of form and the formless realm.

original: de de dag gi rkyen gyis ni gzhan yin no //
analyzed: de de dag gi rkyen gyis ni gzhan yin no //
translated: Craving for existence and craving for nonexistence are conditions for the other two cravings.

original: sred pa gang gi rkyen gyis bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: sred pa gang gi rkyen gyis bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa yin zhe na /
translated: What is the condition for the craving that is the cause of the view of self?

original: sa gang yin pa'i tshor ba la sred pa kun @41b tu byung na sa de ba'i lus la byis pa rnams bdag tu mngon du zhen cing mngon par dga' ba de la chags par byed do //
analyzed: sa gang yin pa'i tshor ba la sred pa kun @41b tu byung na sa de ba'i lus la byis pa rnams bdag tu mngon du zhen cing mngon par dga' ba de la chags par byed do //
translated: When craving for feeling arises in a certain realm, childish ordinary beings cling to the body of that realm as a self and delight in it.

original: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis sa 'og gi mdo sde las 'jig tshogs la lta ba bstan nas ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na bcom ldan 'das kyis sa 'og gi mdo sde las 'jig tshogs la lta ba bstan nas ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa'i tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa'o //
translated: Therefore, the Blessed One taught in the Kṣemaka Sūtra that the view of the transitory collection arises from contact accompanied by ignorance, and that craving arises with feeling as its condition.

original: de las 'du byed de dag go zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de las 'du byed de dag go zhes gsungs so //
translated: From this, the formations.

original: 'o na chos 'di pa bdag med par lta ba rnams kyi nye bar len pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na chos 'di pa bdag med par lta ba rnams kyi nye bar len pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the appropriation of those who see the nonexistence of a self?

original: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba rnams kyi ni 'dod pa nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang ma bral ba rnams kyi ni 'dod pa nye bar len pa'o //
translated: For those who are not free from attachment, it is the appropriation of desire.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi ni nye bar len pa gzhan yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba rnams kyi ni nye bar len pa gzhan yin te /
translated: For those who are free from attachment, it is another appropriation.

original: ji skad du smras pa de lta bu ni ma yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du smras pa de lta bu ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not as you have said.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na ;
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na ;
translated: Why is this?

original: de dag la lta ba'i nyon mongs pa yod pa ma yin no //🔽de lta bas na de dag ni lta ba'am tshul khrims sam brtul zhugs sam /
analyzed: de dag la lta ba'i nyon mongs pa yod pa ma yin no // de lta bas na de dag ni lta ba'am tshul khrims sam brtul zhugs sam /
translated: Because they do not have the affliction of view.🔽Therefore, they do not cling to the view, to morality and vows, or to self-theories.

original: bdag tu smra bar mngon par zhen pas mngon par chags par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: bdag tu smra bar mngon par zhen pas mngon par chags par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: They do not cling to these through the adherence of belief.

original: de dag la sred pa'i nyon mongs pa ni yod de /
analyzed: de dag la sred pa'i nyon mongs pa ni yod de /
translated: But they do have the affliction of craving.

original: sa gang la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba de la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags nye bar len pa yin no //
analyzed: sa gang la 'dod chags dang ma bral ba de la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags nye bar len pa yin no //
translated: Wherever there is no freedom from attachment, there is the appropriation of desire and will.

original: nyon mongs pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i gang zag gi dbang du byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyis nye bar len pa 'di bzhi gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa yongs su rdzogs pa'i gang zag gi dbang du byas nas bcom ldan 'das kyis nye bar len pa 'di bzhi gsungs pa yin no //
translated: The Fortunate One, in fact, has taught these four appropriative aggregates in order to designate the person completely endowed with defilement.

original: gzhan du ni tha dad pa med par gsungs te nye bar len pa med par gyur pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan du ni tha dad pa med par gsungs te nye bar len pa med par gyur pa'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: In other places, he has taught that the aggregates are not distinct: “What are the factors that are not subject to appropriation?

original: mig dang gzugs dang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba dang nye bar len pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: mig dang gzugs dang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba dang nye bar len pa gang zhe na /
translated: The eye, visible forms, eye-consciousness, eye-contact, the painful, pleasant or neither painful nor pleasant sensation that proceeds from contact with the eye.🔽What is subject to appropriation?

original: gang la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags gang yin pa ste 'di ni 'dir nye bar len pa yin no //
analyzed: gang la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags gang yin pa ste 'di ni 'dir nye bar len pa yin no //
translated: The craving which is there, that is what is subject to appropriation here.

original: gzhan dag na re bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa yang de dag la yod pa yin te lus la bdag go snyam pa'i 'dun pa dang 'dod chags gang yin pa'o zhe'o //
analyzed: gzhan dag na re bdag tu smra ba nye bar len pa yang de dag la yod pa yin te lus la bdag go snyam pa'i 'dun pa dang 'dod chags gang yin pa'o zhe'o //
translated: Others say: “The theory of self is also subject to appropriation, for there is craving and attachment to the self in regard to the body.”

original: sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa zhes bya ba 'dir gal te rkyen nges pa yin na ni /
analyzed: sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa zhes bya ba 'dir gal te rkyen nges pa yin na ni /
translated: In the formula of dependent origination, the word “condition” has a specific meaning.

original: sred pa nyid nye bar len pa'i rkyen yin gyi gzhan ma yin pas gzhan rgyu dang de ma thag pa dang dmigs pa'i rkyen rnams nye bar len pa yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sred pa nyid nye bar len pa'i rkyen yin gyi gzhan ma yin pas gzhan rgyu dang de ma thag pa dang dmigs pa'i rkyen rnams nye bar len pa yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Craving itself is the condition of grasping, not something else, so the other conditions cause, immediately preceding condition, and objective condition would become grasping.

original: mdo sde gzhan yang yongs su spangs pa yin te /🔽ma rig pa'i rgyus kun tu 'dod chags pa dang kun du zhe sdang ba dang kun du gti mug pa'o zhes 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du gang cung zad sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnam pa du ma 'byung ba de dag thams cad ni ma rig pa'i rgyu can nas ma rig pa'i rkyen can gyi bar du 'byung ba dang /🔽de bzhin du 'du byed gang yin @42a * //
analyzed: mdo sde gzhan yang yongs su spangs pa yin te / ma rig pa'i rgyus kun tu 'dod chags pa dang kun du zhe sdang ba dang kun du gti mug pa'o zhes 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du gang cung zad sdig pa mi dge ba'i chos rnam pa du ma 'byung ba de dag thams cad ni ma rig pa'i rgyu can nas ma rig pa'i rkyen can gyi bar du 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du 'du byed gang yin @42a * //
translated: And other sūtras would be rejected.🔽It is said, “Through the cause of ignorance, there is desire, hatred and delusion,” and “Whatever bad, nonvirtuous phenomena arise, all of them arise through the cause of ignorance, through the condition of ignorance,” and “Whatever compositional activity there is, all of it arises in dependence on contact.”

original: pa de dag thams cad reg pa la brten nas zhes pa la sogs pa spangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa de dag thams cad reg pa la brten nas zhes pa la sogs pa spangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: And so on.

original: gal te rkyen can nges pa yin na ni /
analyzed: gal te rkyen can nges pa yin na ni /
translated: If the appropriator were definite,

original: nye bar len pa kho na'i rkyen srid pa yin gyi gzhan gyi ma yin pas chos gzhan gyi rgyu dang de ma thag pa dang / dmigs pa dang bdag po'i rkyen du sred pa yin par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nye bar len pa kho na'i rkyen srid pa yin gyi gzhan gyi ma yin pas chos gzhan gyi rgyu dang de ma thag pa dang / dmigs pa dang bdag po'i rkyen du sred pa yin par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Existence is the condition of the appropriated aggregates alone, not of any other. Craving would not be the cause, the antecedent, the object, or the dominant condition of any other factor.

original: dge slong dag las kyi rgyu ni sred pa rkyen ni sred pa 'byung khungs ni sred pa zhes bya ba'i mdo sde gzhan yang yongs su spangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong dag las kyi rgyu ni sred pa rkyen ni sred pa 'byung khungs ni sred pa zhes bya ba'i mdo sde gzhan yang yongs su spangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: The Sūtra would be contradicted: “Bhikṣus, the cause of action is craving; craving is its condition; craving is its source. ”

original: gnyis ka nges pa yin na ni ji skad du smras pa'i skyon gnyis kar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis ka nges pa yin na ni ji skad du smras pa'i skyon gnyis kar 'gyur ro //
translated: If the two are determined, then both errors are committed.

original: ma nges pa yin na ni bshad pa don med par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ma nges pa yin na ni bshad pa don med par 'gyur te /
translated: If they are not determined, then the explanation is useless.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: nges pa yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: nges pa yod pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: the two are not determined.

original: nges pa med kyang bshad pa don med pa ma yin te /
analyzed: nges pa med kyang bshad pa don med pa ma yin te /
translated: Even if they are not determined, the explanation is not useless,

original: gtso bo'i rkyen bstan pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin du bshad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bo'i rkyen bstan pa'i phyir dang / de bzhin du bshad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the principal condition is indicated, and because the explanation is in conformity with the Sūtra.

original: 'di ltar tshor ba la sred bas da dang ldan pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir 'dod pa la sogs pa nye bar len pa'i rkyen yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar tshor ba la sred bas da dang ldan pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir 'dod pa la sogs pa nye bar len pa'i rkyen yin no //
translated: Thus, craving for feeling is the condition for appropriating desire realm objects and so on in order to possess or separate from them.

original: nye bar len pa tha dad pa so so ni ma rig pa la sogs pa dang / tshor ba'i sred pa la ltos pa yin gyi /
analyzed: nye bar len pa tha dad pa so so ni ma rig pa la sogs pa dang / tshor ba'i sred pa la ltos pa yin gyi /
translated: The individual appropriators are dependent on ignorance and so on and craving for feeling.

original: de la ma rig pa la sogs pa ni ma yin no /
analyzed: de la ma rig pa la sogs pa ni ma yin no /
translated: They are not dependent on ignorance and so on.

original: nye bar len pa rnam par nges pa ni shin tu 'phros pa yin pas 'phros pa gzhag go //
analyzed: nye bar len pa rnam par nges pa ni shin tu 'phros pa yin pas 'phros pa gzhag go //
translated: Since the ascertainment of appropriators is very extensive, I will set it aside.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bshad pa las len pa rnam par dbye ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bshad pa las len pa rnam par dbye ba rdzogs so /
translated: This completes the explanation of the branches of dependent origination that are appropriators.

original: // / len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bya ba'i srid pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: // / len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bya ba'i srid pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is existence that is the condition for appropriating?🔽The three existences: desire existence, form existence and formless existence.

original: srid pa gsum ste 'dod pa'i srid pa dang / gzugs kyi srid pa dang gzugs med pa'i srid pa'o zhes bya ba 'dir yang tshig sbyar na thal bar 'gyur ba snga ma bzhin du gnas te /
analyzed: srid pa gsum ste 'dod pa'i srid pa dang / gzugs kyi srid pa dang gzugs med pa'i srid pa'o zhes bya ba 'dir yang tshig sbyar na thal bar 'gyur ba snga ma bzhin du gnas te /
translated: Here, the application of the words is similar to the previous application.

original: de bas na 'di'i tshig sbyar ba ji ltar brjod par bya zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na 'di'i tshig sbyar ba ji ltar brjod par bya zhe na /
translated: How should the compound be analyzed?

original: 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i srid pa ni 'dod pa'i srid pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i srid pa ni 'dod pa'i srid pa'o //
translated: The existence associated with the realm of desire is the existence of the realm of desire.

original: de bzhin du lhag ma rnams kyang tshig bar ma mi mngon pa'i phyir sbrang rtsi'i chu lta bu dang bu ram 'o ma bzhin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du lhag ma rnams kyang tshig bar ma mi mngon pa'i phyir sbrang rtsi'i chu lta bu dang bu ram 'o ma bzhin no //
translated: The same for the other two. The middle term is elided. The compound is like madhu-pāyasa, “honey and milk-rice,” or madhu-stanyam, “honey and milk.”

original: srid pa yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: srid pa yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is existence?

original: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'o zhes mdo sde gzhan las bcom ldan 'das kyis tha dang pa med par gsungs so//
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga'o zhes mdo sde gzhan las bcom ldan 'das kyis tha dang pa med par gsungs so//
translated: The Fortunate One said in another Sūtra: “Existence is the five appropriative aggregates.”

original: de dag kyang khams gsum du ji ltar rigs pas rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang khams gsum du ji ltar rigs pas rig par bya'o //
translated: These existences are distributed among the three realms as is fitting.

original: de ltar na 'o na srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba zhes bya ba skye ba gzhan gang zhig srid pa'i rkyen gyis yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na 'o na srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba zhes bya ba skye ba gzhan gang zhig srid pa'i rkyen gyis yin zhe na /
translated: If this is the case, then what is the existence that is the condition of birth?

original: srid pa gsum po de dag nyid mdo sde gzhan las srid pa bdun du gsungs te /
analyzed: srid pa gsum po de dag nyid mdo sde gzhan las srid pa bdun du gsungs te /
translated: The Fortunate One said in another Sūtra that the three existences are the seven types of existence.

original: dmyal ba'i srid pa dang byol song gi srid pa dang yi @42b dags kyi srid pa dang / lha'i srid pa dang / mi'i srid pa dang / las kyi sred pa dang / bar ma do'i srid pa rnams ji ltar rigs par yin te /
analyzed: dmyal ba'i srid pa dang byol song gi srid pa dang yi @42b dags kyi srid pa dang / lha'i srid pa dang / mi'i srid pa dang / las kyi sred pa dang / bar ma do'i srid pa rnams ji ltar rigs par yin te /
translated: The existence of hell beings, the existence of animals, the existence of ghosts, the existence of gods, the existence of humans, the existence of karma, and the existence of the intermediate state.

original: sems can rnams gang du gang gis 'byung ba de srid pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams gang du gang gis 'byung ba de srid pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because existence is that by which sentient beings arise in a particular place.

original: gang gis zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang gis dang rim pa gang gis shes par bya ba'o //
analyzed: gang gis zhes bya ba ni rgyu gang gis dang rim pa gang gis shes par bya ba'o //
translated: By what means is it known? By what cause and in what order is it known?

original: de bas na mdo sde de las ni las kyi srid pas bsdus pa ni srid pa gsum yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na mdo sde de las ni las kyi srid pas bsdus pa ni srid pa gsum yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, in that sutra, the three existences should be understood as included in the existence of karma.🔽In another sutra, it is also said:🔽“Ananda, even if the establishment of existence in the future were to exist, it would be this existence here.”

original: mdo sde gzhan las kyang kun dga' bo ma 'ongs pa na yang srid pa mngon par 'grub par byed pa yin du zin kyang 'dir ni srid pa 'di yin no zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: mdo sde gzhan las kyang kun dga' bo ma 'ongs pa na yang srid pa mngon par 'grub par byed pa yin du zin kyang 'dir ni srid pa 'di yin no zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: In the analysis, it is also said:

original: rab tu dbye ba las kyang 'dod pa'i srid pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: rab tu dbye ba las kyang 'dod pa'i srid pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is existence in the desire realm?”

original: las gang zhig 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i nye bar len pa'i rkyen can ma 'ongs pa na mngon par 'grub par mngon du phyogs pa dang / las de'i rnam par smin pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: las gang zhig 'dod pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i nye bar len pa'i rkyen can ma 'ongs pa na mngon par 'grub par mngon du phyogs pa dang / las de'i rnam par smin pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: What is the karma that is the condition for appropriation associated with the desire realm, that is directed toward future actualization, and the karmic maturation of that karma?

original: gzugs kyi srid pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs kyi srid pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is existence in the form realm?

original: las gang zhig gzugs dang rab tu ldan pa'i zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: las gang zhig gzugs dang rab tu ldan pa'i zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
translated: It is karma associated with the form realm, as before.

original: gzugs med pa'i srid pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i srid pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is existence in the formless realm?

original: gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: gzugs med pa dang rab tu ldan pa'i zhes bya ba snga ma bzhin no //
translated: It is karma associated with the formless realm, as before.

original: 'dir yang las gang zhig srid pa yin par bstan pa de'i rkyen gyis skye ba yin par dgongs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'dir yang las gang zhig srid pa yin par bstan pa de'i rkyen gyis skye ba yin par dgongs pa yin gyi /
translated: Here, existence is taught to be the karma that is the condition for birth.

original: de'i rnam par smin pa'i rkyen gyis ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i rnam par smin pa'i rkyen gyis ma yin no //
translated: It is not the condition for the karmic maturation of that karma.

original: 'on kyang de ni srid pa yin no //
analyzed: 'on kyang de ni srid pa yin no //
translated: However, that is existence.

original: de bas na las kyi srid pa kho na der khams gsum pa'i 'dod pa la sogs pa'i srid pa yin par dgongs pa ste /
analyzed: de bas na las kyi srid pa kho na der khams gsum pa'i 'dod pa la sogs pa'i srid pa yin par dgongs pa ste /
translated: Therefore, only the existence of karma is intended as the existence of desire realm, etc., in the three realms.

original: 'dis bar ma chod par yang srid pa 'byung bar byed pas srid pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'dis bar ma chod par yang srid pa 'byung bar byed pas srid pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is called “existence” because it causes the arising of a new existence without interruption.

original: dper na 'dis ded par byed pas ded pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na 'dis ded par byed pas ded pa zhes bya ba bzhin no //
translated: For example, a caravan is so called because it goes by traveling together.

original: de lta na 'o na 'du byed rnams dang srid pa la bye brag ci yod //
analyzed: de lta na 'o na 'du byed rnams dang srid pa la bye brag ci yod //
translated: If that is so, what is the difference between the formations and existence?

original: de gnyis ka yang las kyi ming thob par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de gnyis ka yang las kyi ming thob par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Both of them receive the name karma.

original: las ni gnas skabs gnyis te /
analyzed: las ni gnas skabs gnyis te /
translated: Karma is of two kinds:

original: rang gi ngo bo'i gnas skabs dang bag chags kyi gnas skabs so //
analyzed: rang gi ngo bo'i gnas skabs dang bag chags kyi gnas skabs so //
translated: karma as intrinsic nature and karma as residual impression.

original: sems kyi rgyun la bag chags kyi bye brag de las skyes pa yod pa yang las kyi ming 'thob ste /
analyzed: sems kyi rgyun la bag chags kyi bye brag de las skyes pa yod pa yang las kyi ming 'thob ste /
translated: The difference that is produced in the mental continuum by the residual impression of that karma also receives the name karma.

original: dper na sman bcud kyis len gyis skra dkar bcom pa dang ; de las skyes pa lus yongs su 'gyur ba'i bye brag kyang bcud kyis len gyi ming 'thob pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na sman bcud kyis len gyis skra dkar bcom pa dang ; de las skyes pa lus yongs su 'gyur ba'i bye brag kyang bcud kyis len gyi ming 'thob pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, the destruction of gray hair by the elixir of life and the transformation of the body that is produced by that elixir are called “elixir.”

original: de la gang gi tshe 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes brjod pa de'i tshe ni las kyi rang gi ngo bo'i gnas skabs kyi 'du byed kyi ming 'thob pa yin te /🔽nus pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i rnam @43a * //
analyzed: de la gang gi tshe 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis rnam par shes pa zhes brjod pa de'i tshe ni las kyi rang gi ngo bo'i gnas skabs kyi 'du byed kyi ming 'thob pa yin te / nus pa'i bye brag dang ldan pa'i rnam @43a * //
translated: When it is said that consciousness has the formations as its condition, then the formations in the state of the essence of karma receive the name of formations.

original: par shes pa'i rgyun ni de'i rkyen gyis yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: par shes pa'i rgyun ni de'i rkyen gyis yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the continuum of consciousness endowed with a specific potency is its condition.

original: gang gi tshe len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes brjod pa de'i tshe ni bag chags kyi gnas skabs la srid pa'i ming 'thob pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes brjod pa de'i tshe ni bag chags kyi gnas skabs la srid pa'i ming 'thob pa yin no //
translated: When it is said that becoming has the grasping as its condition, then becoming receives the name of grasping in the state of the latent impressions.

original: gal te de'i bag chags de yang srid pa mngon par 'grub bar byed pa yin na 'jug pa rnyed pa yin no //
analyzed: gal te de'i bag chags de yang srid pa mngon par 'grub bar byed pa yin na 'jug pa rnyed pa yin no //
translated: If the latent impressions of that grasping are what bring about the actualization of becoming, then it has obtained entry.

original: 'jug pa ma rnyed pa yin na ni las kyi ming dang 'du byed kyi ming 'thob ba yin no //
analyzed: 'jug pa ma rnyed pa yin na ni las kyi ming dang 'du byed kyi ming 'thob ba yin no //
translated: If it has not obtained entry, then it receives the name of karma and the name of formation.

original: de sa bon yin par dgongs pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de sa bon yin par dgongs pa ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not that it is considered to be a seed.

original: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni sa bon yin te ded la len pa gang yin pa'i bag chags yongs su shin tu brtas par gyur na /
analyzed: kun gzhi rnam par shes pa ni sa bon yin te ded la len pa gang yin pa'i bag chags yongs su shin tu brtas par gyur na /
translated: The store consciousness is the seed, because it is the habitual tendency that is the cause for appropriating.

original: des ni de len pa dang bcas pa yin te /
analyzed: des ni de len pa dang bcas pa yin te /
translated: When that is fully developed, it is said to be associated with appropriation.

original: ma 'ongs pa na yang srid pa'i myu gu mngon par 'grub pa'i sa bon yin no //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na yang srid pa'i myu gu mngon par 'grub pa'i sa bon yin no //
translated: It is the seed for the actualization of the sprout of existence in the future.

original: sa gong ba'i len pa de yongs su shin tu brtas par gyur na /
analyzed: sa gong ba'i len pa de yongs su shin tu brtas par gyur na /
translated: When the appropriation of a higher stage is fully developed,

original: des ni de len pa dang bcas pa yin te ma 'ongs pa yang srid pa'i myu gu mngon par 'grub pa'i sa bon yin no //
analyzed: des ni de len pa dang bcas pa yin te ma 'ongs pa yang srid pa'i myu gu mngon par 'grub pa'i sa bon yin no //
translated: it is said to be associated with appropriation. It is the seed for the actualization of the sprout of existence in the future.

original: sa gang pa'i len pa de yongs su shin tu brtas shing rgyas par gyur na ni de'i sgo de nas sa de pa nyid kyi las kyi bag chags bstsags pa'i gnas skabs dag de ma thag tu tshe gzhan mngon par 'grub par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sa gang pa'i len pa de yongs su shin tu brtas shing rgyas par gyur na ni de'i sgo de nas sa de pa nyid kyi las kyi bag chags bstsags pa'i gnas skabs dag de ma thag tu tshe gzhan mngon par 'grub par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: When the appropriation of a certain stage is fully developed and expanded, then, through that door, the state of the accumulation of the habitual tendencies of karma of that stage is immediately obtained for the actualization of another life.

original: 'jug pa rnyed pa yin pas len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bstan to //
analyzed: 'jug pa rnyed pa yin pas len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that existence has the condition of appropriation.

original: 'jug pa zhes bya ba de ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'jug pa zhes bya ba de ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is this so-called “evolution”?

original: gang la las kyi bag chags yongs su 'gyur ba'i bye brag yod pa rang gi 'bras bu mngon par 'grub par byed pa de ni /
analyzed: gang la las kyi bag chags yongs su 'gyur ba'i bye brag yod pa rang gi 'bras bu mngon par 'grub par byed pa de ni /
translated: It is that which has the specific transformation of the latent impressions of action and which produces its own effect.

original: 'di'i 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'i 'jug pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called “evolution.”

original: dper na ma du lung ga'i me tog la rgya skyegs kyi khu bas bsgos pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na ma du lung ga'i me tog la rgya skyegs kyi khu bas bsgos pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, it is like a mallika flower which is dyed with lac.

original: ci'i phyir sred pa kho na srid pa'i rkyen yin par mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir sred pa kho na srid pa'i rkyen yin par mi 'dod ce na /
translated: Why is craving not accepted as the condition of existence?

original: tshor ba la sred pa ni gdon mi za bar de dang ldan pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir 'dod pa la sogs pa len par byed la len pa med par yang las rnams srid par 'gyur ba ma yin zhing 'dod pa la sogs pa len pa med
analyzed: tshor ba la sred pa ni gdon mi za bar de dang ldan pa dang bral bar bya ba'i phyir 'dod pa la sogs pa len par byed la len pa med par yang las rnams srid par 'gyur ba ma yin zhing 'dod pa la sogs pa len pa med
translated: Craving for feeling necessarily leads to the taking up of desire, etc. in order to be united with or separated from that feeling. But karma does not evolve into existence without the taking up of desire, etc.

original: par yang tshor ba tsam la sred pas ni las sna tshogs kun nas slong bar byed pa ma yin la 'dod pa la sogs pa la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags kyi sgo nas kun nas bslang ba'i las ni sgo de kho nas phyis srid pa yin par 'gyur🔽ro // ngan @45a * //
analyzed: par yang tshor ba tsam la sred pas ni las sna tshogs kun nas slong bar byed pa ma yin la 'dod pa la sogs pa la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags kyi sgo nas kun nas bslang ba'i las ni sgo de kho nas phyis srid pa yin par 'gyur ro // ngan @45a * //
translated: Actions motivated by desire realm attachment and so on are later born in existence through that very door.

original: song gi 'gro bas skrag pa dang / bde 'gro 'dod pa rnams kyi 'gro ba de dang mi mthun pa'i sred pa ni ngan song du 'gro ba'i las rnams srid par byed pa'i rkyen du 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: song gi 'gro bas skrag pa dang / bde 'gro 'dod pa rnams kyi 'gro ba de dang mi mthun pa'i sred pa ni ngan song du 'gro ba'i las rnams srid par byed pa'i rkyen du 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: Craving for a realm of existence that is incompatible with the realms of existence of those frightened of the lower realms and those who desire the higher realms is not tenable as the condition motivating karma leading to the lower realms.

original: bde 'gro'i tshor ba la sred pa sngon du 'gro ba'i 'dod pa la sogs pa la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags ni 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: bde 'gro'i tshor ba la sred pa sngon du 'gro ba'i 'dod pa la sogs pa la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags ni 'thad pa yin no //
translated: Desire realm attachment and so on that is preceded by craving for the feeling of the higher realms is tenable.

original: gang dag gi sred pa srid pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa dang yang srid dang mi mthun par byed pa de dag gi ni de'i rkyen gyis ji ltar las dag srid par 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang dag gi sred pa srid pa la rgyab kyis phyogs pa dang yang srid dang mi mthun par byed pa de dag gi ni de'i rkyen gyis ji ltar las dag srid par 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: How could karma be established as existence through the condition of those who turn their back on craving and who act in a way incompatible with further existence?

original: de bas na len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bya ba ni gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bas na len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bya ba ni gdon mi za bar khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should definitely accept that existence is conditioned by clinging.

original: 'o na gang bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhan nas dga' ba nyid len pa yin par gsungs la /
analyzed: 'o na gang bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhan nas dga' ba nyid len pa yin par gsungs la /
translated: But the Bhagavån has said in another sūtra that craving is clinging.🔽And in the Sūtra on Feeling, he said that existence is conditioned by that:🔽Monks, whatever feeling foolish, untrained ordinary beings experience,🔽whether pleasant, painful, or neither,

original: de'i rkyen gyis kyang srid pa yin par tshor ba'i mdo sde las dge slong dag byis pa thos pa dang mi ldan pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams kyi tshor ba gang ci myong yang rung zhes rgyas par byas nas tshor ba gang yin pa de la dga' ba
analyzed: de'i rkyen gyis kyang srid pa yin par tshor ba'i mdo sde las dge slong dag byis pa thos pa dang mi ldan pa'i so so'i skye bo rnams kyi tshor ba gang ci myong yang rung zhes rgyas par byas nas tshor ba gang yin pa de la dga' ba
translated: they delight in that feeling,

original: de ni len pa yin no //🔽len pa de'i rkyen gyis srid pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs la /
analyzed: de ni len pa yin no // len pa de'i rkyen gyis srid pa yin no zhes bya ba'i bar du gsungs la /
translated: that is clinging.🔽Existence is conditioned by that clinging.🔽And it is said that craving for existence is craving concomitant with attachment to pleasure.

original: yang 'byung ba pa'i sred pa dga' ba 'dod chags dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o zhes 'byung bas mdo sde'i tshig 'di dag sred pa yin par rung la /
analyzed: yang 'byung ba pa'i sred pa dga' ba 'dod chags dang mtshungs par ldan pa'o zhes 'byung bas mdo sde'i tshig 'di dag sred pa yin par rung la /
translated: Therefore, these words of the sūtra are suitable as craving.

original: der yang lha rnams mgu pa ni dga' ba la brten pa yin no zhes kyang gsungs so zhe na /
analyzed: der yang lha rnams mgu pa ni dga' ba la brten pa yin no zhes kyang gsungs so zhe na /
translated: Moreover, the gods are satisfied by joy, which is based on delight.

original: sred pa dang 'dod chags mtshungs par ldan pa sred pa yin no zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //
analyzed: sred pa dang 'dod chags mtshungs par ldan pa sred pa yin no zhes bya bar mi rung ngo //
translated: It is not correct to say that craving is craving associated with craving and attachment.

original: dga' ba yang dga' bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: dga' ba yang dga' bar byed pa yin te /
translated: Delight is also delighting,

original: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dga' ba /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can gyi yid dga' ba /
translated: because defiled mind is delighting.

original: bde ba'i tshor ba'i bye brag yin no //
analyzed: bde ba'i tshor ba'i bye brag yin no //
translated: It is a particular type of pleasant feeling.

original: tshor ba ni len pa kho na yin no zhes bya bar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: tshor ba ni len pa kho na yin no zhes bya bar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not correct to say that feeling alone is grasping.

original: mdo sde'i tshig 'di ni dgongs pa can yin no //
analyzed: mdo sde'i tshig 'di ni dgongs pa can yin no //
translated: This statement in the sutra is provisional.

original: 'di la dgongs pa can gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di la dgongs pa can gang zhe na /
translated: What is the intention here?

original: tshor ba la dga' ba ni srid pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: tshor ba la dga' ba ni srid pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Delight in feeling is the cause of existence.

original: de yang len pa'i yin te rgyu'i rgyu la de'i len pa yin no zhes bstan te /
analyzed: de yang len pa'i yin te rgyu'i rgyu la de'i len pa yin no zhes bstan te /
translated: That is also grasping, and the cause of that is taught to be the cause of that grasping.

original: tshor ba la dga' ba mang ba rnams yid 'byung ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba la dga' ba mang ba rnams yid 'byung ba bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is in order to generate renunciation in those who delight excessively in feeling.

original: dper na bud med ni tshangs par spyod pa'i dri ma'o zhes bya ba bud med dri ma ma yin gyi bud med mthong na de la tshul ma yin pa'i mtshan ma bzung nas 'dod chags skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dper na bud med ni tshangs par spyod pa'i dri ma'o zhes bya ba bud med dri ma ma yin gyi bud med mthong na de la tshul ma yin pa'i mtshan ma bzung nas 'dod chags skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: A woman is not a stain, but when one sees a woman, one grasps the signs of her improper conduct and desire arises.

original: 'dod chags ni tshangs par spyod pa'i dri ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dod chags ni tshangs par spyod pa'i dri ma yin te /
translated: Desire is the stain of pure conduct.

original: des de la bar chad byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des de la bar chad byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it creates an obstacle to it.

original: dri ma brgyud pa'i rgyu yin pas bud med @45b la dri ma zhes nye bar gdags te /
analyzed: dri ma brgyud pa'i rgyu yin pas bud med @45b la dri ma zhes nye bar gdags te /
translated: Since it is the indirect cause of the stain, the woman is figuratively designated as the stain.🔽For example, it is said,

original: dper na / sangs rgyas rnams ni 'byung ba bde //
analyzed: dper na / sangs rgyas rnams ni 'byung ba bde //
translated: The appearance of the Buddhas is happiness.

original: chos bstan pa yang bde ba'o //🔽zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: chos bstan pa yang bde ba'o // zhes bya ba la sogs pa lta bu'o //
translated: The teaching of the Dharma is happiness.

original: 'o na ci'i phyir mdo sde gzhan las sred pa nyid kun 'byung ba'i bde bar gsungs she na /
analyzed: 'o na ci'i phyir mdo sde gzhan las sred pa nyid kun 'byung ba'i bde bar gsungs she na /
translated: If that is so, why is craving declared to be the origin in another sūtra?

original: las kyis 'phangs pa'i yang srid pa mngon par 'grub pa la sred pa rtsa ba yin pas rtsa ba bcad pa'i phyir de skad du gsungs so //
analyzed: las kyis 'phangs pa'i yang srid pa mngon par 'grub pa la sred pa rtsa ba yin pas rtsa ba bcad pa'i phyir de skad du gsungs so //
translated: Craving is the root of the actualization of rebirth projected by action.

original: yang na len pa dang lhan cig pa de la bstan te /
analyzed: yang na len pa dang lhan cig pa de la bstan te /
translated: Or it is taught in the context of that which is simultaneous with appropriation.🔽

original: yang 'byung ba'i sred pa dga' ba 'dod chags dang ldan pa de dang de la mngon par dga' bar byed do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang 'byung ba'i sred pa dga' ba 'dod chags dang ldan pa de dang de la mngon par dga' bar byed do zhes gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, it is taught in the sutra that craving for existence is associated with delight and attachment, and that it delights in this and that in association with the delight and attachment that accompany appropriation.

original: de la tha dad pa med par srid pa 'dod pa ni yang 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de la tha dad pa med par srid pa 'dod pa ni yang 'byung ba yin no //
translated: Craving for existence without distinction is existence.

original: thob pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa'i dga' ba dang 'dod chags gnyis 'dres pa'i phyir dga' ba 'dod chags dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: thob pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa'i dga' ba dang 'dod chags gnyis 'dres pa'i phyir dga' ba 'dod chags dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: It is associated with delight and attachment because it is a mixture of delight and attachment that focuses on the entity that has been obtained.

original: ma thob pa'i longs spyod sna tshogs dang / lus kyi dngos po sna tshogs de dang de la mngon par dga' bar byed do zhes bya ba yin no//
analyzed: ma thob pa'i longs spyod sna tshogs dang / lus kyi dngos po sna tshogs de dang de la mngon par dga' bar byed do zhes bya ba yin no//
translated: It delights in this and that in regard to the various objects of enjoyment that have not been obtained and the various entities of the body that have not been obtained.

original: thob pa dang ma thob pa'i lus kyi dngos po gnyis dang yul gnyis la de ltar sred pa rnam pa bzhi go rims bzhin rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor spyod pa dag go //
analyzed: thob pa dang ma thob pa'i lus kyi dngos po gnyis dang yul gnyis la de ltar sred pa rnam pa bzhi go rims bzhin rig par bya'o zhes bya ba ni rnal 'byor spyod pa dag go //
translated: The four types of craving in regard to the two types of body that have been obtained and that have not been obtained and in regard to the two objects should be understood in the same order.🔽This is the interpretation of the Yogācāras.

original: de bas na len pa'i mtshan nyid 'dun pa dang 'dod chags kyang 'dir 'dus pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na len pa'i mtshan nyid 'dun pa dang 'dod chags kyang 'dir 'dus pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the characteristics of grasping, i.e., desire and craving, are included in this verse.

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: As the Lord has said:

original: las ni zhing sred pa ni rlan /
analyzed: las ni zhing sred pa ni rlan /
translated: Karma is the field, craving is the moisture,

original: rnam par shes pa ni sa bon /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa ni sa bon /
translated: consciousness is the seed,

original: ma rig pa mun pa'i rnam pa ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa mun pa'i rnam pa ste /
translated: ignorance is the darkness.

original: sems can de dag gi ma rig pa mun par gyur pa ni sems pa dman pa la rnam par shes pa gnas pa yin te /
analyzed: sems can de dag gi ma rig pa mun par gyur pa ni sems pa dman pa la rnam par shes pa gnas pa yin te /
translated: The consciousness of those beings, which is the seed of the consciousness of the next existence, is placed in the inferior state of mind, which is the darkness of their ignorance.🔽This is the craving for existence.

original: 'di lta ste 'dod pa'i sred pa'o zhes rgyas par gsungs pa de dag mdo sde 'di la ji ltar rig par bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'di lta ste 'dod pa'i sred pa'o zhes rgyas par gsungs pa de dag mdo sde 'di la ji ltar rig par bya zhe na /
translated: How are these to be understood in this Sutra?

original: srid pa'i gnas skabs kyi las ni zhing yin no //
analyzed: srid pa'i gnas skabs kyi las ni zhing yin no //
translated: Karma is the field in the state of existence.

original: der nye bar 'gro ba'i len pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa ni sa bon yin no //
analyzed: der nye bar 'gro ba'i len pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa ni sa bon yin no //
translated: The seed is the consciousness with grasping that goes there.

original: len pa nyid rlan yin no //
analyzed: len pa nyid rlan yin no //
translated: Grasping is the moisture.

original: rnam pa de gsum ni yang srid pa'i myu gu skye ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: rnam pa de gsum ni yang srid pa'i myu gu skye ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: These three are the cause of the arising of the sprout of the next existence.

original: ma rig pa ni rlan mi zad pa'i rgyu yin par bstan pa'i phyir 'di'i nang nas 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: ma rig pa ni rlan mi zad pa'i rgyu yin par bstan pa'i phyir 'di'i nang nas 'byung ba yin te /
translated: Ignorance is the cause of the non-drying up of moisture. It is mentioned here because it is the cause of the non-drying up of moisture.

original: dper na lud kyis g-yogs pa'i sa bon la rlan mi skam pa yin no //
analyzed: dper na lud kyis g-yogs pa'i sa bon la rlan mi skam pa yin no //
translated: For example, a seed covered by manure does not dry up.

original: de bzhin du ma rig pa'i mun pa'i rnam pas rnam par shes pa'i sa bon g-yogs pa ni sred pa'i rlan mi skam pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du ma rig pa'i mun pa'i rnam pas rnam par shes pa'i sa bon g-yogs pa ni sred pa'i rlan mi skam pa yin no //
translated: In the same way, the seed of consciousness covered by the darkness of ignorance does not dry up with the moisture of craving.

original: ci'i phyir 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis las khon zhing du gsungs la /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyis las khon zhing du gsungs la /
translated: Why is action called a field here by the Blessed One?

original: gzhan las ni rnam @46a * //🔽grangs kyis rnam par shes pa'i gnas bzhi ste /
analyzed: gzhan las ni rnam @46a * // grangs kyis rnam par shes pa'i gnas bzhi ste /
translated: In other places, it is called a seed.

original: dge slong dag rnam par shes pa'i gnas bzhi zhes bya ba ni sa'i khams de'i tshig bla dags yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dge slong dag rnam par shes pa'i gnas bzhi zhes bya ba ni sa'i khams de'i tshig bla dags yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: In the sutra, it is said: “Monks, the four abodes of consciousness are called the earth element.”

original: yul gang la dga' ba dang 'dod chags ba ni len pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa rlan par byed do //
analyzed: yul gang la dga' ba dang 'dod chags ba ni len pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa rlan par byed do //
translated: The object of attachment is the moisture of consciousness with upādāna.

original: ming dang gzugs de ni de'i zhing yin par 'dir gsungs so //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs de ni de'i zhing yin par 'dir gsungs so //
translated: Name-and-form is said to be its field here.

original: las kyi srid pa la ma brten par ris mthun pa'i skal ba mnyam pa gzhan du rnam par shes pa skye bar mi 'gyur bas las ni zhing yin no //
analyzed: las kyi srid pa la ma brten par ris mthun pa'i skal ba mnyam pa gzhan du rnam par shes pa skye bar mi 'gyur bas las ni zhing yin no //
translated: Thus action is the field.

original: gal te len pa'i rkyen gyis las kyi sred pa las yang srid pa mngon par 'grub pa yin no //🔽gang mdo sde gzhan las skye ba'i rgyu ni las yin /
analyzed: gal te len pa'i rkyen gyis las kyi sred pa las yang srid pa mngon par 'grub pa yin no // gang mdo sde gzhan las skye ba'i rgyu ni las yin /
translated: If existence is established from the craving for action that has appropriation as its condition,🔽why is it said in another sūtra that action is the cause of birth and craving is the cause of existence?

original: mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu ni srid pa yin no zhes gsungs na 'di gnyis la tha dad du bya ba ci yod /
analyzed: mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu ni srid pa yin no zhes gsungs na 'di gnyis la tha dad du bya ba ci yod /
translated: What is the difference between these two?

original: ji ltar na las dang sred pa de gnyis rgyu yin zhe na /🔽sems can gyi ris de dang der ris 'dra bar 'gro ba'am /🔽gang yang las dang rjes su mthun par 'gro ba ni skye ba yin la /
analyzed: ji ltar na las dang sred pa de gnyis rgyu yin zhe na / sems can gyi ris de dang der ris 'dra bar 'gro ba'am / gang yang las dang rjes su mthun par 'gro ba ni skye ba yin la /
translated: How are action and craving causes?🔽The cause of birth is action, because sentient beings go to a certain realm,🔽or because they go to a certain realm in accordance with their action.

original: de'i rgyu ni las yin te las sna tshogs yin pa'i phyir dang / rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni las yin te las sna tshogs yin pa'i phyir dang / rnam par smin pa dang bcas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause of existence is craving, because craving is the cause of the establishment of existence.

original: ji skad du de bas ni bdag ni sems can rnams las ji lta ba bzhin du nye bar 'gro ba yin par smra'o zhes gsungs so //🔽de bzhin du de gal te bsod nams kyi 'du byed mngon par 'du byed pa rnam par shes pa bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba yin no zhes rgyas par 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du las ni sems can mthon po dang / dma' ba dang ngan pa dang /
analyzed: ji skad du de bas ni bdag ni sems can rnams las ji lta ba bzhin du nye bar 'gro ba yin par smra'o zhes gsungs so // de bzhin du de gal te bsod nams kyi 'du byed mngon par 'du byed pa rnam par shes pa bsod nams su nye bar 'gro ba yin no zhes rgyas par 'byung ba dang / de bzhin du las ni sems can mthon po dang / dma' ba dang ngan pa dang /
translated: Thus it is said, “Therefore I say that consciousness is the same way with respect to sentient beings.🔽” Similarly, “If one creates meritorious compositional activity, consciousness is reborn in a happy migratory state.🔽” And, “Karma is what distinguishes sentient beings as higher and lower, and bad and good.

original: gya nom pa rnam par 'byed pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gya nom pa rnam par 'byed pa yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: It is the thorough differentiation of the sublime.🔽🔽

original: tha dad pa med par sred pa ni mngon par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: tha dad pa med par sred pa ni mngon par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: Craving is the desire for non-separation.

original: mngon par 'grub pa ni 'grub pa yin no //🔽ris mthun pa'i skal ba dang 'dra ba thams cad du phung po gzhan 'byung ba tsam ste /
analyzed: mngon par 'grub pa ni 'grub pa yin no // ris mthun pa'i skal ba dang 'dra ba thams cad du phung po gzhan 'byung ba tsam ste /
translated: Actualization is establishment.

original: de'i rgyu ni sred pa yin no //
analyzed: de'i rgyu ni sred pa yin no //
translated: The mere arising of another set of aggregates in a similar class is the cause of craving.

original: lus tha dad pa med par chags shing phyis kyang yod par 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: lus tha dad pa med par chags shing phyis kyang yod par 'dod pa ste /
translated: Attachment to the body without differentiation and the desire for its existence later is the cause of craving.

original: de la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir dang rnam par smin pa med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de la tha dad pa med pa'i phyir dang rnam par smin pa med pa'i phyir te /
translated: because they are not different from it and because they are not its maturation.

original: 'di ltar de ni bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ltar de ni bsgribs la lung du ma bstan pa yin no //
translated: In fact, they are obscured non-defined.

original: dmigs kyis phye ba'i dngos po pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba yin no //🔽spyir 'jug pa ni gal te 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin na /
analyzed: dmigs kyis phye ba'i dngos po pa ni 'dod pa na spyod pa'i dge ba yin no // spyir 'jug pa ni gal te 'dod chags dang bral ba ma yin na /
translated: The specific case is that of the wholesome of the realm of desire.

original: gang du skyes pas de pa'i yin pa rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gang du skyes pas de pa'i yin pa rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The general case is that of the wholesome of the realm of fine-materiality and the realm of immateriality, for, if one is not detached, one is in possession of the wholesome of the stage where one is.

original: las med par ni lus sna tshogs par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: las med par ni lus sna tshogs par mi 'gyur la /
translated: The body is not diversified without action.

original: sred pa @46b med par ni mngon par grub pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sred pa @46b med par ni mngon par grub pa nyid du mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The body is not formed without craving.

original: dper na sa bon tha dad pa med par myu gu rnams tha dad pa dang / chu med par mngon par grub par mi 'gyur ba ni dpe yin no //
analyzed: dper na sa bon tha dad pa med par myu gu rnams tha dad pa dang / chu med par mngon par grub par mi 'gyur ba ni dpe yin no //
translated: For example, the sprouts are diversified without there being a diversity of seeds, but they are not formed without water.

original: yang dper na chus brlan pa'i 'jim pa las rgya'i 'bur 'byung gi skam po las ni ma yin no //
analyzed: yang dper na chus brlan pa'i 'jim pa las rgya'i 'bur 'byung gi skam po las ni ma yin no //
translated: For example, a mold is the cause of the shape of a clay pot, but not of a pot made of wood.

original: de yang brkos pa dang rjes su mthun pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang brkos pa dang rjes su mthun pa yin no //
translated: And the mold is in conformity with the shape of the pot.

original: de bzhin du sred pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa las yang srid 'byung ba yin gyi sred pa med pa las ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du sred pa dang bcas pa'i rnam par shes pa las yang srid 'byung ba yin gyi sred pa med pa las ma yin no //
translated: Likewise, a consciousness associated with craving produces a new existence, not one that is free from craving.

original: de yang las dang rjes su mthun pa zhes bya ba 'di yang dpe gzhan yin no //
analyzed: de yang las dang rjes su mthun pa zhes bya ba 'di yang dpe gzhan yin no //
translated: This is another example of the principle that karma ripens in accordance with the way it was created.

original: 'o na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'dir ci'i phyir sred pa dang srid pa gnyis kyi bar du len pa bcug ce na /
analyzed: 'o na rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba 'dir ci'i phyir sred pa dang srid pa gnyis kyi bar du len pa bcug ce na /
translated: Why is the link of grasping inserted between the links of craving and becoming?

original: de'i bye brag gis las bye brag tu srid pa yin par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bye brag gis las bye brag tu srid pa yin par 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: To show that becoming is distinguished by the type of karma that is generated by craving.

original: gang dag 'byung ba med par sred par byed pa de dag ni mngon par 'grub pa gang gi rgyu zhe na /
analyzed: gang dag 'byung ba med par sred par byed pa de dag ni mngon par 'grub pa gang gi rgyu zhe na /
translated: What is the cause of the manifestation of those who are reborn without craving?

original: de dag gi yang phung po la sred pa yod pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de dag gi yang phung po la sred pa yod pa kho na yin te /
translated: They too have craving for the aggregates,

original: bdag tu lta bar zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu lta bar zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are attached to the view of self.

original: gnam lcags kyi sgra la sogs pas skrag pa dang 'chi ba rnams kyang lus la mngon par dga' ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gnam lcags kyi sgra la sogs pas skrag pa dang 'chi ba rnams kyang lus la mngon par dga' ba'i phyir te /
translated: Those who are frightened by the sound of thunder and those who die suddenly also manifest attachment to the body.

original: de nyid de dag gi mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: de nyid de dag gi mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin no //
translated: and that is the cause of their actualization.

original: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la zhe sdang nas de lus rgyun chad par 'dod pa ni lus la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin yid 'byung bar yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi tshor ba la zhe sdang nas de lus rgyun chad par 'dod pa ni lus la yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin yid 'byung bar yongs su mi shes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When one is hostile to the sensation of suffering, one wishes to destroy the body, because one does not know how to become disgusted with the body as it truly is.

original: gzhan dag ni mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu ji ltar sred pa yin zhes bya ba la 'di ltar rtog par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan dag ni mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu ji ltar sred pa yin zhes bya ba la 'di ltar rtog par byed de /
translated: Others think that craving is the cause of actualization in the following way:

original: 'chi ka'i sems dang srid pa bar ma'i gzugs gnyis gcig tu tshogs par 'byung la /
analyzed: 'chi ka'i sems dang srid pa bar ma'i gzugs gnyis gcig tu tshogs par 'byung la /
translated: The two, the thought at death and the form of the intermediate being, occur together.

original: srid pa bar ma'i gzugs de la mngon par dga' nas de la sems 'jug par byed do //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma'i gzugs de la mngon par dga' nas de la sems 'jug par byed do //
translated: Craving for the form of the intermediate being, the mind enters it.

original: srid pa bar ma'i sems kyis kyang khrag dang khu ba la sogs pa phyi'i dngos po la cung zad mngon par dga' nas der skye ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: srid pa bar ma'i sems kyis kyang khrag dang khu ba la sogs pa phyi'i dngos po la cung zad mngon par dga' nas der skye ba yin no zhe na /
translated: The mind of the intermediate being also enters the external entity, blood and semen, etc., through a slight craving for it.

original: de ltar rnam par rtog pa thams cad rigs pa ma yin pa kho na yin te /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par rtog pa thams cad rigs pa ma yin pa kho na yin te /
translated: All of these conceptualizations are illogical.

original: re zhig gal te srid pa bar ma'i gzugs te sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa yin na ni sems can gcig la dus gcig tu bskal ba mi 'dra ba'i lus gnyis ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur /
analyzed: re zhig gal te srid pa bar ma'i gzugs te sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa yin na ni sems can gcig la dus gcig tu bskal ba mi 'dra ba'i lus gnyis ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur /
translated: If the form of the intermediate being is included in the number of sentient beings, then how could one sentient being have two different bodies at the same time?

original: rags pa dang phra ba dang / snang ba dang mi snang ba dang / 'gro ba gzhan dang 'gro ba gzhan gnyis kyang ji ltar rigs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: rags pa dang phra ba dang / snang ba dang mi snang ba dang / 'gro ba gzhan dang 'gro ba gzhan gnyis kyang ji ltar rigs par 'gyur te /
translated: How could it be tenable that the bodies of the intermediate beings of the other realms are gross or subtle, visible or invisible, and so on?

original: 'chi ka'i sems dang srid pa bar ma'i gzugs gnyis @47a * //
analyzed: 'chi ka'i sems dang srid pa bar ma'i gzugs gnyis @47a * //
translated: It is not tenable that the mind at death and the form of the intermediate being

original: gcig tu tshogs par 'thad pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gcig tu tshogs par 'thad pa ma yin no //
translated: are combined in one sentient being.

original: 'on te sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa ma yin na ni da srid pa bar ma nyid yin par mi rigs te /
analyzed: 'on te sems can gyi grangs su gtogs pa ma yin na ni da srid pa bar ma nyid yin par mi rigs te /
translated: If the form of the intermediate being is not included in the number of sentient beings, then it is not tenable that it is an intermediate being.

original: 'di ltar sems can gyi grangs su ma gtogs pa srid pa bar ma ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems can gyi grangs su ma gtogs pa srid pa bar ma ni yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because an intermediate being that is not included in the number of sentient beings does not exist.

original: 'chi ka'i sems de la mngon par dga' ba yang gal te sha'i mig gis mthong nas yin na ni de rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'chi ka'i sems de la mngon par dga' ba yang gal te sha'i mig gis mthong nas yin na ni de rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: If the mind at death sees the one to whom it is attracted with the fleshly eye, then that is not logical.

original: de'i tshe mig gi rnam par shes pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe mig gi rnam par shes pa mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because visual consciousness is impossible at that time.

original: srid pa bar ma'i gzugs kyang lha'i mig gi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srid pa bar ma'i gzugs kyang lha'i mig gi yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, the form of the intermediate being is the object of the divine eye.

original: 'on te rmi lam bzhin du yid kyis brtags pa yin na ni /
analyzed: 'on te rmi lam bzhin du yid kyis brtags pa yin na ni /
translated: But if it is imagined by the mental consciousness, like a dream,

original: de la srid pa bar ma do'i gzugs dgos pa ci zhig yod de /🔽skal pa mi 'dra ba'i sa pa gnyis yin na yang 'chi ka'i sems dang srid pa bar ma'i gzugs gnyis gang gis pa yin yang rung ste /
analyzed: de la srid pa bar ma do'i gzugs dgos pa ci zhig yod de / skal pa mi 'dra ba'i sa pa gnyis yin na yang 'chi ka'i sems dang srid pa bar ma'i gzugs gnyis gang gis pa yin yang rung ste /
translated: what need is there for the form of the intermediate being?

original: de la mngon par dga' bar byed pa mi rigs so //
analyzed: de la mngon par dga' bar byed pa mi rigs so //
translated: Even if two beings of different realms are similar, it is not reasonable that the mind of death and the form of the intermediate being of one would delight in the other.🔽Also, when the form of the intermediate being ceases, the intermediate being does not exist.

original: gzugs mid pa na yang srid pa bar ma nyid yod pa ma yin pas der ji lta ba bzhin du gzhan du yang mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu srid pa yin par ci ste mi 'dod /
analyzed: gzugs mid pa na yang srid pa bar ma nyid yod pa ma yin pas der ji lta ba bzhin du gzhan du yang mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu srid pa yin par ci ste mi 'dod /
translated: Why not accept that the cause for the formation of another intermediate being exists just as it does in the previous case?

original: de ltar na rtog pa de dag thams cad mi rigs pa kho na yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na rtog pa de dag thams cad mi rigs pa kho na yin no //
translated: Thus all these theories are unreasonable.

original: de dag thams cad kyi lus la sred pa ma spangs pa ni sa de las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba rnams de mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba skyon med pa yin no //
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyi lus la sred pa ma spangs pa ni sa de las 'dod chags dang ma bral ba rnams de mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin no zhes bya ba skyon med pa yin no //
translated: The body of all of them is the cause for the nonabandonment of craving for the body, and it is the cause for the nonseparation from attachment to that level.

original: ji ltar ma spangs pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar ma spangs pa yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that they have not abandoned craving?

original: de'i phra rgyas ma bcom pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: de'i phra rgyas ma bcom pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Because their negative tendencies have not been destroyed,

original: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis nyams ma smad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i lam gyis nyams ma smad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: or because they have not been reduced by the mundane path.🔽Well then, how can the Bhagavån say:

original: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyis gang 'di skad du gang zhig skye ba'i kun tu sbyor ba ni spangs la mngon par 'grub pa'i kun tu sbyor ba ma yin pa'i gang zag ni yod de /
analyzed: 'o na bcom ldan 'das kyis gang 'di skad du gang zhig skye ba'i kun tu sbyor ba ni spangs la mngon par 'grub pa'i kun tu sbyor ba ma yin pa'i gang zag ni yod de /
translated: There are persons who have abandoned the fetter of birth but not the fetter of actualization.🔽There are four alternatives.

original: mu bzhi'o zhes gsungs pa de la skye ba ni gang yin /
analyzed: mu bzhi'o zhes gsungs pa de la skye ba ni gang yin /
translated: What is birth?

original: mngon par 'grub pa yang gang yin /
analyzed: mngon par 'grub pa yang gang yin /
translated: What is actualization?

original: de gnyis kyi kun tu sbyor ba yang gang yin /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi kun tu sbyor ba yang gang yin /
translated: What is the fetter of both?

original: gcig spangs pa gang gi yin /🔽gnyis pa gang gi yin /
analyzed: gcig spangs pa gang gi yin / gnyis pa gang gi yin /
translated: What is the abandonment of one?🔽What is the abandonment of the other?

original: gnyis ka spangs pa gang gi yin /
analyzed: gnyis ka spangs pa gang gi yin /
translated: What is the abandonment of both?

original: gnyis ka ma yin pa gang gi yin zhe na /
analyzed: gnyis ka ma yin pa gang gi yin zhe na /
translated: What is the fetter of the two?

original: de la 'di skad du brjod de /
analyzed: de la 'di skad du brjod de /
translated: The answer is:

original: skye ba ni skye ba'i srid pa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba ni skye ba'i srid pa yin no //
translated: Birth is the existence at birth.

original: mngon par 'grub pa ni srid pa bar ma yin te de la mngon du phogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon par 'grub pa ni srid pa bar ma yin te de la mngon du phogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Manifestation is the intermediate existence, because it is directed toward that.

original: de gnyis la nyon mongs pa gang gis sbyor ba de ni de gnyis kyi kun tu sbyor ba yin no //
analyzed: de gnyis la nyon mongs pa gang gis sbyor ba de ni de gnyis kyi kun tu sbyor ba yin no //
translated: The fetter of the two is the passion that binds one to those two.

original: srid pa bar mar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gang yin pa de ni skye ba'i kun tu sbyor ba spangs pa yin no //🔽de yang gang @47b gis skye bar kun tu sbyor ba de ni 'di'i so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa'i tshul du 'gags te dbang po rnams yongs su smin pa yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: srid pa bar mar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' ba gang yin pa de ni skye ba'i kun tu sbyor ba spangs pa yin no // de yang gang @47b gis skye bar kun tu sbyor ba de ni 'di'i so sor ma brtags pas 'gog pa'i tshul du 'gags te dbang po rnams yongs su smin pa yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: One who attains nirvana in the intermediate existence has abandoned the fetter of birth.🔽That is stopped for him in the manner of non-analytical cessation, because his faculties have matured.

original: sred pa bar ma nyid de'i gnyen po nges par skye bar 'gyur ba nyid kyi tshul du rgyun gnas pas na spangs pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: sred pa bar ma nyid de'i gnyen po nges par skye bar 'gyur ba nyid kyi tshul du rgyun gnas pas na spangs pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Since craving is the antidote to that intermediate existence, it is said to be abandoned because it is established in the manner of definitely arising.

original: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yongs de pa'i nyon mongs pa srid pa bar ma par gtogs pa yang rung /🔽skye bar gtogs pa yang rung thams cad cig car 'thob bo //
analyzed: so sor brtags pas 'gog pa yongs de pa'i nyon mongs pa srid pa bar ma par gtogs pa yang rung / skye bar gtogs pa yang rung thams cad cig car 'thob bo //
translated: The noble ones who are detached from the realm of immateriality obtain the cessation due to deliberation of the defilements of the realm of immateriality.🔽The noble ones who are detached from the realm of desire obtain the cessation due to deliberation of the fetters of the realm of desire which are abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: gzugs la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'phags pa gang yin pa des ni mngon par 'grub pa'i kun du sbyor ba spangs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzugs la 'dod chags dang bral ba'i 'phags pa gang yin pa des ni mngon par 'grub pa'i kun du sbyor ba spangs pa yin no //
translated: The noble ones who are detached from the realm of fine-materiality obtain the cessation due to deliberation of the fetters of the realm of fine-materiality which are abandoned by the path of cultivation.🔽The noble ones who are detached from the realm of immateriality obtain the cessation due to deliberation of the fetters of the realm of immateriality which are abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: khams gsum la 'dod chags dang bral ba gang yin pa des ni de gnyis ka spangs pa yin no //🔽de las gzhan gyis na gnyis ka ma spangs so //
analyzed: khams gsum la 'dod chags dang bral ba gang yin pa des ni de gnyis ka spangs pa yin no // de las gzhan gyis na gnyis ka ma spangs so //
translated: The noble ones who are detached from the three realms obtain the cessation due to deliberation of the fetters of the three realms which are abandoned by the path of cultivation.🔽The noble ones who are not detached from the three realms do not obtain the cessation due to deliberation of the fetters of the three realms which are abandoned by the path of cultivation.

original: 'o na gang las sred pa ni mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin no zhes gsungs pa der yang ci'i phyir srid pa bar ma kho na mngon par 'grub pa yin par mi 'dod ce na /
analyzed: 'o na gang las sred pa ni mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin no zhes gsungs pa der yang ci'i phyir srid pa bar ma kho na mngon par 'grub pa yin par mi 'dod ce na /
translated: But, in the Sūtra, craving is said to be the origin of unsatisfactoriness. Why is the intermediate existence not considered to be the origin?

original: de lta yin na ni srid pa bar ma'i rgyu srid pa kho na yin par 'gyur gyi las ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta yin na ni srid pa bar ma'i rgyu srid pa kho na yin par 'gyur gyi las ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If the intermediate existence were the origin, the cause of the existence would be the existence itself and not action.

original: dmyal ba la sogs pa'i srid pa bar ma tha dad pa ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur /
analyzed: dmyal ba la sogs pa'i srid pa bar ma tha dad pa ji ltar 'thad par 'gyur /
translated: How could the intermediate existence of hell beings and so on be tenable?

original: skye ba'i rgyu yang las nyid yin par 'gyur gyi srid pa ni ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i rgyu yang las nyid yin par 'gyur gyi srid pa ni ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: Karma would be the cause of birth, not existence.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba yang gzugs med par skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba yang gzugs med par skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Those free from attachment would be born in the formless realm.

original: srid pa bar mar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: srid pa bar mar yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: One would not attain nirvana in the intermediate existence,

original: skye ba'i rgyu las tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba'i rgyu las tsam yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the cause of birth would be karma alone.

original: de bas ni thams cad ni srid pa bar ma mngon par 'grub pa kho na yin par 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas ni thams cad ni srid pa bar ma mngon par 'grub pa kho na yin par 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, not all beings are said to actualize an intermediate existence.

original: gzhan dag na re khrag dang khu bas grogs byed pa'i las ni 'dir srid pa yin par bsams so zhe na /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re khrag dang khu bas grogs byed pa'i las ni 'dir srid pa yin par bsams so zhe na /
translated: Others say: Existence is the karma that assists blood and semen.

original: de ni 'du byed la yang de dag thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ni 'du byed la yang de dag thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But that would also apply to formations.

original: srid pa ni gsum ste zhes bya ba 'dir gnyis la 'di'i don ni mi 'thad pa yin no //
analyzed: srid pa ni gsum ste zhes bya ba 'dir gnyis la 'di'i don ni mi 'thad pa yin no //
translated: In the passage, “Existence is threefold,” the meaning of this is untenable.

original: 'dod pa'i srid par yang rdzus te 'byung ba rnams la'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i srid par yang rdzus te 'byung ba rnams la'o //
translated: and also for those who are born spontaneously in the realm of desire.

original: 'dir rang gi rgyud la yod pa rkyen du ston pa yin gyi gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa khrag dang khu ba de ni 'dir gzhug par mi rigs so //
analyzed: 'dir rang gi rgyud la yod pa rkyen du ston pa yin gyi gzhan gyi rgyud la yod pa khrag dang khu ba de ni 'dir gzhug par mi rigs so //
translated: Here, the cause is indicated as being in one’s own continuum, but it is not proper to include the blood and semen of another’s continuum.

original: ji ltar na der len pa rkyen gyi dngos po yin /
analyzed: ji ltar na der len pa rkyen gyi dngos po yin /
translated: How can the appropriating aggregates be the condition for the self?

original: gzhan yang 'dir khungs brjod par bya dgos so //🔽rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba bshad pa las srid pa rnam par dbye ba'o /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'dir khungs brjod par bya dgos so // rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba bshad pa las srid pa rnam par dbye ba'o /
translated: Moreover, the source of this should be stated.🔽This concludes the analysis of existence in the explanation of dependent origination.

original: // / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang po dang rnam par dbye ba bshad pa /
analyzed: // / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang po dang rnam par dbye ba bshad pa /
translated: The first and its analysis

original: bam po bzhi pa ste tha ma /
analyzed: bam po bzhi pa ste tha ma /
translated: The fourth and final chapter

original: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba zhes bya @48a * //
analyzed: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba zhes bya @48a * //
translated: The condition of existence is said to be birth.

original: ba'i skye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: ba'i skye ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is birth?

original: gang sems can de dang de dag gi zhes rgyas par 'byung ba de dag gi ni gang dag gi dang gang du dang skye ba'i mtshan nyid ji ltar yin pa de bstan to //
analyzed: gang sems can de dang de dag gi zhes rgyas par 'byung ba de dag gi ni gang dag gi dang gang du dang skye ba'i mtshan nyid ji ltar yin pa de bstan to //
translated: It is said that for those sentient beings, and so on, it is the arising of the aggregates, and so on, of those, where, and in what manner they are born.

original: de dang de dag gi zhes bya ba ni khams dang 'gro ba dang skye gnas dang gnas dang / lus kyi dngos po dbye ba tha dad pa'i sems can rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de dang de dag gi zhes bya ba ni khams dang 'gro ba dang skye gnas dang gnas dang / lus kyi dngos po dbye ba tha dad pa'i sems can rnams kyi'o //
translated: “Those” refers to the different kinds of sentient beings who are distinguished by their realms, destinies, birth processes, abodes, and bodies.

original: ming dang gzugs de 'brel ba ni sems can zhes bya ste /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs de 'brel ba ni sems can zhes bya ste /
translated: The connection of name-and-form is called a sentient being.

original: chags pa'i dbang gis 'brel ba'i rgyun gnas pas zhes bya ba ni nges tshig yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chags pa'i dbang gis 'brel ba'i rgyun gnas pas zhes bya ba ni nges tshig yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The derivation of the term is as follows: the connection is called a continuum because it is connected by the power of attachment and it endures.

original: 'brel ba'i rgyun zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na /
analyzed: 'brel ba'i rgyun zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na /
translated: What is this thing called a continuum?🔽A continuum is a connection of cause and effect.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'brel ba'i rgyun ni 'brel ba'i rgyun zhes bya ste /🔽'dir rgyun ni breng chags pa la bya bar 'dod do //
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'brel ba'i rgyun ni 'brel ba'i rgyun zhes bya ste / 'dir rgyun ni breng chags pa la bya bar 'dod do //
translated: Here, a continuum is a series.

original: de yang rgyun ma chad pa'o //
analyzed: de yang rgyun ma chad pa'o //
translated: It is also an uninterrupted series.

original: sems can gyi ris de dang der zhes bya ba ni gang zhig gang dang 'dra ba'i sems can gyi tshogs la bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi ris de dang der zhes bya ba ni gang zhig gang dang 'dra ba'i sems can gyi tshogs la bya'o //
translated: “In that and that class of sentient beings” means in that and that group of sentient beings that are similar.

original: skye ba dang shin tu skye ba zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni rjes su mthun par rnam par 'chad pa ni /
analyzed: skye ba dang shin tu skye ba zhes rgyas par 'byung ba ni rjes su mthun par rnam par 'chad pa ni /
translated: “Birth, rebirth, and becoming” are explained in detail in accordance with the following passage from the sutras:

original: skye ba'i rnam grangs yin te /
analyzed: skye ba'i rnam grangs yin te /
translated: This is another way of explaining the members of dependent origination.

original: rnam grangs gzhan gyis bstan pa rigs pa yin no //🔽gang yang skye ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam grangs gzhan gyis bstan pa rigs pa yin no // gang yang skye ba gang zhe na /
translated: It is proper to teach them in another way.🔽But what is the meaning of the statement, “What is birth? It is birth itself”?

original: gang skye ba'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lugs 'di ni sngon ma byung ngo zhe na /
analyzed: gang skye ba'o zhes bya ba'i tshig gi lugs 'di ni sngon ma byung ngo zhe na /
translated: This statement is not a new formulation.

original: 'di sngon ma byung ba ma yin gyi /🔽de dag sngon byung ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di sngon ma byung ba ma yin gyi / de dag sngon byung ba yin te /
translated: It is not new, but it is a repetition.

original: blo snga ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: blo snga ba'i phyir te /
translated: It is a repetition because the meaning is the same.

original: de bzhin du gzhan rnams kyi yang don la khyad par med par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan rnams kyi yang don la khyad par med par bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The meaning is the same because the meaning of the members of dependent origination is taught in another way, in order to show that the members of dependent origination are not only twelve.

original: gnas skabs kyi bye brag ston pa'i don ni rnam grangs gzhan yin te /
analyzed: gnas skabs kyi bye brag ston pa'i don ni rnam grangs gzhan yin te /
translated: The meaning of the members of dependent origination is taught in another way in order to show the difference in their states.

original: ji ltar 'phangs pa bzhin du ming dang gzugs la sogs pa mtha' tshor ba la thug pa'i bar gyi dngos po 'byung ba ni skye ba yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phangs pa bzhin du ming dang gzugs la sogs pa mtha' tshor ba la thug pa'i bar gyi dngos po 'byung ba ni skye ba yin te /
translated: The arising of the entity of name/form, etc., up to the arising of the entity of feeling, which occurs in accordance with the projection of consciousness, is birth.

original: de'i tshe sems can gyi ris skal ba 'dra ba der skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe sems can gyi ris skal ba 'dra ba der skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: At that time, the sentient being is born in a class of sentient beings that has a similar share of the result.

original: skyes nas ni ming dang gzugs yongs su rdzogs pa ni shin tu skye ba yin no //
analyzed: skyes nas ni ming dang gzugs yongs su rdzogs pa ni shin tu skye ba yin no //
translated: The complete development of name/form after birth is called “birth.”

original: ming dang gzugs kun da rdzogs pa dbang po ma tshang ba med pa'i gnas skabs su 'gro ba ni 'phos pa'o //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs kun da rdzogs pa dbang po ma tshang ba med pa'i gnas skabs su 'gro ba ni 'phos pa'o //
translated: The name-and-form that has reached completion and is in the state of having all the faculties without deficiency is “transference.”

original: 'phos nas skye mched drug ma'i mngal nas byung ste /
analyzed: 'phos nas skye mched drug ma'i mngal nas byung ste /
translated: Having transferred, it is the six sense bases that emerge from the womb.

original: yul la dmigs par mngon du phyogs pas 'jug pa ni mngon par 'byung ba yin te /
analyzed: yul la dmigs par mngon du phyogs pas 'jug pa ni mngon par 'byung ba yin te /
translated: The engagement that is directed toward the object is “manifestation,”

original: mngal gyi sgo nas 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: mngal gyi sgo nas 'byung ba yin no //
translated: because it emerges from the womb.

original: btsas phyin chad 'dug pa ni rab tu byung ba yin no //
analyzed: btsas phyin chad 'dug pa ni rab tu byung ba yin no //
translated: After birth, it is “fully manifest” when it is sitting up.

original: de ltar na srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba zhes bya ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i skye bas bsdus pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba zhes bya ba yongs su rdzogs pa'i skye bas bsdus pa yin no //
translated: Thus, “conditioned by becoming, birth occurs” is included in the completed birth.

original: sngar ji ltar 'phangs pa bzhin ming dang gzugs nas tshor ba la thug pa'i bar 'di ni skye ba'i gnas skabs tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid @48b yin no //
analyzed: sngar ji ltar 'phangs pa bzhin ming dang gzugs nas tshor ba la thug pa'i bar 'di ni skye ba'i gnas skabs tha dad pa'i mtshan nyid @48b yin no //
translated: As previously projected, this name-and-form up to feeling is the characteristic of the different stages of birth.

original: skye ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni sems can rnams kyi bdag gi dngos po thob pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni sems can rnams kyi bdag gi dngos po thob pa'o //
translated: The intrinsic characteristic of birth is the acquisition of one’s own individual existence as a sentient being.

original: bdag gi dngos po thob pa de ston pa ni phung po so sor thob pa dang / khams so sor thob pa dang / skye mched so sor thob pa dang zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: bdag gi dngos po thob pa de ston pa ni phung po so sor thob pa dang / khams so sor thob pa dang / skye mched so sor thob pa dang zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: The phrase “the attainment of the individual self” refers to the attainment of the aggregates, the attainment of the elements, and the attainment of the sense bases.

original: de lta na sems can rnams kyi bdag nyid rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: de lta na sems can rnams kyi bdag nyid rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Thus, there are three types of self-existence for sentient beings.

original: phung po la sogs pa'i rgyun la sems can du 'du shes shing mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa'i rgyun la sems can du 'du shes shing mngon par zhen pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason for this is that sentient beings conceive of and cling to the continuity of the aggregates, etc., as a sentient being.
