original: gsum smos pa ni gcig pu dang lus can dang / yul la dmigs par byed pa yang bdag go zhes bdag tu rtog pa rnam pa gsum bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gsum smos pa ni gcig pu dang lus can dang / yul la dmigs par byed pa yang bdag go zhes bdag tu rtog pa rnam pa gsum bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason for mentioning three is to eliminate three types of speculation about the self: the self is one, the self is embodied, and the self is the object of the notion of “I.”

original: spungs pa'i don ni phung po'i don yin pas phung po smos pa ni bdag gcig pu rtog pa bstsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spungs pa'i don ni phung po'i don yin pas phung po smos pa ni bdag gcig pu rtog pa bstsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason for mentioning the aggregates is to eliminate the speculation that the self is a unity, since the meaning of “aggregate” is “a heap.”

original: chos tsam srog ni khams so zhes bya ba nges tshig yin pa'i phyir khams smos pa ni lus can bdag yin par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos tsam srog ni khams so zhes bya ba nges tshig yin pa'i phyir khams smos pa ni lus can bdag yin par rtog pa bsal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The reason for mentioning the elements is to eliminate the speculation that the self is embodied, since the term “element” is defined as “that which is the life of mere entities.”

original: mig la sogs pa yul la dmigs par byed pa ni skye mched rnams yin gyi /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa yul la dmigs par byed pa ni skye mched rnams yin gyi /
translated: The sense bases are the eyes, etc., which are the supports for the objects.

original: dmigs par byed pa'i bdag ni gang yang yod pa ma yin pas skye mched smos pa ni bdag tu rtog pa gsum pa bsal pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs par byed pa'i bdag ni gang yang yod pa ma yin pas skye mched smos pa ni bdag tu rtog pa gsum pa bsal pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since there is no self at all that is the support for the objects, the sense bases are mentioned in order to eliminate the third misconception of a self.

original: de ltar gnas skabs dang bcas pa'i skye ba'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa rgyas par bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar gnas skabs dang bcas pa'i skye ba'i mtshan nyid tha dad pa rgyas par bstan nas /
translated: Having thus extensively taught the characteristics of birth together with its states,

original: yang mdor ston pa ni phung po rnams mngon par 'grub pa dang srog gi dbang po rab tu skyes pa zhes bya ba yin no ;
analyzed: yang mdor ston pa ni phung po rnams mngon par 'grub pa dang srog gi dbang po rab tu skyes pa zhes bya ba yin no ;
translated: he again summarizes them in the statement: “The aggregates are actualized and the life faculty arises.”

original: / de ltar byas na drod gsher las skyes pa dang / rdzus te byung ba'i sems can rnams kyi skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyang bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: / de ltar byas na drod gsher las skyes pa dang / rdzus te byung ba'i sems can rnams kyi skye ba'i mtshan nyid kyang bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the characteristics of birth of sentient beings born from heat and moisture and of those born supernaturally are also taught.

original: de la gsar du byung ba ni mngon par grub pa yin no //
analyzed: de la gsar du byung ba ni mngon par grub pa yin no //
translated: In this context, “actualized” means newly arisen.

original: srog gi dbang po ni sems can rnams kyi sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa skal pa 'dra ba'i rgyun 'brel bar bya ba la nus pa yod pa gang gis ris mthun pa der mngon par byung ste /
analyzed: srog gi dbang po ni sems can rnams kyi sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa skal pa 'dra ba'i rgyun 'brel bar bya ba la nus pa yod pa gang gis ris mthun pa der mngon par byung ste /
translated: The faculty of life force has the power to maintain the continuum of similar types of sentient beings projected by their former karma.

original: phung po'i rgyun 'jug cing gnas pa ste /
analyzed: phung po'i rgyun 'jug cing gnas pa ste /
translated: It causes the continuum of aggregates to continue and remain.

original: gnas pa de yang srog ces bya'o //
analyzed: gnas pa de yang srog ces bya'o //
translated: That remaining is called life force.

original: de ltar na mdor na ris mthun par mtshams sbyar nas rgyun dang bcas pa ni skye ba yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na mdor na ris mthun par mtshams sbyar nas rgyun dang bcas pa ni skye ba yin no zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: Thus in brief, it teaches that birth is the connection to a homogeneous existence and the continuum that follows.

original: skye ba rnam pa lnga'i nang nas dang po'i skye ba ni re zhig srid pa'i rkyen gyis yin par rigs na de'i 'og ma dag ni 'og ma 'og ma rkyen yin na ji ltar srid pa'i rkyen gyis yin zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba rnam pa lnga'i nang nas dang po'i skye ba ni re zhig srid pa'i rkyen gyis yin par rigs na de'i 'og ma dag ni 'og ma 'og ma rkyen yin na ji ltar srid pa'i rkyen gyis yin zhes bya zhe na /
translated: From among the five types of birth, it is reasonable that the first birth is conditioned by existence, but how can the others be conditioned by existence since the latter are conditioned by the former?

original: srid pas ni skye ba dang po la de'i ngo bo'i nus pa yod par byas nas de'i bye brag las gnas skabs gzhan lhag ma rnams kyang 'og ma 'og ma rkyen nyid du gyur pa yin te /🔽de rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir @49a * //
analyzed: srid pas ni skye ba dang po la de'i ngo bo'i nus pa yod par byas nas de'i bye brag las gnas skabs gzhan lhag ma rnams kyang 'og ma 'og ma rkyen nyid du gyur pa yin te / de rtsa ba yin pa'i phyir @49a * //
translated: Existence makes the potential for that nature exist in the first birth, and the remaining other states are its particulars, which are the conditions for the subsequent births.

original: srid pa'i rkyen gyis yin no zhes bstan to //
analyzed: srid pa'i rkyen gyis yin no zhes bstan to //
translated: Because that is the root, it is taught that the condition for birth is existence.🔽The Sutra Differentiating the Middle and Extremes declares:

original: dang po'i bye brag rnam par 'byed pa'i mdo sde las kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis de ltar dge slong dag rnam pa bzhi'i mtshan nyid kyi skye ba ni rim pa gang gis skye ba dang / gang skye ba dang ji ltar skye ba de ni 'di'i skye ba'i mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: dang po'i bye brag rnam par 'byed pa'i mdo sde las kyang bcom ldan 'das kyis de ltar dge slong dag rnam pa bzhi'i mtshan nyid kyi skye ba ni rim pa gang gis skye ba dang / gang skye ba dang ji ltar skye ba de ni 'di'i skye ba'i mtshan nyid yin par rig par bya'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: “Bhagavat, the birth of the four types of characteristics is the characteristic of birth. The order in which it is born, that which is born and how it is born should be understood as the characteristic of its birth.”

original: rnam pa bzhi'i mtshan nyid ni ji ltar 'phangs pa'i ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang tshor ba'i mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rnam pa bzhi'i mtshan nyid ni ji ltar 'phangs pa'i ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang tshor ba'i mtshan nyid do //
translated: The four types of characteristics are the characteristics of name and form, the six sense bases, contact and feeling that are projected.

original: rim pa gang gis skye ba ni sa bon btab pa'i skye ba dang / de'i 'og tu de'i 'phel ba'i skye ba dang / de'i 'og tu bcas pa'i skye ba dang / de'i 'og tu 'phel ba'i skye ba dang / 'phel nas longs spyod pa dang /
analyzed: rim pa gang gis skye ba ni sa bon btab pa'i skye ba dang / de'i 'og tu de'i 'phel ba'i skye ba dang / de'i 'og tu bcas pa'i skye ba dang / de'i 'og tu 'phel ba'i skye ba dang / 'phel nas longs spyod pa dang /
translated: The stages of birth are: the birth of the seed, the birth of its growth, the birth of its completion, the birth of its development, the birth of its enjoyment, and the birth of its conventional designation.

original: tha snyad nus pa thob pa'i skye ba ste rim pa 'dis skye ba yin no //
analyzed: tha snyad nus pa thob pa'i skye ba ste rim pa 'dis skye ba yin no //
translated: Birth is by these stages.

original: skye ba yang gang zhe na /
analyzed: skye ba yang gang zhe na /
translated: What is birth?

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams skye ba yin gyi bdag ma yin no //
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched rnams skye ba yin gyi bdag ma yin no //
translated: The birth of the aggregates, elements, and sense bases, not the birth of a self.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: phung po la sogs pa 'phel bar 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po la sogs pa 'phel bar 'gro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the aggregates, etc., are subject to growth.

original: mi rtag pa dang srog gi dbang po'i dbang gis dang / dus dpag tu yod par gnas pa'i chos nyid yin pa'i yang phyir /
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang srog gi dbang po'i dbang gis dang / dus dpag tu yod par gnas pa'i chos nyid yin pa'i yang phyir /
translated: Because they are impermanent, because they are subject to the life faculty, and because they are subject to the law of duration for a limited time.

original: mi rtag pa skye ba nyid skye ba yin no //
analyzed: mi rtag pa skye ba nyid skye ba yin no //
translated: Impermanence is the birth of birth.

original: de ltar bshad pa ni go rims bzhin du skye ba'i rnam grangs bcu yin par brjod do //
analyzed: de ltar bshad pa ni go rims bzhin du skye ba'i rnam grangs bcu yin par brjod do //
translated: These explanations are said to be the ten synonyms of birth.

original: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba zhes bya ba 'dir rkyen dang rkyen can gnyis nges pa dang ma nges pa la skyon yod de /
analyzed: srid pa'i rkyen gyis skye ba zhes bya ba 'dir rkyen dang rkyen can gnyis nges pa dang ma nges pa la skyon yod de /
translated: In the statement “Birth occurs due to the condition of existence,” there is a problem if the condition and that which possesses the condition are either definitely or not definitely one.

original: gal te srid pa kho na skye ba'i rkyen yin na ni gnas gsum tshogs pas ma'i mngal du bu chags par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba'i mdo sde spangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te srid pa kho na skye ba'i rkyen yin na ni gnas gsum tshogs pas ma'i mngal du bu chags par 'gyur ro zhes 'byung ba'i mdo sde spangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: If existence alone is the condition of birth, then the sutra that states “A son is conceived in the mother’s womb through the union of three factors” would be rejected.

original: 'on te skye ba kho na rkyen yin na ni srid par gyur pa'i las ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyu dang rkyen ma yin par 'gyur ba dang / de la dmigs pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i dmigs pa'i rkyen ma yin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te skye ba kho na rkyen yin na ni srid par gyur pa'i las ni rgyu mthun pa'i 'bras bu'i rgyu dang rkyen ma yin par 'gyur ba dang / de la dmigs pa'i sems dang sems las byung ba'i dmigs pa'i rkyen ma yin par 'gyur ro //
translated: If birth alone is the condition, then karma that produces existence would not be the cause and condition of the result that is natural outflow, and the mind and mental factors that focus on that would not be objective conditions.

original: 'on te gnyis ka nges pa yin na ni skyon rnam pa gnyis yod do //
analyzed: 'on te gnyis ka nges pa yin na ni skyon rnam pa gnyis yod do //
translated: If both are definite, then there are two faults.🔽If they are not definite, then the explanation is meaningless.

original: 'on te ma nges pa yin na ni bshad pa don med par 'gyur ro zhe na don med par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on te ma nges pa yin na ni bshad pa don med par 'gyur ro zhe na don med par mi 'gyur te /
translated: It is not meaningless,

original: rkyen gtso bo 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rkyen gtso bo 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it explains the principal condition.

original: srid pa ni rkyen gtso bo nyid yin te /
analyzed: srid pa ni rkyen gtso bo nyid yin te /
translated: Existence is the principal condition of birth,

original: de med par skye ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de med par skye ba mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because birth is impossible without it.

original: dri za yang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dri za yang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: The gandharva also does not exist.

original: gnas rnam pa gsum med pa yang drod gsher las skye ba dang / rdzus te skye ba rnams dang / gzugs med pa rnams su ji ltar rigs par skye ba yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: gnas rnam pa gsum med pa yang drod gsher las skye ba dang / rdzus te skye ba rnams dang / gzugs med pa rnams su ji ltar rigs par skye ba yod pa nyid do //
translated: But birth is possible for those born from heat and moisture and for the miraculously born, and for those in the formless realm, even though the three stages of embryonic development do not exist.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bshad pa las @49b skye ba rnam par 'byed pa'o //🔽skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya ba'i rga ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bshad pa las @49b skye ba rnam par 'byed pa'o // skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya ba'i rga ba gang zhe na /
translated: This concludes the section on the analysis of birth in the explanation of dependent origination.🔽What is aging?🔽The eighteen characteristics of aging are the seven types of degeneration, as stated in the sutra:🔽What is aging? It is the degeneration, coarsening,

original: gang de'i spyi cer dang / skra dkar dang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba'i tshig rnam pa bco brgyad kyis yongs su 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bdun ni yongs su nyams pa'i rgas pa yin par bstan to //
analyzed: gang de'i spyi cer dang / skra dkar dang zhes rgyas par 'byung ba'i tshig rnam pa bco brgyad kyis yongs su 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bdun ni yongs su nyams pa'i rgas pa yin par bstan to //
translated: breaking, bending, graying, and wrinkling of the body, and the degeneration of life,🔽heat, and faculties.

original: gzugs yongs su 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid ni skra byi zhing skra mdog 'gyur ba dang / pags pa 'khums pa dang mdangs yongs su nyams pa dang / sha lhod pa dang / dpe dang bcas pa'i lus kyi dbyibs yongs su gyur ba dang mdog 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: gzugs yongs su 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid ni skra byi zhing skra mdog 'gyur ba dang / pags pa 'khums pa dang mdangs yongs su nyams pa dang / sha lhod pa dang / dpe dang bcas pa'i lus kyi dbyibs yongs su gyur ba dang mdog 'gyur bas so //
translated: The characteristic of the transformation of form is the falling out and greying of hair, the wrinkling and discoloration of skin, the flabbiness of flesh, and the change in bodily shape and complexion.

original: stobs yongs su 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid ni sgra dang bcas shing shin tu dbugs rgod pa dang / 'greng ba dang 'gro ba'i gnas skabs gnyis na 'bub pa ltar mngon du phyogs pa'o //
analyzed: stobs yongs su 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid ni sgra dang bcas shing shin tu dbugs rgod pa dang / 'greng ba dang 'gro ba'i gnas skabs gnyis na 'bub pa ltar mngon du phyogs pa'o //
translated: The characteristic of the transformation of strength is the loss of strength, so that one is obliged to rise and sit again and again, even when only conversing.

original: shes rab rnam par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid ni blun pa nyid kyis yin te /
analyzed: shes rab rnam par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid ni blun pa nyid kyis yin te /
translated: The characteristic of the transformation of wisdom is stupidity.

original: legs par bshad pa dang / nyes par bshad pa'i chos rnams kyi don dang / bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa shes pa'i stobs med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: legs par bshad pa dang / nyes par bshad pa'i chos rnams kyi don dang / bya ba dang bya ba ma yin pa shes pa'i stobs med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One is unable to understand the meaning of the Dharma, whether well or badly taught, and one is unable to understand what should and should not be done.

original: dran pa rnam par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid ni myur du brjed pa dang / dran pa mi gsal ba'o //
analyzed: dran pa rnam par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid ni myur du brjed pa dang / dran pa mi gsal ba'o //
translated: The characteristic of the transformation of memory is the rapid loss of memory and the lack of clarity of memory.

original: 'khrig pa dang zas kyi longs spyod kyi bde ba rnam par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid ni skyes pa nyid la gnod par gyur ba'i phyir dang / 'jug pa'i me zhen par gyur pas so //
analyzed: 'khrig pa dang zas kyi longs spyod kyi bde ba rnam par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid ni skyes pa nyid la gnod par gyur ba'i phyir dang / 'jug pa'i me zhen par gyur pas so //
translated: The characteristic of the pleasure of sex and eating is that it is harmful to the one who has it, because it is the cause of the destruction of life.

original: dbang po rnam par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid ni yul la dmigs pa'i stobs zhan pa dang nyams pas so //
analyzed: dbang po rnam par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid ni yul la dmigs pa'i stobs zhan pa dang nyams pas so //
translated: The characteristic of the change of the faculties is the weakness and deterioration of the power of the object.

original: tshe rnam par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid ni tshe'i 'du byed rnams 'chi bar nye bar gyur pa dang yo byad nyung bar mi bzod pas so //
analyzed: tshe rnam par 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid ni tshe'i 'du byed rnams 'chi bar nye bar gyur pa dang yo byad nyung bar mi bzod pas so //
translated: The characteristic of the change of life is the proximity of death and the inability to bear the loss of the life-forming forces.🔽The first is the five kinds of misfortune that are made by the change of life itself, which is said in the Vibhanga:

original: dang po'i bye brag rnam par 'byed pa las gsungs pa dge slong dag skye ba rnam pa bzhi po nyid kyi tshe yongs su 'gyur bas byas pa'i phongs pa rnam pa lnga ni rgas pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: dang po'i bye brag rnam par 'byed pa las gsungs pa dge slong dag skye ba rnam pa bzhi po nyid kyi tshe yongs su 'gyur bas byas pa'i phongs pa rnam pa lnga ni rgas pa zhes bya'o //
translated: “Monks, the five kinds of misfortune that are made by the change of life itself, which is of four kinds, are called old age.”

original: phongs pa rnam pa lnga la skras phongs pa ni byi ba dang mdog gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phongs pa rnam pa lnga la skras phongs pa ni byi ba dang mdog gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The five kinds of misfortune are: misfortune of hair, because of the change of color and the appearance of gray hair;

original: lus phongs pa ni dbyibs dang sha dang stobs dang mdog gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lus phongs pa ni dbyibs dang sha dang stobs dang mdog gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The body is impoverished because its shape, flesh, strength, and complexion deteriorate.

original: las phongs pa ni smra ba na lud pa lu ba dang / dbugs rgod pa'i lus yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: las phongs pa ni smra ba na lud pa lu ba dang / dbugs rgod pa'i lus yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Action is impoverished because when one speaks, one's voice is hoarse and one's breath is wheezing.

original: langs pa na gdung ma gug pa bzhin du gug por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: langs pa na gdung ma gug pa bzhin du gug por gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When one stands up, one bends like a crooked stick.

original: 'dug pa na lus mdun du gug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dug pa na lus mdun du gug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When one sits down, one's body sags forward.

original: 'gro ba na 'khar ba la brten pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba na 'khar ba la brten pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When one walks, one leans on a stick.

original: yid kyi ni shes rab rmongs pa dang dran pa zhan pa'i yang phyir ro //
analyzed: yid kyi ni shes rab rmongs pa dang dran pa zhan pa'i yang phyir ro //
translated: The mind is impoverished because one's wisdom is confused and one's memory is weak.

original: longs spyod phongs pa ni yo byad la longs spyod pa zhan pa'i phyir dang / @50a * //
analyzed: longs spyod phongs pa ni yo byad la longs spyod pa zhan pa'i phyir dang / @50a * //
translated: Enjoyment is impoverished because one's enjoyment of one's possessions is weak,

original: rtsed mo dang dga' ba'i yo byad la thams cad nas thams cad du longs mi spyod pa'i phyir dang / dbang po gzugs can rnams rang gi yul la mi gsal bar rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtsed mo dang dga' ba'i yo byad la thams cad nas thams cad du longs mi spyod pa'i phyir dang / dbang po gzugs can rnams rang gi yul la mi gsal bar rgyu ba dang mi rgyu ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because one does not enjoy play and amusements at all, and because one's physical faculties do not move clearly toward their objects.

original: srog gi dbang po phongs pa ni tshe zad pa dang shi ba dang nye ba dang 'chi ba'i rkyen cung zad tsam yang mi bzod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: srog gi dbang po phongs pa ni tshe zad pa dang shi ba dang nye ba dang 'chi ba'i rkyen cung zad tsam yang mi bzod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The faculty of life force is impaired because life is exhausted and death is near, and one is unable to endure even a slight condition that would cause death.

original: rgas pa'i rnam grangs bco brgyad po de dag ni de ltar bshad do zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rgas pa'i rnam grangs bco brgyad po de dag ni de ltar bshad do zhes brjod do //
translated: These eighteen synonyms for aging are explained in that way.

original: 'chi ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'chi ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is death?

original: sems can gang yin pa de dang de dag sems can gyi ris de dang de dag nas 'phos pa dang 'pho ba nyid dang zhes bya ba rgyas par rnam grangs bcu 'byung ba yin no //
analyzed: sems can gang yin pa de dang de dag sems can gyi ris de dang de dag nas 'phos pa dang 'pho ba nyid dang zhes bya ba rgyas par rnam grangs bcu 'byung ba yin no //
translated: For any sentient being, it is the passing away, the passing from that sentient being, from that class of sentient beings, and so on, with ten synonyms in total.

original: de la 'phos pa ni sems can gyi ris de dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: de la 'phos pa ni sems can gyi ris de dang bral ba'o //
translated: Here, passing away is the separation from that class of sentient beings.

original: 'pho ba nyid ni 'chi ba'i gnas skabs te /
analyzed: 'pho ba nyid ni 'chi ba'i gnas skabs te /
translated: Passing is the state of death.

original: gang zhig 'pho ba de 'pho ba yin la /
analyzed: gang zhig 'pho ba de 'pho ba yin la /
translated: That which passes away is passing.

original: de'i dngos po ni 'pho ba nyid de /
analyzed: de'i dngos po ni 'pho ba nyid de /
translated: Its state is passing away.

original: 'pho ba'i gnas skabs gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'pho ba'i gnas skabs gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the state of passing away.

original: zhig pa ni gzugs kyi lus la ming gi tshogs bral ba'o //
analyzed: zhig pa ni gzugs kyi lus la ming gi tshogs bral ba'o //
translated: Destruction is the separation of the collection of names from the physical body.

original: nang nyams pa nyid las gzugs kyi lus la dbang po gzugs can rnams rgyun chad pa'o //
analyzed: nang nyams pa nyid las gzugs kyi lus la dbang po gzugs can rnams rgyun chad pa'o //
translated: The degeneration of the internal faculties is the cessation of the material faculties in the body.

original: tshe nyams pa dang drod yal pa zhes bya ba gnyis ka yang gnas pa'i rgyu sngon gyi 'phen pa dang / nye bar bsten pa'i zas kyang zad pa'i phyir yin par ston te /
analyzed: tshe nyams pa dang drod yal pa zhes bya ba gnyis ka yang gnas pa'i rgyu sngon gyi 'phen pa dang / nye bar bsten pa'i zas kyang zad pa'i phyir yin par ston te /
translated: The two terms, “the degeneration of life” and “the loss of heat” indicate the exhaustion of the prior impetus that is the cause of duration and the exhaustion of the sustenance that is the support of duration.

original: mdo sde gzhan las ji skad du zas ni sems can gnas pa'i tshe na zas gnas pa'ang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pas tshig gnyis gnyis kyis 'phos pa dang / 'pho ba nyid yin par bstan to //
analyzed: mdo sde gzhan las ji skad du zas ni sems can gnas pa'i tshe na zas gnas pa'ang de bzhin no zhes gsungs pas tshig gnyis gnyis kyis 'phos pa dang / 'pho ba nyid yin par bstan to //
translated: In another sūtra, it is said, “Sustenance is the life of sentient beings, and the life of sustenance is the same.”

original: de ltar re zhig tshe zad pa rim gyis shi ba gang yin pa dang / 'chi ba'i gnas skabs gang yin pa de gnyis ka shi ba yin par bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar re zhig tshe zad pa rim gyis shi ba gang yin pa dang / 'chi ba'i gnas skabs gang yin pa de gnyis ka shi ba yin par bstan to //
translated: Thus, the two terms indicate the two types of death: the death of those who die gradually and the death of those who die suddenly.🔽Thus, the two terms indicate the two types of death: the death of those who die gradually and the death of those who die suddenly.

original: gang yang tshe ma nyams pa srog gi dbang po dang ldan pa yang rim gyis ma yin par 'chi ba ste /
analyzed: gang yang tshe ma nyams pa srog gi dbang po dang ldan pa yang rim gyis ma yin par 'chi ba ste /
translated: Those who die suddenly are those who, without the degeneration of life, possess the faculty of life but die suddenly.

original: de ni srog gi dbang po 'gags pa dang / phung po rnams 'dor ba dang / shi ba zhes bya ba yin te mdor bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni srog gi dbang po 'gags pa dang / phung po rnams 'dor ba dang / shi ba zhes bya ba yin te mdor bstan pa yin no //
translated: This is called the cessation of the life faculty, the casting off of the aggregates, and death. This is the brief presentation.

original: srog gi dbang po 'gags pa gang zhe na /🔽dus byed pa'o zhes smras te /
analyzed: srog gi dbang po 'gags pa gang zhe na / dus byed pa'o zhes smras te /
translated: What is the cessation of the life faculty?🔽It is the end of life.

original: dus yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dus yongs su rdzogs pa zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: This means the completion of the life span.

original: des ni sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa gang yin pa skal ba 'dra ba'i phung po'i rgyun gyis gnas pa'i dus de'i mthar thug pa ni srog gi dbang po 'gags pa ste /
analyzed: des ni sngon gyi las kyis 'phangs pa gang yin pa skal ba 'dra ba'i phung po'i rgyun gyis gnas pa'i dus de'i mthar thug pa ni srog gi dbang po 'gags pa ste /
translated: This is the cessation of the life faculty, which is the end of the duration of the continuum of aggregates of a similar class of sentient beings, propelled by previous karma.

original: srog gi dbang po don gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes ston pa yin no //
analyzed: srog gi dbang po don gzhan yod pa ma yin no zhes ston pa yin no //
translated: This shows that there is no separate entity called the life faculty.

original: dang po'i bye brag rnam par 'byed pa las dge slong dag skye ba'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhi po dag nyid la /
analyzed: dang po'i bye brag rnam par 'byed pa las dge slong dag skye ba'i mtshan nyid rnam pa bzhi po dag nyid la /
translated: In the first chapter of the Abhidharmakośa, it says, “Monks, there are four characteristics of birth.

original: 'chi ba'i @50b rab tu dbye ba rnam pa drug yod par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'chi ba'i @50b rab tu dbye ba rnam pa drug yod par rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood that there are six types of death.

original: rdzogs par shi ba dang / ma rdzogs par shi ba dang / shi ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang / ma rdzogs par 'chi ba'i rnam par dbye ba dang / rdzogs par shi ba'i rnam par dbye ba dang / dus ma yin pa dang dus su shi ba'o //
analyzed: rdzogs par shi ba dang / ma rdzogs par shi ba dang / shi ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid dang / ma rdzogs par 'chi ba'i rnam par dbye ba dang / rdzogs par shi ba'i rnam par dbye ba dang / dus ma yin pa dang dus su shi ba'o //
translated: death with remainder, death without remainder, the intrinsic nature of death, the classification of death without remainder, the classification of death with remainder, and timely and untimely death.

original: dge slong dag de la shi ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni lus las rnam par shes pa bral zhing 'jig pa dang / dbang po gzugs can rnams nub par gyur pa las rig par bya'o zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dge slong dag de la shi ba'i rang gi mtshan nyid ni lus las rnam par shes pa bral zhing 'jig pa dang / dbang po gzugs can rnams nub par gyur pa las rig par bya'o zhes gsungs te /
translated: Monks, the intrinsic nature of death is to be known from the separation and destruction of consciousness from the body and the disappearance of the material faculties.

original: de dag ni shi ba'i rnam grangs rnam pa bcu po de dag gi don bstan pa yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: de dag ni shi ba'i rnam grangs rnam pa bcu po de dag gi don bstan pa yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: These are said to be the explanations of the meanings of the ten synonyms for death.

original: bstan pa las ci'i phyir mya ngan la sogs pa gsungs la rnam par dbye ba las ma phye zhe na /
analyzed: bstan pa las ci'i phyir mya ngan la sogs pa gsungs la rnam par dbye ba las ma phye zhe na /
translated: Why are sorrow and so on mentioned in the teaching but not classified?

original: rga shi ni srid pa'i yan lag nyid du brjod par bzhed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rga shi ni srid pa'i yan lag nyid du brjod par bzhed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is asserted that aging and death are limbs of existence.

original: 'di ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'di ltar rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams gang zhe na /
translated: What are the factors that are dependently arisen?

original: ma rig pa nas rga shi'i bar yin no zhes mdo sde gzhan las gsungs kyi /
analyzed: ma rig pa nas rga shi'i bar yin no zhes mdo sde gzhan las gsungs kyi /
translated: The sutras state that they are the factors from ignorance up to aging and death.

original: mya ngan la sogs pa ni ma yin no //🔽lung las bzlog la brtag pa'i tshe yang gang zhig med na rga shi mi 'byung ba yin zhes gsungs kyi mya ngan la sogs pa ma yin no //🔽'o na ci de dag khas mi len tam zhe na /

translated: But they do not state that sorrow, etc., are dependently arisen.

original: go rims ma nges pa'i phyir dang / gcig tu chad pa med pa'i phyir ro //🔽de dag la go rims nges pa ni yod pa ma yin te /🔽rga ba'i snga rol lam phyi nas kyang yin no //
analyzed: go rims ma nges pa'i phyir dang / gcig tu chad pa med pa'i phyir ro // de dag la go rims nges pa ni yod pa ma yin te / rga ba'i snga rol lam phyi nas kyang yin no //
translated: When one analyzes the factors in the reverse order, the sutras state that when one factor is absent, the next factor is absent.🔽But they do not state that when sorrow, etc., are absent, ignorance, etc., are absent.

analyzed: gdon mi za bar mya ngan la sogs pa yang yod pa ma yin te /
