original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because they are characteristics of conditioned factors.

original: 'byung ba ni skye ba yin no //
analyzed: 'byung ba ni skye ba yin no //
translated: Arising is birth.

original: 'jig pa ni 'chi ba yin no //
analyzed: 'jig pa ni 'chi ba yin no //
translated: Perishing is death.

original: gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid ni rga ba yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid ni rga ba yin no //
translated: Change is the transformation of the factors that endure.

original: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni rgyun yin par bstan to //
analyzed: gnas pa zhes bya ba ni rgyun yin par bstan to //
translated: Enduring is the stream of conditioned factors.

original: de'i snga phyi'i bye brag ni gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i snga phyi'i bye brag ni gzhan du 'gyur ba nyid yin no //
translated: The difference between its earlier and later moments is its transformation.

original: kun rdzogs pa la yongs su nyams pa'i rga ba yod par mdo sde 'di las bstan to //
analyzed: kun rdzogs pa la yongs su nyams pa'i rga ba yod par mdo sde 'di las bstan to //
translated: The Sūtra teaches that the transformation of the perfected being is a regression.

original: gal te gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba rga ba yin na ci'i phyir bar du bstan zhe na ;🔽'di nyid go rims yin no //
analyzed: gal te gnas pa gzhan du 'gyur ba rga ba yin na ci'i phyir bar du bstan zhe na ; 'di nyid go rims yin no //
translated: If transformation is aging, why is it mentioned separately?🔽It is mentioned separately in order to show that the stream of conditioned factors is impermanent in five ways.

original: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid la ci'i phyir de ltar ma yin zhe na /🔽skye ba dang 'jig pa'i bye brag nyid gnas pa gzhan du gyur pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dus byas kyi mtshan nyid la ci'i phyir de ltar ma yin zhe na / skye ba dang 'jig pa'i bye brag nyid gnas pa gzhan du gyur pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is it not so for the characteristics of conditioned factors?🔽In order to show that the difference between earlier and later moments of the stream is aging.

original: gnyis kyis ni snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa'i mi rtag pa nyid ston to //
analyzed: gnyis kyis ni snga na med pa dang zhig nas med pa'i mi rtag pa nyid ston to //
translated: The first two show the impermanence of that which did not exist before and that which, having existed, no longer exists.

original: gcig gis ni dngos po rnam par 'gyur @51a * //
analyzed: gcig gis ni dngos po rnam par 'gyur @51a * //
translated: One is impermanent in the sense of having a perishable nature.

original: ba'i mi rtag pa yin pas de las ni go rims ji lta bu yin no //
analyzed: ba'i mi rtag pa yin pas de las ni go rims ji lta bu yin no //
translated: How is it that the order of the members is in accordance with the order of their arising?

original: 'o na bstan pa las ci'i phyir mya ngan la sogs pa bstan zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na bstan pa las ci'i phyir mya ngan la sogs pa bstan zhe na /
translated: But why are sorrow and so on taught in the sutra?

original: skye ba yod na nyes pa de dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes nyes dmigs phal che ba nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir dang yid 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skye ba yod na nyes pa de dag 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes nyes dmigs phal che ba nyid yin par bstan pa'i phyir dang yid 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: In order to show that the arising of birth is the cause of the great mass of harm and in order to generate a sense of disenchantment.

original: de dag ci'i phyir mya ngan la sogs pa zhes bya zhe na /
analyzed: de dag ci'i phyir mya ngan la sogs pa zhes bya zhe na /
translated: Why are they called sorrow and so on?

original: sdug pa dang bral ba na log par cal col smra ba'i rgyu rnam par rtog pa ni mya ngan no //
analyzed: sdug pa dang bral ba na log par cal col smra ba'i rgyu rnam par rtog pa ni mya ngan no //
translated: Sorrow is the discursive thought that is the cause of lamenting due to being separated from what is attractive.

original: log par cal col smra ba de nyid smre sngags 'don pa yin no //
analyzed: log par cal col smra ba de nyid smre sngags 'don pa yin no //
translated: Lamenting is the expression of that very sorrow.

original: mi sdug pa dang phrad pa na lus kyis mi 'dong pa myong ba ni sdug bsngal yin no //
analyzed: mi sdug pa dang phrad pa na lus kyis mi 'dong pa myong ba ni sdug bsngal yin no //
translated: Pain is the experience of the body that is caused by the contact of what is unattractive.

original: sems las byung ba ni yid mi bde ba yin no //
analyzed: sems las byung ba ni yid mi bde ba yin no //
translated: Mental dissatisfaction is a mental factor.

original: tshol ba dang kun tu bsrung ba'i dus na 'bad par byed pa'i ngal ba ni 'khrug pa yin no //
analyzed: tshol ba dang kun tu bsrung ba'i dus na 'bad par byed pa'i ngal ba ni 'khrug pa yin no //
translated: The fatigue of the effort of searching and of guarding is disturbance.

original: sdug pa dang bral ba nyid na brang brdung ba la sogs pas lus gdung ba ni sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: sdug pa dang bral ba nyid na brang brdung ba la sogs pas lus gdung ba ni sdug bsngal lo //
translated: The torment of the body by beating the chest, etc., when one is separated from what one loves is suffering.

original: cal col smra ba btang ba na bar skabs su sems la gdung ba drag po 'byung ba ni yid mi bde ba'o //
analyzed: cal col smra ba btang ba na bar skabs su sems la gdung ba drag po 'byung ba ni yid mi bde ba'o //
translated: The violent mental distress which occurs in the interval when one gives up frivolous speech is sorrow.

original: de dang bral ba nas mi gsal ba'i gnas skabs su nyin zhag kha cig tu zla la yid mi bde ba byed pa ni 'khrug pa'i rnam grangs yin no //
analyzed: de dang bral ba nas mi gsal ba'i gnas skabs su nyin zhag kha cig tu zla la yid mi bde ba byed pa ni 'khrug pa'i rnam grangs yin no //
translated: The mental distress which occurs for a day and a night when one is separated from what one loves and is not manifest in the state of non-disturbance is a synonym for disturbance.

original: de ltar byas na mdo sde gzhan las sdug pa'i rigs can gyi mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang sdug bsngal ma dang / yid mi bde ba dang 'khrug pa rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa de rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar byas na mdo sde gzhan las sdug pa'i rigs can gyi mya ngan dang smre sngags 'don pa dang sdug bsngal ma dang / yid mi bde ba dang 'khrug pa rnams 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa de rigs pa yin no //
translated: If this is so, then the statement in another sūtra that “grief, lamentation, suffering, mental anguish, and disturbance arise from what is loved” is reasonable.

original: gal te skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi yin na skyes tsam nyid na rgas pa'am 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi yin na skyes tsam nyid na rgas pa'am 'chi bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: If aging and death have birth as their condition, then one who has just been born would age and die.

original: 'dir nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma dang po kho na skye ba yin no zhes de skad gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir nyid mtshams sbyor ba'i skad cig ma dang po kho na skye ba yin no zhes de skad gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Here, only the first moment of the linking of consciousness at rebirth is called birth.

original: ji ltar nur nur po la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis nar nar po la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar nur nur po la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis nar nar po la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Just as the condition of the oval shaped embryo is due to the condition of the oblong shaped embryo, and so on.

original: de ma thag tu ni ma yin pas dpe sngar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de ma thag tu ni ma yin pas dpe sngar bstan pa yin no //
translated: But not immediately, so the example is given.

original: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni rnam pa de dag gis so //
analyzed: de ltar na zhes bya ba ni rnam pa de dag gis so //
translated: Thus means in this way.

original: sdug bsngal gyi phung po zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyun no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi phung po zhes bya ba ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyun no //
translated: The mass of suffering means the continuum of suffering.

original: chen po zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: chen po zhes bya ba ni thog ma med pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Great means beginningless.

original: 'di zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang rga shil sogs pa'am 'du byed la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di zhes bya ba ni skye ba dang rga shil sogs pa'am 'du byed la sogs pa'o //
translated: This means birth, aging, and death, or formations, and so on.

original: 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: 'ba' zhig ces bya ba ni bdag dang bdag gi dang bral ba'o //
translated: Only means free from self and what belongs to self.

original: 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes bya ba ni skye ba'o //
translated: Arises means is produced.

original: ji skad du reg pa de dang de kun 'byung ba nas tshor ba de dang de kun 'byung ba yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ji skad du reg pa de dang de kun 'byung ba nas tshor ba de dang de kun 'byung ba yin no zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: For example, the Sūtra says: “The arising of this and that sensation is due to the arising of this and that contact.

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa las ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba zhes bstan te 'dis sam 'di las kun 'byung bas na zhes byas @51b pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa las ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las sdug bsngal kun 'byung ba zhes bstan te 'dis sam 'di las kun 'byung bas na zhes byas @51b pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: ” In the Noble Truths, the cause of suffering is taught as the origin of suffering, because it is the origination from that or by that.

original: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya ba 'dir rkyen dang rkyen can gnyis nges pa dang ma nges pa la skyon yod do //
analyzed: skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi zhes bya ba 'dir rkyen dang rkyen can gnyis nges pa dang ma nges pa la skyon yod do //
translated: In the formula: “With birth as condition, old age and death,” there is a fault in the determination of the conditioned and the conditioning in regard to both the definite and the indefinite.

original: gal te skye ba kho na rga shi'i rkyen yin na ni lam gyis dub pa dang nad dang mya ngan dang yang ba ma spangs pa dang gzhan gyis byas pa dag gis shin tu myur bar rgas shing shi bar mi 'gyur bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te skye ba kho na rga shi'i rkyen yin na ni lam gyis dub pa dang nad dang mya ngan dang yang ba ma spangs pa dang gzhan gyis byas pa dag gis shin tu myur bar rgas shing shi bar mi 'gyur bar thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If birth were the condition of old age and death, it would follow that those who are very quickly aged and die, such as those exhausted by the path, those afflicted by illness, those afflicted by grief, those who are emaciated, and those who are harmed by others, would not be aged and die.

original: 'on te rga shi kho na'i rkyen skye ba yin na ni skye bas bye brag tu byas pa gzhan kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos kun du 'byung ba med par thal bar 'gyur ba dang / bde ba dang tshor ba bar ma dang mya ngan la sogs pa yang med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te rga shi kho na'i rkyen skye ba yin na ni skye bas bye brag tu byas pa gzhan kun nas nyon mongs pa dang rnam par byang ba'i chos kun du 'byung ba med par thal bar 'gyur ba dang / bde ba dang tshor ba bar ma dang mya ngan la sogs pa yang med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But if birth is the condition of only aging and death, then it follows that all the other phenomena of defilement and purification, which are distinguished by birth, would not occur, and it follows that pleasure, neutral feeling, sorrow, and so on would not exist.

original: 'on te gnyis ka nges pa yin na ni skyon gnyis po de dag nyid yin no //
analyzed: 'on te gnyis ka nges pa yin na ni skyon gnyis po de dag nyid yin no //
translated: But if both are determined, then both errors would apply.

original: 'on te ma nges pa yin na ni 'chad pa don med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te ma nges pa yin na ni 'chad pa don med par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: But if they are not determined, then the explanation is pointless.

original: don med pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: don med pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not pointless,

original: rkyen gtso bo 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rkyen gtso bo 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the principal condition is explained.

original: rkyen gtso bo nyid ni skye ba yin te /
analyzed: rkyen gtso bo nyid ni skye ba yin te /
translated: The principal condition is birth,

original: ma skyes pa rga shi med pa'i phyir dang / lam gyis dub ba la sogs pa med par yang yod pa'i phyir ro//
analyzed: ma skyes pa rga shi med pa'i phyir dang / lam gyis dub ba la sogs pa med par yang yod pa'i phyir ro//
translated: because without birth there is no aging and death, and because they exist even without the exhaustion of the life force and so on.

original: 'di ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnam par dbye ba yin no zhes bya ba ni de'i yan lag rnam par 'byed pa rdzogs par ston pa yin no zhes ngas smras pa gang yin pa de'i ched du ngas smras pa 'di dag yin no zhes bya ba
analyzed: 'di ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rnam par dbye ba yin no zhes bya ba ni de'i yan lag rnam par 'byed pa rdzogs par ston pa yin no zhes ngas smras pa gang yin pa de'i ched du ngas smras pa 'di dag yin no zhes bya ba
translated: This is the analysis of dependent origination. This is the explanation of the complete analysis of its members. This is what I have taught.

original: ni de dag so so dang de dag gi ched du de dag gi dbang du byas te de lta bu de dag ngas smras so zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: ni de dag so so dang de dag gi ched du de dag gi dbang du byas te de lta bu de dag ngas smras so zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: This is the meaning of what I have taught individually and for the sake of those, in terms of those, in that way, I have taught those.

original: de dag gi ni sngar don dang yi ge thugs su chud pa nyid dang shin tu ldan te brjod pa bdag nyid yin no zhes ston to //
analyzed: de dag gi ni sngar don dang yi ge thugs su chud pa nyid dang shin tu ldan te brjod pa bdag nyid yin no zhes ston to //
translated: It shows that they are fully endowed with the understanding of both the meaning and the words, and are the very expression of the self.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bshad pa las rga shi rnam par 'byed pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bshad pa las rga shi rnam par 'byed pa rdzogs so /
translated: The analysis of aging and death in the explanation of dependent origination is complete.

original: // / kha cig na re 'dir ma rig pa la sogs pa bstan pa'i phyir ma rig pa la sogs pa kho na yan lag nyid yin par rig par bya ba ni ma yin gyi der gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan yang gdon mi za
analyzed: // / kha cig na re 'dir ma rig pa la sogs pa bstan pa'i phyir ma rig pa la sogs pa kho na yan lag nyid yin par rig par bya ba ni ma yin gyi der gzugs dang sems dang sems las byung ba'i chos gzhan yang gdon mi za
translated: Some say: Since ignorance and so on are taught here, ignorance and so on are not recognized as branches. Other phenomena of form, mind and mental factors are also included there.🔽

original: bar de dang lhan cig byed pa yod pa yin te /
analyzed: bar de dang lhan cig byed pa yod pa yin te /
translated: Some say: The members ignorance, etc. are not to be known as members because they are taught as ignorance, etc. in this context. But it is certain that other phenomena, form, mind, mental factors, exist there, coexisting with them.

original: phung po lnga pa'i gnas skabs bcu gnyis po de dag la yan lag bcu gnyis zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: phung po lnga pa'i gnas skabs bcu gnyis po de dag la yan lag bcu gnyis zhes bya ba'o //
translated: For, in the twelve states of the five aggregates, the twelve members are spoken of.

original: ci'i phyir ma rig pa la sogs pa nyid mdo sde las bstan zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir ma rig pa la sogs pa nyid mdo sde las bstan zhe na /
translated: Why are ignorance, etc. taught in the sutras?

original: gnas skabs de dang de dag gi nang na gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
analyzed: gnas skabs de dang de dag gi nang na gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro zhe'o //
translated: Because they are the principal factors in those states.

original: gal te ma rig pa la sogs pa dag 'du byed la sogs pa'i rkyen gyi gtso bo yin par ji ltar bstan par mi 'dod na de'i gnas skabs na ma rig pa la sogs pa gtso bo nyid yin pa ci zhig @52a * //
analyzed: gal te ma rig pa la sogs pa dag 'du byed la sogs pa'i rkyen gyi gtso bo yin par ji ltar bstan par mi 'dod na de'i gnas skabs na ma rig pa la sogs pa gtso bo nyid yin pa ci zhig @52a * //
translated: If you do not accept that ignorance, etc. are taught as the principal conditions of the formations, etc., then what is the principal factor in those states, ignorance, etc.?

original: yod ; de dag yan lag nyid yin par yang ji ltar khas ma blangs pa yin /
analyzed: yod ; de dag yan lag nyid yin par yang ji ltar khas ma blangs pa yin /
translated: How could it be that they are not accepted as members?

original: thams cad kyang phung po lnga pa yin na ci'i phyir ming dang gzugs 'ba' zhig phung po lnga par bstan pa gzhan ma yin /
analyzed: thams cad kyang phung po lnga pa yin na ci'i phyir ming dang gzugs 'ba' zhig phung po lnga par bstan pa gzhan ma yin /
translated: If all are five aggregates, why are only name-and-form taught as a five-aggregate member?

original: de bas na 'du byed la sogs pa'i rkyen gtso bo re re nyid yan lag yin par bcom ldan 'das bzhed pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas na 'du byed la sogs pa'i rkyen gtso bo re re nyid yan lag yin par bcom ldan 'das bzhed pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the Lord intended the principal conditions of the formations, etc., to be members.

original: mu bzhi brtags pas ji skad bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mu bzhi brtags pas ji skad bstan pa yin no //
translated: The four alternatives are taught by the examination.

original: yan lag bcu gnyis bstan pa 'dis mdor ci bstan zhe na /
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis bstan pa 'dis mdor ci bstan zhe na /
translated: What is taught in brief by this teaching of the twelve members?

original: dang po'i bye brag rnam par 'byed pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs la brten pa byas nas ji ltar khong du chud pa mdor bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: dang po'i bye brag rnam par 'byed pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs la brten pa byas nas ji ltar khong du chud pa mdor bstan par bya'o //
translated: Having relied on the doctrinal formulation that analyzes the distinctions of the first member, I will teach in brief what is understood.

original: gang gis ji ltar ci zhig 'phen pa dang 'phangs pa de nyid gang gis ji ltar mngon par sgrub pa dang / mngon par grub pa gang yin pa de dang / de'i nyes dmigs gang yin pa de dag bstan to //
analyzed: gang gis ji ltar ci zhig 'phen pa dang 'phangs pa de nyid gang gis ji ltar mngon par sgrub pa dang / mngon par grub pa gang yin pa de dang / de'i nyes dmigs gang yin pa de dag bstan to //
translated: It has been shown by what, by how much, and by what is projected, and also what is projected, and by what, and how, and what is actualized, and what is actualized, and what is the disadvantage of that.

original: gang gis 'phangs she na /
analyzed: gang gis 'phangs she na /
translated: By what is it projected?

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen can 'du byed kyis so //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen can 'du byed kyis so //
translated: By the formations having ignorance for their causal condition.

original: ji ltar 'phangs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar 'phangs she na /
translated: How is it projected?

original: rnam par shes pa la bag chags bsgos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la bag chags bsgos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By the impregnation of the seeds in consciousness.

original: ci zhig 'phen zhe na /
analyzed: ci zhig 'phen zhe na /
translated: What is projected?

original: yang srid pa pa'i ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba ste ci rigs par mthar gyis dang cig car 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang srid pa pa'i ming dang gzugs dang skye mched drug dang / reg pa dang / tshor ba ste ci rigs par mthar gyis dang cig car 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Name-and-form, the six sense bases, contact, and feeling, in the future rebirth, in due order and simultaneously, in order that they may arise.

original: 'phangs pa de gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: 'phangs pa de gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: What is the twofold projection?

original: rnam par shes pa la de'i sa bon yongs su brtas pa de nyid 'phangs pa yin no //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la de'i sa bon yongs su brtas pa de nyid 'phangs pa yin no //
translated: It is the very impregnation of the seeds in consciousness.

original: gang gis mngon par sgrub par byed ce na /
analyzed: gang gis mngon par sgrub par byed ce na /
translated: By what is it actualized?

original: ji skad du bstan pa'i rim gyis sngon 'phangs pas 'dir skyes pa'i tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa skyes pa gang yin pa dang / de'i rkyen gyis len pa'o //
analyzed: ji skad du bstan pa'i rim gyis sngon 'phangs pas 'dir skyes pa'i tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa skyes pa gang yin pa dang / de'i rkyen gyis len pa'o //
translated: The craving that arises from the condition of sensation, which is projected by the previously mentioned process and is born here, and the grasping that arises from the condition of craving.

original: ji ltar de gnyis kyis mngon par sgrub ce na /
analyzed: ji ltar de gnyis kyis mngon par sgrub ce na /
translated: How are these two actualized?

original: rnam par shes pa de la las kyi bag chags gnas pa dag des srid pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa de la las kyi bag chags gnas pa dag des srid pa byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because consciousness is the support for the latent impressions of karma.

original: rnam par shes pa la las kyi bag chags rnam pa mang du yod de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa la las kyi bag chags rnam pa mang du yod de /
translated: There are many latent impressions of karma in consciousness.

original: 'du byed sna tshogs kyis yongs su bsgos pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed sna tshogs kyis yongs su bsgos pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is perfumed by various karmic forces.

original: len pa'i bye brag gis yongs su zin pa gang gis 'di nas gnyis par yang srid 'byung bar byed pa de 'dir srid pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: len pa'i bye brag gis yongs su zin pa gang gis 'di nas gnyis par yang srid 'byung bar byed pa de 'dir srid pa zhes bya'o //
translated: That which is grasped by the particular grasping that causes the arising of existence in the next life is called existence here.

original: mngon par grub pa de gang zhe na /
analyzed: mngon par grub pa de gang zhe na /
translated: What is the actualization of that?

original: ming dang gzugs la sogs pa 'phangs pa gang yin pa de ma 'ongs pa na skye ba'o //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs la sogs pa 'phangs pa gang yin pa de ma 'ongs pa na skye ba'o //
translated: The projection of name-and-form, etc. is birth in the future.

original: de yod na nyes dmigs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de yod na nyes dmigs gang zhe na /
translated: What is the danger when that exists?

original: rga shi yin te /
analyzed: rga shi yin te /
translated: It is old age and death.

original: yid du 'ong ba'i lang tsho dang srog zhig pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba'i lang tsho dang srog zhig pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it destroys pleasant youth and life.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed kyis 'phen pa dang / sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pas mngon par grub pa yin pa 'di ji ltar yid ches par bya @52b zhe na ;
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed kyis 'phen pa dang / sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pas mngon par grub pa yin pa 'di ji ltar yid ches par bya @52b zhe na ;
translated: How can one believe that the formations are projected by the condition of ignorance and actualized by the condition of craving?

original: 'di ltar bden pa mthong na yang srid pa 'phen pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar bden pa mthong na yang srid pa 'phen pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Because even though one sees the truths, there is no projection of a new existence,

original: 'phags pa'i bden pa la rig pa skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'phags pa'i bden pa la rig pa skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the knowledge of the noble truths has arisen.

original: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dgra bcom pa la yang sngon gyi 'phen pa yongs su zin kyang yang srid mngon par sgrub pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod chags dang bral ba'i dgra bcom pa la yang sngon gyi 'phen pa yongs su zin kyang yang srid mngon par sgrub pa ma yin no //
translated: And even though the arhat who is free from passion has the former projection of a new existence, he does not actualize a new existence.

original: don de nyid bsdu ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa lnga ste /
analyzed: don de nyid bsdu ba'i phyir tshigs su bcad pa lnga ste /
translated: Five verses on the summary of the meaning of the above teaching:

original: gang gis 'phen dang ji ltar gang //
analyzed: gang gis 'phen dang ji ltar gang //
translated: By what is it projected? How is it projected?

original: de sgrub byed pa'ang de la yang //🔽nyes dmigs gang yin de dag rnams //
analyzed: de sgrub byed pa'ang de la yang // nyes dmigs gang yin de dag rnams //
translated: By what is it actualized? What is its actualization?

original: yan lag bcu gnyis rnams kyis bstan //
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis rnams kyis bstan //
translated: What is its danger? These are taught by the twelve members.

original: gnyis kyi yan lag gcig gis dang // rnam pa bzhi dang gnyis kyis dang // gcig gis gcig dang gcig gis ni //
analyzed: gnyis kyi yan lag gcig gis dang // rnam pa bzhi dang gnyis kyis dang // gcig gis gcig dang gcig gis ni //
translated: four by four, two by two, and one by one.

original: don bdun dag tu rab tu bstan //
analyzed: don bdun dag tu rab tu bstan //
translated: These seven topics are taught.

original: bden pa ji bzhin mi shes phyir //
analyzed: bden pa ji bzhin mi shes phyir //
translated: Because one does not know the truths as they are,

original: las kyis sems la bsgos phyir dang // yan lag bzhi ni rim gyis 'phen //
analyzed: las kyis sems la bsgos phyir dang // yan lag bzhi ni rim gyis 'phen //
translated: one’s actions leave an imprint on the mind, and the four branches are projected in sequence.

original: de yi sa bon yongs brtas phyir //
analyzed: de yi sa bon yongs brtas phyir //
translated: Because the seeds of these are fully nourished,

original: 'phangs pa bzhin du skyes pa yi //
analyzed: 'phangs pa bzhin du skyes pa yi //
translated: they arise as projected.

original: tshor bas skyed pa'i sred pa las //
analyzed: tshor bas skyed pa'i sred pa las //
translated: From the craving that is produced by feeling,

original: len pa 'byung bas de yi las //
analyzed: len pa 'byung bas de yi las //
translated: grasping arises, and the imprinted actions

original: bsgos pa sngon du gyur pa yin ;
analyzed: bsgos pa sngon du gyur pa yin ;
translated: from before are activated.

original: / grub pa skye yin de la yang //
analyzed: / grub pa skye yin de la yang //
translated: When they are activated,

original: rgas stsogs nyes dmigs gang gi phyir //
analyzed: rgas stsogs nyes dmigs gang gi phyir //
translated: because of the problems of aging and so on,

original: bden pa mthong la 'phen pa med //
analyzed: bden pa mthong la 'phen pa med //
translated: one who sees the truths is not projected.

original: sred pa bral na 'byung ba med //
analyzed: sred pa bral na 'byung ba med //
translated: If one is free from craving, there is no arising.

original: ci'i phyir bden pa mthong ba la ma rig pa med pa yin /
analyzed: ci'i phyir bden pa mthong ba la ma rig pa med pa yin /
translated: Why is it that one who sees the truths is not ignorant?

original: gang gi phyir 'di'i las kyis yang srid 'phen par mi byed /
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di'i las kyis yang srid 'phen par mi byed /
translated: Because the actions of one who sees the truths do not project a new existence.

original: gang dag gi yang srid 'phen par byed pa'i las la dbang byed pa ni med pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang dag gi yang srid 'phen par byed pa'i las la dbang byed pa ni med pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But it is not the case that there is no karma that projects a rebirth and that is controlled by those.

original: de dbang byed pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de dbang byed pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is that control?

original: rig pa med pas ma rig pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: rig pa med pas ma rig pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is ignorance, because it is not knowledge.

original: de gang zhe na /
analyzed: de gang zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: bden pa mthong ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the resistance to seeing the truths.

original: sred pa yang de bzhin du ci'i phyir mi 'dod //
analyzed: sred pa yang de bzhin du ci'i phyir mi 'dod //
translated: Why is craving not accepted in the same way?

original: bden pa mthong ba gang yin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs de ni de la dbang byed pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba gang yin pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs de ni de la dbang byed pa yin no zhe na /
translated: If you say that the resistance to seeing the truths is the control over that,

original: mi mthong ba ni mthong ba nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin par rigs pa yin te /
analyzed: mi mthong ba ni mthong ba nyid kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin par rigs pa yin te /
translated: it is reasonable that not seeing is the resistance to seeing,

original: sgrib par byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: sgrib par byed pa'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: because it has the nature of obscuring,

original: dper na snang ba'i mun pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na snang ba'i mun pa lta bu'o //
translated: like darkness is for light.

original: sred pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: sred pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But craving is not like that,

original: chags pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chags pa'i mtshan nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the characteristic of attachment.

original: bden pa mthong ba'i yul la khyab par byed pa yang ma rig pa yin pas de ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin par rigs kyi srid pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba'i yul la khyab par byed pa yang ma rig pa yin pas de ni mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin par rigs kyi srid pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Since ignorance pervades the object of seeing the four noble truths, it is logical that it is the counteragent to that, not existence.

original: 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa gnyis la de med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'gog pa dang lam gyi bden pa gnyis la de med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it does not exist in the two truths of cessation and path.

original: sred pa med par yang ma rig pa ni bden pa mthong ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin par grub pa yin te /🔽'gog pa dang lam @53a * //
analyzed: sred pa med par yang ma rig pa ni bden pa mthong ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin par grub pa yin te / 'gog pa dang lam @53a * //
translated: It is established that ignorance is the counteragent to seeing the four noble truths even without craving,

original: gyi bden pa gnyis lam 'dres pa yod pa yin gyi /
analyzed: gyi bden pa gnyis lam 'dres pa yod pa yin gyi /
translated: because the two truths of cessation and path are mixed with the path.

original: sred pa ni ma rig pa med par ma yin no //
analyzed: sred pa ni ma rig pa med par ma yin no //
translated: But craving does not exist without ignorance.

original: bden pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba yang ma rig pa dmigs pa yongs su shes pas yongs su 'gyur gyi /
analyzed: bden pa mthong bas spang bar bya ba yang ma rig pa dmigs pa yongs su shes pas yongs su 'gyur gyi /
translated: Also, ignorance to be abandoned by seeing the truths is eliminated by thoroughly knowing its focal object,

original: srid pa ni de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas spong ba yin pas 'di ni bden pa mthong ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin no //
analyzed: srid pa ni de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa spangs pas spong ba yin pas 'di ni bden pa mthong ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs ma yin no //
translated: but existence is eliminated by abandoning the affliction that focuses on it. Therefore it is not the counteragent to seeing the truths.

original: 'o na de'i gnyen po bden pa mthong ba ji ltar yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na de'i gnyen po bden pa mthong ba ji ltar yin zhe na /
translated: If that is so, how is the antidote to that seeing the truths?

original: ma rig pa med par sred pa mi skye ba'i phyir dang / de yang des rgyun gcod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma rig pa med par sred pa mi skye ba'i phyir dang / de yang des rgyun gcod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because craving does not arise without ignorance, and because that craving is the cause of the continuity of the series.

original: dper na skyon gyi gnyen po gang yin pa de ni de las byung ba'i nad kyi yang gnyen po yin pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na skyon gyi gnyen po gang yin pa de ni de las byung ba'i nad kyi yang gnyen po yin pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, whatever is the antidote to a fault is also the antidote to the disease that arises from that fault.

original: gal te yang sred pa ni yang srid 'phen par byed pa'i las la dbang byed pa yin na ni bden pa rnams la rmongs pa gang zhig srid pa rgyun chad par 'dod na de'i yang srid 'phen par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te yang sred pa ni yang srid 'phen par byed pa'i las la dbang byed pa yin na ni bden pa rnams la rmongs pa gang zhig srid pa rgyun chad par 'dod na de'i yang srid 'phen par byed pa ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: If craving has power over the action that projects a new existence, then for one who is confused about the truths and who desires to cut off the continuity of existence, craving would not project a new existence.

original: sred pa la zhe sdang zhing yang srid med par sred pa'i dbang gis yang srid 'phen par rigs pa ma yin no //🔽re zhig bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa'i 'du byed la sred pas dbang byed pa yin te /
analyzed: sred pa la zhe sdang zhing yang srid med par sred pa'i dbang gis yang srid 'phen par rigs pa ma yin no // re zhig bsod nams dang bsod nams ma yin pa'i 'du byed la sred pas dbang byed pa yin te /
translated: It is not reasonable that one who hates craving and who desires the nonexistence of a new existence would project a new existence through the power of craving.🔽Craving has power over the formative forces of merit and demerit,

original: 'dod pa'i sred pas de lhag par spyod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i sred pas de lhag par spyod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because one who is attached to the craving for the realm of desire engages in those formative forces.

original: mi g-yo ba la ni ji ltar yin /
analyzed: mi g-yo ba la ni ji ltar yin /
translated: How is it that craving has power over the formative forces of the realm of form?

original: bsam gtan nam gzugs med la ma bskyed par ni de la dmigs pa'i srid pa skye ba'i skabs yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bsam gtan nam gzugs med la ma bskyed par ni de la dmigs pa'i srid pa skye ba'i skabs yod pa ma yin no //
translated: But it is impossible for existence to arise that has as its object the meditative attainment of the formless realm or the meditative attainment of the base of nothingness, without having previously generated those meditative attainments.

original: 'di ltar sred pa ni rang gi khams dang / sa la dmigs pa nges pa yin na /
analyzed: 'di ltar sred pa ni rang gi khams dang / sa la dmigs pa nges pa yin na /
translated: Thus craving definitely has as its object its own realm and level.

original: ma rig pa ni de lta bu ma yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa ni de lta bu ma yin no //
translated: But ignorance is not like that.

original: de bas na ma rig pa kho na yang srid 'phen par byed pa'i las la dbang byed par rigs pa yin gyi sred pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na ma rig pa kho na yang srid 'phen par byed pa'i las la dbang byed par rigs pa yin gyi sred pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore it is reasonable that ignorance alone is the dominant condition for the karma that propels existence, but craving is not.

original: yang srid 'phangs pa la yang sa gang bar gtogs pa'i sred pa 'jug pa rnyed pas sa de par gtogs pa mngon par sgrub par byed pa de la dbang byed pa yin no //
analyzed: yang srid 'phangs pa la yang sa gang bar gtogs pa'i sred pa 'jug pa rnyed pas sa de par gtogs pa mngon par sgrub par byed pa de la dbang byed pa yin no //
translated: Also, craving that engages the level of the projected existence obtains the level of the actual existence that is established.

original: 'o na gang dag rang gis la dmigs par nges pa ma yin gyi skal ba mi 'dra ba dang / khams thams cad du 'gro ba dag de dag gi yang srid 'phen par byed pa'i las la byed pa yin par ci'i phyir ma bstan zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na gang dag rang gis la dmigs par nges pa ma yin gyi skal ba mi 'dra ba dang / khams thams cad du 'gro ba dag de dag gi yang srid 'phen par byed pa'i las la byed pa yin par ci'i phyir ma bstan zhe na /
translated: But why is it not explained that craving that is not definitely focused on its own level and that is of different types and that pervades all realms is the dominant condition for the karma that propels existence?

original: ma rig pa kho na de la gtso bo yin te /
analyzed: ma rig pa kho na de la gtso bo yin te /
translated: Ignorance is the principal factor in this.

original: bden pa mthong ba'i yul la khyab pa yin pa'i phyir dang / de dag med par yang mthu yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bden pa mthong ba'i yul la khyab pa yin pa'i phyir dang / de dag med par yang mthu yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it pervades the object of seeing the truth, and because it has power even when it is absent.

original: ma rig pa med par de dag med do //
analyzed: ma rig pa med par de dag med do //
translated: They do not exist when ignorance is absent.

original: de bas na don bdun gyi dbang du byas te yan lag bcu gnyis 'chad pa de dag 'thad pa yin no //🔽gzhan du yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rim gyis yang @53b srid skye bar 'chad pa la yan lag du zhig gis rdzogs par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de bas na don bdun gyi dbang du byas te yan lag bcu gnyis 'chad pa de dag 'thad pa yin no // gzhan du yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba rim gyis yang @53b srid skye bar 'chad pa la yan lag du zhig gis rdzogs par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: Therefore, the explanation of the twelve members in terms of seven subjects is tenable.

original: ji srid kyis rgyu dang bcas pa'i yang srid bstan par nus pa'o //
analyzed: ji srid kyis rgyu dang bcas pa'i yang srid bstan par nus pa'o //
translated: In other sūtras, dependent origination is explained in terms of the gradual generation of existence. By how many members is it completed?

original: bdun nam ldas yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bdun nam ldas yin no zhe na /
translated: It is completed by seven or by ten.

original: gal te bdun kho na 'chad par byed na ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa las ming dang gzugs la sogs pa'i rim gyis ma 'ongs pa na yang srid 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes smras par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te bdun kho na 'chad par byed na ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa las ming dang gzugs la sogs pa'i rim gyis ma 'ongs pa na yang srid 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes smras par 'gyur ro //
translated: If he were to explain only seven links, he would be saying that the future rebirth arises from name-and-form, etc., conditioned by the consciousness perfumed by the formations conditioned by ignorance.

original: de yang srid pa'i rkyen gyis len pa'i bye brag gi 'bras bu 'byin par bya ba'i phyir sngon du gyur pa las byung ngo zhes ma smras par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang srid pa'i rkyen gyis len pa'i bye brag gi 'bras bu 'byin par bya ba'i phyir sngon du gyur pa las byung ngo zhes ma smras par 'gyur ro //
translated: And he would not be saying that the future rebirth arises from the karma of the prior stage, since the karma is the result of the specific appropriation conditioned by existence.

original: de dag med par dgra bcom pa yang yang srid 'grub par thal bar 'gyur te ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag med par dgra bcom pa yang yang srid 'grub par thal bar 'gyur te ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pa yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And it would follow, absurdly, that even arhats would have future rebirths, because they have consciousness perfumed by the formations conditioned by ignorance.

original: ma rig pa ni yang srid mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin par bstan pa yang ma yin na gang gi phyir de spangs pas de mi 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: ma rig pa ni yang srid mngon par 'grub pa'i rgyu yin par bstan pa yang ma yin na gang gi phyir de spangs pas de mi 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: And it is not as if ignorance were taught to be the cause of the establishment of future rebirth, for how could that be eliminated?

original: 'du byed kyi rkyen de ni sngar kun du 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'du byed kyi rkyen de ni sngar kun du 'byung ngo //
translated: The condition of volitions occurs previously.

original: 'on te lnga kho na 'chad par byed na ni srid pa'i rkyen gyis len pas kun nas bslang ba'i las kyis yang srid 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes smras par 'gyur pa yin gyi /
analyzed: 'on te lnga kho na 'chad par byed na ni srid pa'i rkyen gyis len pas kun nas bslang ba'i las kyis yang srid 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes smras par 'gyur pa yin gyi /
translated: If only five are mentioned, then it would be said that existence occurs due to the karma motivated by grasping, which is conditioned by existence.

original: de yang ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pas 'phangs pa'i ming dang gzugs la sogs pa'i rim gyis 'byung ngo zhes smras pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de yang ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i rnam par shes pas 'phangs pa'i ming dang gzugs la sogs pa'i rim gyis 'byung ngo zhes smras pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: But that would not mention that it occurs through the stages of name-and-form and so on, which are projected by consciousness fully infused by the formative factors of karma, which are conditioned by ignorance.

original: de med par bden pa mthong ba la yang bden pa ma mthong ba bzhin du gsar du yang srid 'phen pa yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de med par bden pa mthong ba la yang bden pa ma mthong ba bzhin du gsar du yang srid 'phen pa yod par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And without that, it would follow that even one who sees the four noble truths would newly project a subsequent rebirth, just as one who has not seen the four noble truths does.

original: las zad na yang srid ga las yod pa dang / rang gi ngo bo ci yin pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa gang yin pa dang / longs spyod pa ci yin pa shes par ma byas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las zad na yang srid ga las yod pa dang / rang gi ngo bo ci yin pa dang / yongs su rdzogs pa gang yin pa dang / longs spyod pa ci yin pa shes par ma byas par 'gyur ro //
translated: It would not be known that when karma is exhausted, a subsequent rebirth occurs from somewhere, what its nature is, what it is fully completed by, and what it experiences.

original: srid pa'i rkyen kyang ma bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: srid pa'i rkyen kyang ma bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: and the condition of existence would not be taught.

original: de bas yan lag bcu gnyis bshad pa med par yang srid kyi bshad pa rdzogs pa ma yin no //🔽skye bar byed pa'i rgyu ni las ji lta ba bzhin yin te /
analyzed: de bas yan lag bcu gnyis bshad pa med par yang srid kyi bshad pa rdzogs pa ma yin no // skye bar byed pa'i rgyu ni las ji lta ba bzhin yin te /
translated: Therefore, even without the explanation of the twelve members, the explanation of dependent origination is not incomplete.

original: ming dang gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba tha dad pa'i lus kyi dngos po 'phen pa la dbang byed pa'i phyir ro //🔽mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i rgyu ni sred pa ji lta ba bzhin yin te /
analyzed: ming dang gzugs la sogs pa'i rnam par dbye ba tha dad pa'i lus kyi dngos po 'phen pa la dbang byed pa'i phyir ro // mngon par 'grub par byed pa'i rgyu ni sred pa ji lta ba bzhin yin te /
translated: The cause of production is karma, as it is, because it has the power to project the state of the body, which is the differentiation of name-and-form, etc.

original: rang gi khams su 'phangs pa'i yang srid mtshams sbyor ba la dbang byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi khams su 'phangs pa'i yang srid mtshams sbyor ba la dbang byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cause of actualization is craving, as it is, because it has the power to connect with the existence projected in one’s own realm.

original: de ltar ni yan lag bdun dang lngas bstan pa yin no //🔽de bas na lung las yan lag bcu @54a * //
analyzed: de ltar ni yan lag bdun dang lngas bstan pa yin no // de bas na lung las yan lag bcu @54a * //
translated: Thus, seven members and five members are taught.

original: gnyis 'chad pa nyid legs pa yin no //
analyzed: gnyis 'chad pa nyid legs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, the explanation of twelve members in the scriptures is excellent.

original: de ltar na bstan bcos dang 'gal ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: de ltar na bstan bcos dang 'gal ba ma yin nam /
translated: In that case, is it not contradictory to the treatise?

original: ji skad du ye shes la 'jug pa las gang gsungs pa gang zag gcig gi skye ba 'di la 'das pa ni du zhig ce na smras pa gnyis te /
analyzed: ji skad du ye shes la 'jug pa las gang gsungs pa gang zag gcig gi skye ba 'di la 'das pa ni du zhig ce na smras pa gnyis te /
translated: If someone asks, how many of the twelve factors of dependent origination are past in this birth of a person?

original: ma rig pa dang 'du byed do //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang 'du byed do //
translated: It is said that two are past: ignorance and compositional activity.

original: ma 'ongs pa du zhig ce na smras pa /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa du zhig ce na smras pa /
translated: How many are future?

original: gnyis te skye ba dang rga shi'o //
analyzed: gnyis te skye ba dang rga shi'o //
translated: It is said that two are future: birth and aging and death.

original: da ltar byung ba du zhig ce na /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba du zhig ce na /
translated: How many are present?

original: smras pa / brgyad de rnam par shes pa nas sred pa'i bar ro zhes bya ba'o zhe na /
analyzed: smras pa / brgyad de rnam par shes pa nas sred pa'i bar ro zhes bya ba'o zhe na /
translated: It is said that eight are present: consciousness up to craving.

original: de ltar na ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed dang / len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa la tha dad du bya ba ci zhig yod ce na smras pa /
analyzed: de ltar na ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed dang / len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa la tha dad du bya ba ci zhig yod ce na smras pa /
translated: If that is so, what is the difference between ignorance as a condition of compositional activity and craving as a condition of becoming?

original: sngon gyi tshe rabs gzhan la las gang byas shing bstsags pa dang / las gang gi rnam par smin pas tshe 'di la sred pa rnyed par byed pa dang / las gang gis skyes pa na rnam par smin po so sor myong bar byed pa'i las de nyon mongs pa gcig gi rkyen gyis yin par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
analyzed: sngon gyi tshe rabs gzhan la las gang byas shing bstsags pa dang / las gang gi rnam par smin pas tshe 'di la sred pa rnyed par byed pa dang / las gang gis skyes pa na rnam par smin po so sor myong bar byed pa'i las de nyon mongs pa gcig gi rkyen gyis yin par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
translated: The Bhagavān has said that the karma that is created and accumulated in other previous lives and the karma that causes craving in this life through the ripening of karma and the karma that causes the experience of the ripening of karma upon birth is karma that has the condition of a single affliction.

original: 'di lta ste ma rig pa ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste ma rig pa ste /
translated: That is, ignorance.

original: 'di ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis 'du byed ces bya'o //
translated: This is called “the condition of ignorance creates compositional activity.”

original: las gang zhig skye ba 'di ni byed cing bstsags pa dang / las gang gis rnam par smin pa ma 'ongs pa na yin pa phyis srid par mtshams sbyor bar byed pa dang / las gang gis skyes pa na rnam par smin pa phyis so sor myong bar 'gyur bar byed pa'i las de ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rkyen gyis yin par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
analyzed: las gang zhig skye ba 'di ni byed cing bstsags pa dang / las gang gis rnam par smin pa ma 'ongs pa na yin pa phyis srid par mtshams sbyor bar byed pa dang / las gang gis skyes pa na rnam par smin pa phyis so sor myong bar 'gyur bar byed pa'i las de ni nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi rkyen gyis yin par bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs te /
translated: The Bhagavān has said that the karma that is created and accumulated in this life and the karma that causes rebirth through the ripening of karma and the karma that causes the linking of rebirth in a future life and the karma that causes the experience of the ripening of karma upon birth is karma that has the condition of all afflictions.

original: 'di lta ste len pa ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste len pa ste /
translated: Thus, it is said:

original: 'di ni len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bya'o zhes ston te /
analyzed: 'di ni len pa'i rkyen gyis srid pa zhes bya'o zhes ston te /
translated: This is called “existence conditioned by grasping.”

original: de dag ni dum bu gsum rnam par gzhag pa tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: de dag ni dum bu gsum rnam par gzhag pa tha dad pa yin te /
translated: These three parts are established as distinct.

original: de ltar na bstan bcos 'di dang 'gal ba yod pa ji skad du sngar bstan pa de bzhin du mdo sde la brten pa'o//
analyzed: de ltar na bstan bcos 'di dang 'gal ba yod pa ji skad du sngar bstan pa de bzhin du mdo sde la brten pa'o//
translated: Thus, as previously explained, there is a contradiction with this treatise.

original: bstan bcos dang 'gal ba ni tshod yod kyi mdo sde dang 'gal na mi rung ngo //
analyzed: bstan bcos dang 'gal ba ni tshod yod kyi mdo sde dang 'gal na mi rung ngo //
translated: A contradiction with the sutras is not permissible, as in the case of the Kṣudraka Collection.

original: dum bu gsum du rnam par 'jog pa 'di la brjod par bya ba mang du 'byung ste /
analyzed: dum bu gsum du rnam par 'jog pa 'di la brjod par bya ba mang du 'byung ste /
translated: There is much to be said about the establishment of the three parts.

original: rgyu dang bcas pa'i skye ba rim gyis yin par 'chad pa dang / rgyu khyad par can las skye ba rim gyis 'chad pa la dgos pa ci yod /
analyzed: rgyu dang bcas pa'i skye ba rim gyis yin par 'chad pa dang / rgyu khyad par can las skye ba rim gyis 'chad pa la dgos pa ci yod /
translated: What is the purpose of explaining the gradual arising of causes and effects and the gradual arising of special causes?

original: 'das pa'i las las 'dir nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa ji ltar 'byung /
analyzed: 'das pa'i las las 'dir nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa ji ltar 'byung /
translated: How does the consciousness that links to this life arise from past karma?

original: bstan bcos las ni de nyon mongs pa can kho nar 'dod do //
analyzed: bstan bcos las ni de nyon mongs pa can kho nar 'dod do //
translated: The treatise maintains that it is only afflicted.

original: ji ltar de 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis yin par rung /
analyzed: ji ltar de 'du byed kyi rkyen gyis yin par rung /
translated: How could it be tenable that it is the condition of formation?

original: rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs gnyis kyi gnas skabs gnyis la yang bye brag ci yod /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang ming dang gzugs gnyis kyi gnas skabs gnyis la yang bye brag ci yod /
translated: What is the difference between the two states of consciousness and name and form?

original: 'gag pa'i rim pa la yang @54b ma rig pa la sogs pa 'gag pa gal te rnam par zhig pa yin na ni /
analyzed: 'gag pa'i rim pa la yang @54b ma rig pa la sogs pa 'gag pa gal te rnam par zhig pa yin na ni /
translated: If the cessation of ignorance and so on is disintegration,

original: des rgyu rnam par zhig pa las 'bras bu rnam par zhig pa khas blangs pa'i phyir skad cig ma 'jig pa la gnod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des rgyu rnam par zhig pa las 'bras bu rnam par zhig pa khas blangs pa'i phyir skad cig ma 'jig pa la gnod par 'gyur ro //
translated: then since you accept that the effect disintegrates from the disintegration of the cause, you would be harmed by the disintegration of momentariness.

original: skad cig ma 'jig pa'i rgyu dang / bar ma chad par 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: skad cig ma 'jig pa'i rgyu dang / bar ma chad par 'bras bu skye ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the effect arises without interruption from the cause of momentary disintegration.

original: rgyu rnam par 'jig pa'i dus kho na ni 'bras bu skye ba yin na ni ji ltar na rgyu rnam par 'jig pa las 'bras bu rnam par 'jig pa 'grub par 'gyur /
analyzed: rgyu rnam par 'jig pa'i dus kho na ni 'bras bu skye ba yin na ni ji ltar na rgyu rnam par 'jig pa las 'bras bu rnam par 'jig pa 'grub par 'gyur /
translated: If the effect arises at the time of the disintegration of the cause, how could the effect be established from the disintegration of the cause?

original: sngon gyi skye ba rnam par 'jig pa na yang de'i rgyu can skye ba phyi ma mi gnas pa'i phyir dang / skye ba yang ma yin no snyam du 'jug par yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon gyi skye ba rnam par 'jig pa na yang de'i rgyu can skye ba phyi ma mi gnas pa'i phyir dang / skye ba yang ma yin no snyam du 'jug par yang 'gyur ro //
translated: and when the former birth is destroyed, the subsequent birth does not occur because it is caused by that.

original: 'on te 'gag pa zhes bya ba spangs pa yin na ni des na ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang len pa rnams cig car du spangs pa'i phyir dang / de dag spangs na yang gzhan spangs par rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir rim pas 'gag par ston pa rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'on te 'gag pa zhes bya ba spangs pa yin na ni des na ma rig pa dang / sred pa dang len pa rnams cig car du spangs pa'i phyir dang / de dag spangs na yang gzhan spangs par rnam par 'jog pa'i phyir rim pas 'gag par ston pa rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: But if cessation is the abandonment of the defilements, then it is not logical to teach the gradual cessation of ignorance, craving, and grasping, because they are abandoned simultaneously, and when they are abandoned, the others are also abandoned.

original: spangs pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can rnams kyi thob pa rgyun chad pa'o //
analyzed: spangs pa zhes bya ba ni nyon mongs pa can rnams kyi thob pa rgyun chad pa'o //
translated: Abandonment is the termination of the possession of the defiled.

original: de las gzhan pa yang de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i thob pa rnams rgyun chad pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa yang de la dmigs pa'i nyon mongs pa'i thob pa rnams rgyun chad pa'o //
translated: The other is the termination of the possession of the defilements that have that as their object.

original: gang zhig mig la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags spangs na /
analyzed: gang zhig mig la 'dun pa dang 'dod chags spangs na /
translated: When one abandons desire and attachment to the eye,

original: 'dun pa dang 'dod chags spangs pa de dag nyid kyis khyod kyis mig spangs pa yin no zhes mdo sde las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dun pa dang 'dod chags spangs pa de dag nyid kyis khyod kyis mig spangs pa yin no zhes mdo sde las gsungs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: You have abandoned the eye by abandoning desire and attachment.

original: 'on te 'gag pa zhes bya ba ma skyes pa yin na ni 'das pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i skye bas bsdus pa'i yan lag rnams skyes pa yin par ji ltar rung ba yin /
analyzed: 'on te 'gag pa zhes bya ba ma skyes pa yin na ni 'das pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i skye bas bsdus pa'i yan lag rnams skyes pa yin par ji ltar rung ba yin /
translated: But if cessation is unarisen, how could the limbs that are included in arising, which are past and present, be arisen?

original: de lta na mi rtag pa'i 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta na mi rtag pa'i 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pa'i 'gog pa dang / so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa'i skyon du 'gyur ro //
translated: In that case, there would be the fault that cessation would be impermanent, and that there would be cessation by analysis and cessation not by analysis.

original: rnam grangs kyis de 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam grangs kyis de 'chad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is explained by way of synonyms.

original: 'on te yang 'gag pa'i rim ba 'chad pa la 'di ltar rtogs par byed de /
analyzed: 'on te yang 'gag pa'i rim ba 'chad pa la 'di ltar rtogs par byed de /
translated: But if one explains the order of cessation in this way, it is understood thus:

original: skye ba de nyid la ma rig pa ma skyes pas 'du byed rnams mi skyed pa yin no //
analyzed: skye ba de nyid la ma rig pa ma skyes pas 'du byed rnams mi skyed pa yin no //
translated: In that very birth, formations are not produced by the non-arising of ignorance.

original: de nas skye ba gnyis pa la yang rnam par shes pa ma skyes pa zhes rgyas par byas nas srid pa'i bar du ma skyes pa'i phyir skye ba gsum pa'i skye ba ma skyes pa dang / de la rga shi'o zhe na /
analyzed: de nas skye ba gnyis pa la yang rnam par shes pa ma skyes pa zhes rgyas par byas nas srid pa'i bar du ma skyes pa'i phyir skye ba gsum pa'i skye ba ma skyes pa dang / de la rga shi'o zhe na /
translated: Then, in the second birth, since the consciousness of the third birth has not yet arisen, because it has not yet arisen up to the intermediate existence, the birth of the third birth has not yet arisen.🔽If you say that aging and death exist there,

original: de ltar skye ba gsum pa ma skyes pa'i rim pas 'chad pa ni don med par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: de ltar skye ba gsum pa ma skyes pa'i rim pas 'chad pa ni don med par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: then the explanation of the sequence of the nonarising of the third birth would be meaningless.

original: ha cang thal bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ha cang thal bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Or else, it would follow, absurdly, that

original: gang gi tshe lugs las bzlog pa'i 'gog pa ston te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe lugs las bzlog pa'i 'gog pa ston te /
translated: when the cessation of the reverse order is taught,

original: skye ba med na rga shi med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de lta bu la brten pa yin na ni /
analyzed: skye ba med na rga shi med par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba de lta bu la brten pa yin na ni /
translated: that is, when it is taught that if there is no birth, there will be no aging and death,

original: de'i tshe gal te ma 'ongs pa skye ba gsum @55a * //
analyzed: de'i tshe gal te ma 'ongs pa skye ba gsum @55a * //
translated: then at that time, if you imagine that the nonarising of the third birth in the future

original: pa'i skye ba la rtog na ni skyon de dag nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pa'i skye ba la rtog na ni skyon de dag nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: is the nonarising of the third birth, then those errors would ensue.

original: 'on te skye ba gnyis pa la rtog na ni rgyu dang bcas pa da ltar gyi skye ba la ma skyes pa'i rim pa ston pa rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'on te skye ba gnyis pa la rtog na ni rgyu dang bcas pa da ltar gyi skye ba la ma skyes pa'i rim pa ston pa rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: But if you imagine that the nonarising of the second birth is the nonarising of the third birth, then it would not be correct to teach the sequence of the nonarising of the present birth, which has a cause.

original: de skyes pa yin pa'i phyir dang / dgos pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de skyes pa yin pa'i phyir dang / dgos pa yang med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has already arisen, and because there is no need for it.

original: de bas na dus tha dad pa'i sgo nas yan lag bcu gnyis rnam par 'jog pa la 'gog pa'i rim pa 'chad pa ni thams cad du sbyar bar nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na dus tha dad pa'i sgo nas yan lag bcu gnyis rnam par 'jog pa la 'gog pa'i rim pa 'chad pa ni thams cad du sbyar bar nus pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the explanation of the order of cessation in terms of the sequential arrangement of the twelve members is not applicable in all cases.

original: sngar yan lag rnam par gzhag pa la gang skyes pas gang skye ba'am /
analyzed: sngar yan lag rnam par gzhag pa la gang skyes pas gang skye ba'am /
translated: In the sequential arrangement of the members, it is reasonable to explain the order of cessation in terms of the principle that when one member arises, another member either arises,

original: 'phen pa'am / 'phangs pa'am /
analyzed: 'phen pa'am / 'phangs pa'am /
translated: is projected, or is actualized.

original: mngon par sgrub par byed pa la ni de ma skyes pas de mi skye ba'am /🔽mi 'phen pa'am /
analyzed: mngon par sgrub par byed pa la ni de ma skyes pas de mi skye ba'am / mi 'phen pa'am /
translated: When that member has not yet arisen, the other member does not arise,🔽is not projected,

original: 'phangs pa med pa'am /🔽mngon par sgrub par byed pa med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'gog pa'i rim pa 'chad pa ni rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'phangs pa med pa'am / mngon par sgrub par byed pa med do zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'gog pa'i rim pa 'chad pa ni rigs pa yin no //
translated: is not actualized.

original: tshe 'di la tshor bdag yod bzhin du tshor ba ma skyes pas sred pa ma skyes par ji ltar rung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: tshe 'di la tshor bdag yod bzhin du tshor ba ma skyes pas sred pa ma skyes par ji ltar rung bar 'gyur /
translated: How could craving not arise in this life when feeling exists and feeling has not yet ceased?

original: tshor ba gang yin pa ni sred pa'i rkyen yin te /
analyzed: tshor ba gang yin pa ni sred pa'i rkyen yin te /
translated: Feeling is the condition for craving,

original: de ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ma skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has not yet ceased.

original: de'i rkyen yang gang zhig ce na /
analyzed: de'i rkyen yang gang zhig ce na /
translated: What is the cause of this craving?

original: sred pa'i sa bon gang yin pa de yin te /
analyzed: sred pa'i sa bon gang yin pa de yin te /
translated: It is the seed of craving.

original: ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa yin no //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i 'dus te reg pa las skyes pa yin no //
translated: It arises from contact accompanied by ignorance.

original: de ni rnam par 'byed pa bstan pa las shes par byas zin to //
analyzed: de ni rnam par 'byed pa bstan pa las shes par byas zin to //
translated: This has already been explained in the Teaching of Discrimination.

original: 'dir yang dum bu gsum rnam par gzhag pa blangs te /
analyzed: 'dir yang dum bu gsum rnam par gzhag pa blangs te /
translated: Here, the three sections are taken as the three times.

original: 'ga' zhig lan 'debs pa dus gsum la rmongs pa bzlog pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dum bu gsum bstan te /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig lan 'debs pa dus gsum la rmongs pa bzlog pa'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dum bu gsum bstan te /
translated: In order to stop the confusion of some who do not know the three times, the Lord taught dependent origination in three sections.

original: 'di ltar mdo sde gzhan las bcom ldan 'das kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams kho na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis mthong na /
analyzed: 'di ltar mdo sde gzhan las bcom ldan 'das kyis rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i chos rnams kho na yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis mthong na /
translated: In other sutras, the Lord said: “When one sees dependent origination and the dharmas produced through dependence correctly and as they really are with correct wisdom, one does not pursue the past, thinking, ‘Did I exist in the past?

original: de ni ci bdag 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur tam zhes rgyas par byas te sngon gyi mtha'i rjes su mi 'brang ngo //
analyzed: de ni ci bdag 'das pa'i dus na byung bar gyur tam zhes rgyas par byas te sngon gyi mtha'i rjes su mi 'brang ngo //
translated: Did I not exist in the past? What was I in the past? How was I in the past? Having been what, what did I become in the past?’

original: ci bdag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhig gam zhes rgyas par byas te ma 'ongs pa'i mtha'i rjes su yang mi 'brang ngo //
analyzed: ci bdag ma 'ongs pa'i dus na 'byung bar 'gyur ba zhig gam zhes rgyas par byas te ma 'ongs pa'i mtha'i rjes su yang mi 'brang ngo //
translated: He does not pursue the future end, asking: Will I be in the future? and so on.

original: bdag gi lus la the tshom za ste /🔽ci ste bdag 'di yin nam /
analyzed: bdag gi lus la the tshom za ste / ci ste bdag 'di yin nam /
translated: He doubts his own body,🔽wondering:🔽Is this self?

original: ji ltar 'di bdag yin zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: ji ltar 'di bdag yin zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: How is this self?

original: sngon gyi mthar yang ma rig pa'i sgo nas sred pa dang len pa yang bstan te /
analyzed: sngon gyi mthar yang ma rig pa'i sgo nas sred pa dang len pa yang bstan te /
translated: In the past, craving and grasping are also shown to be due to ignorance,

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad ma rig pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad ma rig pa dang lhan cig 'byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because all the defilements arise together with ignorance.

original: las gang gis skye ba byas pa ni 'du byed kyi sgras bstan to //
analyzed: las gang gis skye ba byas pa ni 'du byed kyi sgras bstan to //
translated: The action by which birth is produced is indicated by the word formations.

original: gang las skye ba gzhan 'byung bar 'gyur ba de ni srid pa'i @55b sgra'o ;
analyzed: gang las skye ba gzhan 'byung bar 'gyur ba de ni srid pa'i @55b sgra'o ;
translated: The other birth that will arise is indicated by the word existence.

original: /'das pa'i las kyang yod pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: /'das pa'i las kyang yod pa nyid yin te /
translated: Past action does exist,

original: de las nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ba yin gyi /
analyzed: de las nying mtshams sbyor ba'i rnam par shes pa 'byung ba yin gyi /
translated: because birth consciousness arises from it.

original: las kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i sngon gyi skye ba'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyun las ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: las kyis yongs su bsgos pa'i sngon gyi skye ba'i rnam par shes pa'i rgyun las ni ma yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: But it is not from the continuum of consciousness that is imbued with karma.

original: de dag thams cad kyis nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag thams cad kyis nus pa ma yin te /
translated: All of these are not capable of that,

original: gang zhig las dang nyon mongs pa las skye ba 'byung bar shes pa de na dum bu gsum bstan pa med par yang sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa la ma rmongs pa mi 'byung ba yin na /
analyzed: gang zhig las dang nyon mongs pa las skye ba 'byung bar shes pa de na dum bu gsum bstan pa med par yang sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa la ma rmongs pa mi 'byung ba yin na /
translated: because if one understands that birth arises from karma and affliction, then even without teaching the three segments, one would not be confused about the prior limit and so on.

original: sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa'i rjes su 'brang bar lta ga la 'gyur /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha' la sogs pa'i rjes su 'brang bar lta ga la 'gyur /
translated: How then could one follow the prior limit and so on?

original: gal te yang ma rig pa'i sgo nas sred pa dang len pa yang bstan pa yin na /
analyzed: gal te yang ma rig pa'i sgo nas sred pa dang len pa yang bstan pa yin na /
translated: Moreover, if craving and grasping are taught from the perspective of ignorance,

original: bstan bcos 'di dang ji ltar 'gal bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: bstan bcos 'di dang ji ltar 'gal bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: how could this not contradict this treatise?

original: de'i las ni nyon mongs pa gcig gi rkyen gyis yin te 'di lta ste ma rig pa'i zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: de'i las ni nyon mongs pa gcig gi rkyen gyis yin te 'di lta ste ma rig pa'i zhes bcom ldan 'das kyis gsungs so //
translated: The Bhagavān said, “Its function is due to the condition of a single affliction, namely ignorance.”

original: sngon gyi mthar sred pa dang len pa yang ma rig pa'i sgo nas bstan pa yin na /
analyzed: sngon gyi mthar sred pa dang len pa yang ma rig pa'i sgo nas bstan pa yin na /
translated: If craving and grasping are taught from the perspective of ignorance,

original: ci'i phyir dbus kyi mthar ma yin /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dbus kyi mthar ma yin /
translated: Why not the end of the middle?

original: gal te 'das pa'i dus la mun pa'i rnam par gyur pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: gal te 'das pa'i dus la mun pa'i rnam par gyur pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say: because the past time is like darkness,

original: de nyid kyi phyir 'di gnyis shin tu rnam par phye ste brjod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir 'di gnyis shin tu rnam par phye ste brjod par bya dgos so //
translated: then precisely for that reason, these two should be clearly distinguished and explained.

original: 'on te da ltar byung bas 'das pa grub pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te da ltar byung bas 'das pa grub pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: If you say: because the present time establishes the past time,

original: de nyid kyi phyir de mi bstan par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de mi bstan par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: then precisely for that reason, it would follow that the present time should not be taught.

original: ci'i phyir dbus kyi mthar sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa zhes gsungs la sngon gyi mthar ma yin /
analyzed: ci'i phyir dbus kyi mthar sred pa'i rkyen gyis len pa zhes gsungs la sngon gyi mthar ma yin /
translated: Why is it said that craving is a condition for grasping in the end of the middle, but not in the beginning?

original: las gang gis skye ba byas pa de ni 'di 'du byed yin la /
analyzed: las gang gis skye ba byas pa de ni 'di 'du byed yin la /
translated: The action by which birth is produced is formation.

original: gang byed par 'gyur ba de 'du byed ma yin /
analyzed: gang byed par 'gyur ba de 'du byed ma yin /
translated: That by which it will be produced is not formation.

original: gang las skyes par gyur pa de ni srid pa yin la /
analyzed: gang las skyes par gyur pa de ni srid pa yin la /
translated: That from which birth has been produced is existence.

original: gang las skye bar 'gyur ba de srid pa ma yin zhes bya ba 'di la rigs pa ci yod /
analyzed: gang las skye bar 'gyur ba de srid pa ma yin zhes bya ba 'di la rigs pa ci yod /
translated: That from which it will be produced is not existence. What logic is there in this?

original: 'das pa'i las yod pa kho na'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni thams cad brgyan to //
analyzed: 'das pa'i las yod pa kho na'o zhes bya ba 'dis ni thams cad brgyan to //

analyzed: gang rang gi mtshan nyid kyis yod pa kho na yin na ji ltar de 'das pa yin /

translated: In what way are they different?
