analyzed: gang gis ji ltar gang 'phangs pa de ni 'phangs pa'i dum bu gcig pa yin no //
translated: The first section is the projection of the effect by a cause, that is, the projection of the effect by the action.

original: gang gis ji ltar gang mngon par 'grub pa de ni mngon par 'grub pa dum bu gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gis ji ltar gang mngon par 'grub pa de ni mngon par 'grub pa dum bu gnyis pa yin no //
translated: The second section is the actualization of the effect, that is, the actualization of the effect projected by the action.

original: de mngon par 'grub na nyes dmigs gang yin pa de ni nyes dmigs dum bu gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: de mngon par 'grub na nyes dmigs gang yin pa de ni nyes dmigs dum bu gsum pa yin no //
translated: The third section is the error that is the effect, that is, the error that is the actualized effect.

original: dus gsum du dbye ba nyid kyis gzhan du dum bu gsum rnam par gzhag pa las brtsams pa'i lung ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dus gsum du dbye ba nyid kyis gzhan du dum bu gsum rnam par gzhag pa las brtsams pa'i lung ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The three sections are established in a different way, by means of the division into three times.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis las yan lag du zhig 'das pa lags /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis las yan lag du zhig 'das pa lags /
translated: How many of the twelve members are past?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Buddha replied,

original: gnyis te / ma rig pa dang 'du byed do //
analyzed: gnyis te / ma rig pa dang 'du byed do //
translated: Two, namely ignorance and the formations,

original: skyes pa 'gags pa'i don dang / skye ba snga ma pa ma yin pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: skyes pa 'gags pa'i don dang / skye ba snga ma pa ma yin pa'i don gyis so //
translated: in the sense of the cessation of what has arisen and the non-arising of what has not arisen.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i du zhig / bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i du zhig / bka' stsal pa /
translated: How many are future?

original: gnyis te / skye ba dang rga shi'o //
analyzed: gnyis te / skye ba dang rga shi'o //
translated: Two, namely birth and old-age-and-death,

original: yan lag bzhi pa can gyi skye ba nyes dmigs dang bcas par ma chad par mngon par 'grub pa 'thob pa'i don gyis dang / lan grangs gzhan ma yin pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: yan lag bzhi pa can gyi skye ba nyes dmigs dang bcas par ma chad par mngon par 'grub pa 'thob pa'i don gyis dang / lan grangs gzhan ma yin pa'i don gyis so //
translated: in the sense of the acquisition of the manifestation of birth with its disadvantages and in the sense of the non-repetition of that.

original: da ltar byung ba du zhig /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba du zhig /
translated: How many are present?

original: bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One replied:

original: brgyad de rnam par shes pa ni nus pa yongs su 'dzin pa da ltar byung ba yin pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: brgyad de rnam par shes pa ni nus pa yongs su 'dzin pa da ltar byung ba yin pa'i don gyis so //
translated: Eight, namely consciousness, in the sense of the present state of the possession of the potentiality;

original: ming dang gzugs la sogs pa ni sa bon gyi mtshan nyid da ltar byung pa yin pa'i don gyis so //
analyzed: ming dang gzugs la sogs pa ni sa bon gyi mtshan nyid da ltar byung pa yin pa'i don gyis so //
translated: name-and-form, etc., in the sense of the present state characterized by the seed;

original: sred pa la sogs pa ni las byed pa da ltar byung ba yin pa'i don gyis te /
analyzed: sred pa la sogs pa ni las byed pa da ltar byung ba yin pa'i don gyis te /
translated: craving, etc., in the sense of the present state of the performance of the function.

original: de la sred pa dang len ba'i yan lag ni srid par byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: de la sred pa dang len ba'i yan lag ni srid par byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Craving and grasping are the limbs that produce existence.

original: srid pa'i yan lag ni skye ba'i gnas byed pa'i las can no //
analyzed: srid pa'i yan lag ni skye ba'i gnas byed pa'i las can no //
translated: Existence is the limb that produces birth.

original: de ltar na de dag ni rigs pa dang lung la brten nas bdag gis bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar na de dag ni rigs pa dang lung la brten nas bdag gis bstan to //
translated: Thus, I have explained them in dependence on reasoning and scripture.

original: btsun pas ston pa'i mdo sde las byung ba dus gsum las ma rig pa dang 'du byed ni 'das pa'i dus so //
analyzed: btsun pas ston pa'i mdo sde las byung ba dus gsum las ma rig pa dang 'du byed ni 'das pa'i dus so //
translated: The Venerable Master said in the sutra: “From the three times, ignorance and volitional action are in the past time.

original: rnam par shes pa nas srid pa'i bar du ni da ltar byung ba'i dus so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa nas srid pa'i bar du ni da ltar byung ba'i dus so //
translated: Consciousness up to existence are in the present time.

original: skye ba dang rga shi ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus so //
analyzed: skye ba dang rga shi ni ma 'ongs pa'i dus so //
translated: Birth and old age and death are in the future time.”

original: yang mdo sde gzhan las gsungs pa /
analyzed: yang mdo sde gzhan las gsungs pa /
translated: Again, it is said in another sutra:

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis kyi chos de dag ni gnas skabs lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba yan lag bcu gnyis kyi chos de dag ni gnas skabs lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: “Those phenomena of the twelve members of dependent origination should be known in five states.

original: ma rig pa dang 'du byed ni byed pa po'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: ma rig pa dang 'du byed ni byed pa po'i gnas skabs so //
translated: Ignorance and volitional action are the state of the agent.🔽Consciousness up to the six sense spheres are the state of the seed.

original: rnam par shes pa @56b dang ming dang gzugs ni mngal gyi gnas skabs so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa @56b dang ming dang gzugs ni mngal gyi gnas skabs so //
translated: Name and form up to sensation are the state of the womb.

original: skye mched drug dang reg pa dang tshor ba ni yul la 'jug pa'i gnas skabs so //
analyzed: skye mched drug dang reg pa dang tshor ba ni yul la 'jug pa'i gnas skabs so //
translated: The six sense spheres, contact, and feeling are the stage of engagement with objects.

original: sred pa dang len pa dang srid pa ni 'byung bar gnas skabs so //
analyzed: sred pa dang len pa dang srid pa ni 'byung bar gnas skabs so //
translated: Craving, grasping, and existence are the stage of the occurrence of the effect.

original: skye ba dang rga shi ni rnam par smin ba'i gnas skabs yin no //
analyzed: skye ba dang rga shi ni rnam par smin ba'i gnas skabs yin no //
translated: Birth and aging and death are the stage of the ripening of the effect.

original: yang phal dgu ni mdo sde las rnam par shes pa zas yin te /
analyzed: yang phal dgu ni mdo sde las rnam par shes pa zas yin te /
translated: Moreover, the nine beginning with consciousness are food in the sutras,

original: ma 'ongs pa na yang srid mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa na yang srid mngon par 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs so //
translated: because it is said that in the future they actualize existence.

original: bdag 'dra bdag de lta bu la rab tu spro ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag 'dra bdag de lta bu la rab tu spro ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: I have no enthusiasm for such a self.

original: nyi tshe ba'i ma do sde bsdus pa rnams legs par gsungs pa ma yin no snyam sems par 'gyur ba 'di dag la dgongs pa ci yod ces 'di la 'bad par bya dgos te /
analyzed: nyi tshe ba'i ma do sde bsdus pa rnams legs par gsungs pa ma yin no snyam sems par 'gyur ba 'di dag la dgongs pa ci yod ces 'di la 'bad par bya dgos te /
translated: One should make an effort to understand what the intention is behind the statement that the partial nirvāṇa of the Saṃmitīyas is not the well spoken doctrine.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa ni rang gi dgongs pa tha dad pa mtha' yas pa yin te /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan pa ni rang gi dgongs pa tha dad pa mtha' yas pa yin te /
translated: The doctrine of the Bhagavat Buddha has limitless different intentions.

original: sems can rnams kyi mos pa dang / khams dang gnyen po sna tshogs la ltos nas de 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can rnams kyi mos pa dang / khams dang gnyen po sna tshogs la ltos nas de 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is applied in relation to the various aspirations, natures, and antidotes of sentient beings.

original: 'di brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di brjod par bya ste /
translated: This should be stated.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rim pa ji ltar mdo sde 'di las 'byung ba 'di kho na lta bu yin na ni rgyu dang bcas rkyen dang bcas gzhi dang bcas pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs las gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i rim pa ji ltar mdo sde 'di las 'byung ba 'di kho na lta bu yin na ni rgyu dang bcas rkyen dang bcas gzhi dang bcas pa'i chos kyi rnam grangs las gang gsungs pa /
translated: If the order of dependent origination is exactly as it is presented in this sutra, then it would contradict the explanation in the sutra called the Enumeration of Dharmas with Causes, which states:

original: dge slong dag tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa'i rgyu can ni ma rig pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa'i rgyu can ni ma rig pa'o //
translated: Monks, incorrect mental activity is the cause of ignorance.

original: ma rig pa'i rgyu can ni sred pa'o //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rgyu can ni sred pa'o //
translated: Ignorance is the cause of craving.

original: sred pa'i rgyu can ni las so //
analyzed: sred pa'i rgyu can ni las so //
translated: Craving is the cause of karma.

original: las kyi rgyu can ni mig nas yid kyi bar du yin no zhes 'byung ba 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las kyi rgyu can ni mig nas yid kyi bar du yin no zhes 'byung ba 'gal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Karma is the cause of the eyes and so on up to the mind.

original: 'on te rim pa de kho na lta bu yin na ni mdo sde'i 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhe na 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: 'on te rim pa de kho na lta bu yin na ni mdo sde'i 'gal bar 'gyur ro zhe na 'gal ba med de /
translated: But if the order is exactly as it is presented in the sutra, then it would contradict the Abhidharma.

original: de ni dgongs ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni dgongs ba can yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no contradiction because that sutra is provisional.

original: der ni sred pa dang len pa dag yan lag gcig tu byas te bstan te /
analyzed: der ni sred pa dang len pa dag yan lag gcig tu byas te bstan te /
translated: There, craving and grasping are taught as one member,

original: 'dod pa la sogs pa la 'dun pa dang / 'dod chags la ni sred pa'i bye brag yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa la sogs pa la 'dun pa dang / 'dod chags la ni sred pa'i bye brag yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because craving is a specific form of desire and attachment.

original: srid pa'i gnas skabs kyi las ni las su gsungs so //
analyzed: srid pa'i gnas skabs kyi las ni las su gsungs so //
translated: Action in the state of existence is taught as action.

original: skye mched drug gi gnas skabs kyi skye ba ni skye mched drug tu gsungs te /
analyzed: skye mched drug gi gnas skabs kyi skye ba ni skye mched drug tu gsungs te /
translated: Birth in the state of the six sense spheres is taught as the six sense spheres.

original: de ltar na mngon par 'grub pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la dgongs nas de skad gsungs kyi /
analyzed: de ltar na mngon par 'grub pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la dgongs nas de skad gsungs kyi /
translated: Thus, this is stated with the intention of the dependent origination of actualization,

original: 'phen par byed pa la ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'phen par byed pa la ni ma yin no //
translated: but not with the intention of the projecting.

original: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes bya ba ni sred pa thams cad kyi spyi'i rkyen nyid la dgongs te gsungs so //
analyzed: ma rig pa'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes bya ba ni sred pa thams cad kyi spyi'i rkyen nyid la dgongs te gsungs so //
translated: The statement “craving has the condition of ignorance” is stated with the intention of the general condition of all craving.

original: 'dir ni tshor ba'i bye brag gis sred pa'i bye brag bstan pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: 'dir ni tshor ba'i bye brag gis sred pa'i bye brag bstan pa'i phyir te /
translated: Here, the specific forms of craving are taught by way of the specific forms of feeling.

original: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes bya ba ni rkyen bye brag tu @57a * //
analyzed: tshor ba'i rkyen gyis sred pa zhes bya ba ni rkyen bye brag tu @57a * //
translated: The statement “craving has the condition of feeling” is stated with the intention of the specific condition of craving.

original: gyur pa la dgongs te gsungs so //
analyzed: gyur pa la dgongs te gsungs so //
translated: The meaning of the statement is to be understood in this way.

original: der yang ma rig pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i don gyis tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa rkyen yin par gsungs kyi rab tu 'jug pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: der yang ma rig pa'i rjes su 'jug pa'i don gyis tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa rkyen yin par gsungs kyi rab tu 'jug pa ni ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is said that the condition for the formative forces is the non-appropriation of the mind which is governed by nescience, but not the engagement of nescience,

original: de ma rig pa skyed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: de ma rig pa skyed pa'i phyir te /
translated: because the formative forces are generated by nescience.

original: rmongs pa yod na tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa yin gyi /
analyzed: rmongs pa yod na tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa yin gyi /
translated: For, when there is delusion, there is the non-appropriation of the mind which is governed by nescience,

original: ma rmongs par ma yin no //
analyzed: ma rmongs par ma yin no //
translated: but not when there is no delusion.

original: de skad du de nyid las mig dang gzugs la brten nas log par yid la byed pa ni rmongs pa las byung ba yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de skad du de nyid las mig dang gzugs la brten nas log par yid la byed pa ni rmongs pa las byung ba yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, in the same text it is said: “The non-appropriation of the mind which is governed by nescience arises from delusion in dependence upon the eye and form”.

original: yan lag bcu gnyis las ni rab tu 'jug pa rkyen du bstan to //
analyzed: yan lag bcu gnyis las ni rab tu 'jug pa rkyen du bstan to //
translated: In the twelve members, the engagement of nescience is taught as the condition for the formative forces.

original: de bas na tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa ni ma rig pa'i rkyen du ma gsungs te sngar yang shes par byas zin to //
analyzed: de bas na tshul bzhin ma yin par yid la byed pa ni ma rig pa'i rkyen du ma gsungs te sngar yang shes par byas zin to //
translated: Therefore, the non-appropriation of the mind which is governed by nescience is not said to be the condition for the formative forces, as has been understood previously.

original: de bas na 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de bas na 'gal ba med do //
translated: Thus, there is no contradiction.

original: gdul bya'i skye bo'i bye brag la ltos nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis lugs dang mthun pa dang / lugs dang mi mthun pa dang / nag po dang dkar po'i phyogs dang / tshang ba dang yan lag ma tshang ba la sogs par 'chad pa tha dad pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ston pa'i mdo sde gzhan rnam pa mang po la bdag gis brjod pa'am brtag par lta ga la nus /🔽rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i bye brag ma lus par mkhyen pa chos dang don dang nges pa'i tshig dang spobs pa mkhyen pa mthar phyin pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi yan lag re re la yang rnam par nges pa tha dad
analyzed: gdul bya'i skye bo'i bye brag la ltos nas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis lugs dang mthun pa dang / lugs dang mi mthun pa dang / nag po dang dkar po'i phyogs dang / tshang ba dang yan lag ma tshang ba la sogs par 'chad pa tha dad pa rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ston pa'i mdo sde gzhan rnam pa mang po la bdag gis brjod pa'am brtag par lta ga la nus / rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i bye brag ma lus par mkhyen pa chos dang don dang nges pa'i tshig dang spobs pa mkhyen pa mthar phyin pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi yan lag re re la yang rnam par nges pa tha dad
translated: In dependence upon the various types of disciples, the Bhagavan Buddha taught many different types of dependent arising, such as forward and reverse, black and white, complete and incomplete. How could I describe or analyze all of these in other sūtras that teach dependent arising?

original: pa mtha' yas pa dag bdag gis ga la rtogs /
analyzed: pa mtha' yas pa dag bdag gis ga la rtogs /
translated: The buddhas and the great bodhisattvas, who have perfected the knowledge of phenomena, the knowledge of meaning, the knowledge of language, and the knowledge of confidence, know all the different types of dependent arising without exception. How could I, in each of their branches, understand their infinite different certainties?

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang po dang rnam par 'byed pa gnyis pa bstan pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba dang po dang rnam par 'byed pa gnyis pa bstan pa rdzogs so /
translated: The teaching of the first dependent origination and the second differentiation is complete.

original: // / de nas gzhan yang gseb nas phyogs 'ga'i rnam par nges pa cung zad bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: // / de nas gzhan yang gseb nas phyogs 'ga'i rnam par nges pa cung zad bstan par bya'o //
translated: Now, moreover, a little determination of the directions will be taught.

original: mdo sde'i don ston pa rtsom pa'i tshe dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa byed pa na /
analyzed: mdo sde'i don ston pa rtsom pa'i tshe dkon mchog gsum la mchod pa byed pa na /
translated: When one composes a teaching of the meaning of the sūtras, one should make offerings to the Three Jewels.

original: bstod pa dang tshad kyi sgo nas byed pa de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: bstod pa dang tshad kyi sgo nas byed pa de yang ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: When one does so by way of praise and measure, why is that?

original: ston pa po dang bstan pa dang slob ma'i yon tan phun sum tshogs pa brjod pas mdo sde 'di la gus pa'i bye brag skyed pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ston pa po dang bstan pa dang slob ma'i yon tan phun sum tshogs pa brjod pas mdo sde 'di la gus pa'i bye brag skyed pa'i phyir te /
translated: It is in order to generate a special respect for this sūtra by proclaiming the excellence of the qualities of the teacher, the teaching, and the disciples.

original: kha cig de'i 'phro lus pa dang de la zhugs pa dang / de 'dor ba dag kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kha cig de'i 'phro lus pa dang de la zhugs pa dang / de 'dor ba dag kyang yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because some have a remainder of that, some have entered that, and some have abandoned that.

original: sangs rgyas la bstod phas yon tan phun sum tshogs pa du zhig brjod ce na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas la bstod phas yon tan phun sum tshogs pa du zhig brjod ce na /
translated: How many kinds of excellence of qualities are proclaimed in the praise of the Buddha?

original: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: ye shes phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: The excellence of wisdom is as follows.

original: shes bya thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i ye shes yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shes bya thams cad la thogs pa med pa'i ye shes yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is the intuition unobstructed as to all that is to be known.

original: spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: spangs pa phun sum tshogs pa ste /
translated: It is the perfection of abandonment,

original: nyon mongs pa'i phra rgyas thams cad bag chags dang @57b bcas te spangs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i phra rgyas thams cad bag chags dang @57b bcas te spangs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because all the propensities of the passions along with their instincts have been abandoned.

original: thugs rje phun sum tshogs pa ni 'jig rten pa rnams 'khor ba'i mi bde ba thams cad las yongs su skyob ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: thugs rje phun sum tshogs pa ni 'jig rten pa rnams 'khor ba'i mi bde ba thams cad las yongs su skyob ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the perfection of compassion, because it protects the world from all the miseries of cyclic existence.

original: mi zad pa phun sum tshogs pa ni 'khor ba'i mthar thug par mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi zad pa phun sum tshogs pa ni 'khor ba'i mthar thug par mnga' ba'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the perfection of inexhaustibility, because it is present until the end of cyclic existence.

original: 'jig pas na 'jig rten zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'jig pas na 'jig rten zhes bya ste /
translated: The world is so called because it is perishable.

original: de'i mtha' las 'das pa'o ;
analyzed: de'i mtha' las 'das pa'o ;
translated: It is beyond the world, because it is beyond the world of transmigration.

original: / mtshungs pa med pa nyid phun sum tshogs pa ni sems can thams cad kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: / mtshungs pa med pa nyid phun sum tshogs pa ni sems can thams cad kyi mchog yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the perfection of being without equal, because it is the best of all beings.

original: de ltar len pa rnams la bcom ldan 'das kyis chos dang zang zing gi sbyin pas ni gzhan mtha' dag la phan gdags par nus pa'i bya ba nyid dang / de bya bar 'dod pa nyid dang / rtag pa'i gnas thob pa nyid dang ; gcig tu skyabs su gyur pa brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar len pa rnams la bcom ldan 'das kyis chos dang zang zing gi sbyin pas ni gzhan mtha' dag la phan gdags par nus pa'i bya ba nyid dang / de bya bar 'dod pa nyid dang / rtag pa'i gnas thob pa nyid dang ; gcig tu skyabs su gyur pa brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, the Lord has declared that the taking of these perfections is the very activity that is able to benefit all others through the gift of the Dharma and material gifts, it is the very desire to perform that activity, it is the attainment of the state of permanence, and it is the sole refuge.

original: chos kyi yon tan phun sum tshogs par brjod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos kyi yon tan phun sum tshogs par brjod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the declaration of the excellence of the qualities of the Dharma?

original: chos la bstod pa 'dir rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: chos la bstod pa 'dir rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Here, the praise of the Dharma is threefold:

original: 'bras bu'i chos 'di mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i chos 'di mya ngan las 'das pa'o //
translated: The result Dharma is nirvana.

original: sgrub pa'i chos 'di lam mo //
analyzed: sgrub pa'i chos 'di lam mo //
translated: The practice Dharma is the path.

original: bshad pa'i chos ni de 'chad pa'o //
analyzed: bshad pa'i chos ni de 'chad pa'o //
translated: The explanatory Dharma is the teaching of those two.

original: de de la dang po yon tan phun sum tshogs pa ni sdug bsngal rgyu dang bcas pa thams cad shin tu zhi ba'i phyir zhi ba nyid dang / gnas pa nyid de las mi g-yos pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de de la dang po yon tan phun sum tshogs pa ni sdug bsngal rgyu dang bcas pa thams cad shin tu zhi ba'i phyir zhi ba nyid dang / gnas pa nyid de las mi g-yos pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Of these, the excellence of the qualities of the first is peace, because it is the complete pacification of all suffering and its causes, and it is stability, because it does not move from that.

original: de ltar na de ni dge ba nyid dang / rtog pa nyid du brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na de ni dge ba nyid dang / rtog pa nyid du brjod pa yin no //
translated: Thus, it is said to be virtuous and conceptual.

original: gnyis pa'i ni de 'thob par byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: gnyis pa'i ni de 'thob par byed pa nyid do //
translated: The second is the cause of attaining it.

original: gsum pa'i ni de dag gsal bar byed pa nyid do //
analyzed: gsum pa'i ni de dag gsal bar byed pa nyid do //
translated: The third is the cause of manifesting it.

original: gsum char gyi yang de la dmigs pa'i shes pa ni 'khor ba dang mi mthun pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: gsum char gyi yang de la dmigs pa'i shes pa ni 'khor ba dang mi mthun pa nyid yin no //
translated: The knowledge that focuses on these three is incompatible with cyclic existence.

original: dge 'dun gyi yon tan phun sum tshogs par brjod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi yon tan phun sum tshogs par brjod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the expression of the excellence of the qualities of the Saṅgha?

original: mdor na mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pas bcings pa las grol ba nyid dang / dge 'dun gzhan las khyad par du gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: mdor na mthong ba dang bsgom pas spang bar bya ba'i nyon mongs pas bcings pa las grol ba nyid dang / dge 'dun gzhan las khyad par du gyur pa nyid do //
translated: In brief, it is the freedom from the bondage of the mental afflictions that are to be abandoned by means of seeing and meditation, and it is the state of being superior to other Saṅghas.

original: rgyas par byas na yang mi slob pa'i dge 'dun gyi ni yan lag bcu dang ldan pa nyid de /
analyzed: rgyas par byas na yang mi slob pa'i dge 'dun gyi ni yan lag bcu dang ldan pa nyid de /
translated: If it is expressed in an extensive manner, then the Saṅgha of those who are beyond training possesses ten qualities.

original: rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa nyid dang / de'i 'bras bu rnam par grol ba nyid dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes phun sum tshogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa nyid dang / de'i 'bras bu rnam par grol ba nyid dang / rnam par grol ba'i ye shes phun sum tshogs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is endowed with knowledge and conduct, and it possesses the result of that knowledge and conduct, which is the perfection of the liberation of mind and the perfection of the knowledge of the liberation of mind.

original: slob pa'i dge 'dun gyi yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: slob pa'i dge 'dun gyi yan lag brgyad dang ldan pa nyid yin te /
translated: The Saṅgha of learners possesses eight branches,

original: rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rig pa dang zhabs su ldan pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it possesses the knowledge and the feet.

original: gnyis ka'i ni yan lag de'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gnyis ka'i ni yan lag de'i gnas skabs kyi bye brag yin pa'i phyir /
translated: The Saṅgha of both possesses the specific states of those two.

original: ji ltar rigs par 'bras bu bzhi'i lam dang / lam bzhi'i 'bras bu'i sgo nas phun sum tshogs pa brgyad do //
analyzed: ji ltar rigs par 'bras bu bzhi'i lam dang / lam bzhi'i 'bras bu'i sgo nas phun sum tshogs pa brgyad do //
translated: The Saṅgha is perfect in eight ways, in terms of the four results and the four paths, as is fitting.

original: @58a * // ci'i phyir 'di bshad ce na /
analyzed: @58a * // ci'i phyir 'di bshad ce na /
translated: Why is this taught?

original: mdo sde mang po bshad pa'i dgos pa ni yang dag par bstan pa dang / gdams pa dang / gzengs bstod pa dang yang dag par dga' bar bya ste /
analyzed: mdo sde mang po bshad pa'i dgos pa ni yang dag par bstan pa dang / gdams pa dang / gzengs bstod pa dang yang dag par dga' bar bya ste /
translated: The purpose of explaining many sūtras is to teach, instruct, inspire, and delight.

original: gdul bya kun du rmongs pa dang // bag med pa dang kun tu zhum pa dang / yang dag par zhugs pa rnams las gnyis sam gsum mam bzhi'i bye brag tha dad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gdul bya kun du rmongs pa dang // bag med pa dang kun tu zhum pa dang / yang dag par zhugs pa rnams las gnyis sam gsum mam bzhi'i bye brag tha dad pa'i phyir te /
translated: There are four types of disciples: those who are confused, those who are heedless, those who are discouraged, and those who are correctly engaged.

original: gcig pu yang don kha cig la kun du rmongs pa nas kha cig la yang dag par zhugs pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gcig pu yang don kha cig la kun du rmongs pa nas kha cig la yang dag par zhugs pa'i bar du 'gyur ro //
translated: Moreover, the single person is confused about some things and engages correctly in regard to other things.

original: 'di ltar mdo sde gzhan las bcom ldan 'das kyis gang zag de dang de'i ched du ston par mdzad 'doms par mdzad gzengs bstod par mdzad yang dag par dga' bar mdzad ces gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di ltar mdo sde gzhan las bcom ldan 'das kyis gang zag de dang de'i ched du ston par mdzad 'doms par mdzad gzengs bstod par mdzad yang dag par dga' bar mdzad ces gsungs so //
translated: Thus, in other sūtras, the Bhagavat teaches, instructs, rouses, and delights that person for that purpose.

original: de la dgos pa'i dgos pa yang mang ste /🔽yid 'byung bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: de la dgos pa'i dgos pa yang mang ste / yid 'byung bar bya ba'am /
translated: The purpose of the purpose is also manifold.🔽It is to cause disgust,

original: rab tu dang bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: rab tu dang bar bya ba'am /
translated: to cause faith,

original: ser sna la sogs ba'i nyes pa bzlog pa'am /
analyzed: ser sna la sogs ba'i nyes pa bzlog pa'am /
translated: to avert faults such as miserliness,

original: de'i gnyen po yon tan gyi khyad par sgrub pa'am /
analyzed: de'i gnyen po yon tan gyi khyad par sgrub pa'am /
translated: to establish the special qualities that are the antidotes to those,

original: de'i rjes su 'jug pa ste de la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'jug pa ste de la sogs pa'o //
translated: and to engage in those.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba 'di la kha cig rgol bar byed pa po mthun pa can gyi bya ba byed pa gnyis las bya ba byed pa snga ma la ste zhes bya ba yod pa mthong ste /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba 'di la kha cig rgol bar byed pa po mthun pa can gyi bya ba byed pa gnyis las bya ba byed pa snga ma la ste zhes bya ba yod pa mthong ste /
translated: Some argue that in this dependent origination, the activity of the agent is seen in the first activity, which is the activity of the one who has a companion.

original: dper na langs te 'gro ba dang 'dug ste za ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na langs te 'gro ba dang 'dug ste za ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like standing up and walking, or sitting down and eating.

original: gang sngar rten te phyis skye bar 'gyur ba skye ba'i snga rol na de yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang sngar rten te phyis skye bar 'gyur ba skye ba'i snga rol na de yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If something exists prior to arising, then it would arise again.

original: de bas rten te 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba 'di ni sbyor ba legs pa ma yin no zhe'o //🔽de la gzhan dag lan 'debs pa 'di la ste zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de bas rten te 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba 'di ni sbyor ba legs pa ma yin no zhe'o // de la gzhan dag lan 'debs pa 'di la ste zhes bya ba yod pa ma yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, this so-called dependent origination is not a good theory.

original: rten te 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba /
analyzed: rten te 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba /
translated: In response to this, others say that this so-called dependent origination🔽is not a good theory.

original: pra t'i tya sa mutp'a da la pra zhes bya ba ni mang ba'i don to ;
analyzed: pra t'i tya sa mutp'a da la pra zhes bya ba ni mang ba'i don to ;
translated: In pratītyasamutpāda, the prefix pra means “many.”

original: / ai tya zhes bya ba ni gang 'jig pa zhig par 'gyur ba skyes pa mi gnas pa rnam par 'jig pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: / ai tya zhes bya ba ni gang 'jig pa zhig par 'gyur ba skyes pa mi gnas pa rnam par 'jig pa zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The suffix -ta means “that which is destroyed, that which is annihilated, that which arises and does not endure, that which is destroyed.”

original: sa ma zhes bya ba ni 'du ba'i don to //
analyzed: sa ma zhes bya ba ni 'du ba'i don to //
translated: The suffix -ya means “to come together.”

original: 'di skad bstan te /
analyzed: 'di skad bstan te /
translated: This is what is being said:

original: rgyu de dang de dag tshogs pa dang 'jig pa rnams 'du ba'i tshul gyis skye ba ni rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu de dang de dag tshogs pa dang 'jig pa rnams 'du ba'i tshul gyis skye ba ni rten cing 'brel te 'byung ba zhes bya'o //
translated: The arising of the collection and dissolution of these causes and effects in the manner of a convergence is called dependent origination.

original: de'i ni de dag lan du rung na mig dang gzugs la brten te mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di ni mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de'i ni de dag lan du rung na mig dang gzugs la brten te mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes bya ba la sogs pa 'di ni mi rung ngo //
translated: If that were the case, then it would be incorrect to say, “Eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and forms.”

original: gzhan dag na re rten te 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba la ste zhes bya ba yod pa 'di ni pha rol dang tshu rol sbyor ba yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan dag na re rten te 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba la ste zhes bya ba yod pa 'di ni pha rol dang tshu rol sbyor ba yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Others say: The term dependent origination is a compound meaning “having a connection.” It should be understood that this compound is applied to both the prior and subsequent terms.

original: dper na chu brgal te ri yod pa dang / dbyar 'das te @58b ston byung ba lta bu yin pas de dag gis mig dang gzugs la brten te mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes ba 'di yang pha rol dang tshu rol sbyor ba tsam yin par mngon gyi /
analyzed: dper na chu brgal te ri yod pa dang / dbyar 'das te @58b ston byung ba lta bu yin pas de dag gis mig dang gzugs la brten te mig gi rnam par shes pa skye'o zhes ba 'di yang pha rol dang tshu rol sbyor ba tsam yin par mngon gyi /
translated: For example, it is like the expressions “having crossed the river, the mountain is there” and “having passed the summer, autumn arrives.” Therefore it is clear that the statement “Eye consciousness arises in dependence on the eye and forms” is merely an application of the compound to both the prior and subsequent terms.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni ma yin no zhes zer na /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po ni ma yin no zhes zer na /
translated: It is not a statement of the relationship of cause and effect.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rkyen dang dmigs pa 'das pa yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i rkyen dang dmigs pa 'das pa yin par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It follows that the condition and the object of the eye consciousness are past.

original: de la yang 'dus pa brtag pa las skyon bstan zin to //
analyzed: de la yang 'dus pa brtag pa las skyon bstan zin to //
translated: And the error in that has already been demonstrated in the examination of the aggregates.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba bye brag med par bstan pa la pha rol nyid gang la rten te 'brel par 'byung ba bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya ba bye brag med par bstan pa la pha rol nyid gang la rten te 'brel par 'byung ba bcom ldan 'das kyis bstan /
translated: In the teaching of dependent origination, which is taught without distinction, the Blessed One taught that dependent origination is based on the other.

original: de thas na 'di yang len du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de thas na 'di yang len du mi rung ngo //
translated: Therefore, this is also not a proper example.

original: te zhes bya ba yod pa ni rgyu'i don la mthong ngo zhes sngar bstan zin to //
analyzed: te zhes bya ba yod pa ni rgyu'i don la mthong ngo zhes sngar bstan zin to //
translated: The word “te” is seen to have the meaning of cause, as was previously explained.

original: byed pa po mi mthun pa la yang mthong ste /
analyzed: byed pa po mi mthun pa la yang mthong ste /
translated: It is also seen in the case of an agent that is not similar.

original: 'jig rten na mar 'thungs te stobs yod do zhes bya ba dang / seng ge mthong ste 'jigs so zhes bya ba dang / bha ra ta las kyang 'dro na'i bu ngo mtshar cher 'gyur ba'i bros pa mthong ste /
analyzed: 'jig rten na mar 'thungs te stobs yod do zhes bya ba dang / seng ge mthong ste 'jigs so zhes bya ba dang / bha ra ta las kyang 'dro na'i bu ngo mtshar cher 'gyur ba'i bros pa mthong ste /
translated: In the world, it is said, “Having drunk milk, there is strength,” and “Having seen a lion, there is fear,” and in the Bharata it says, “Having seen the amazing flight of the son of Drona.”

original: shin tu mi'i las kyis yin no zhes khyod nga la 'jigs pa chen po byung ngo zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: shin tu mi'i las kyis yin no zhes khyod nga la 'jigs pa chen po byung ngo zhes bya ba lta bu'o //
translated: The meaning of the locative case is the meaning of the cause, as in the expressions “in the wood” and “in the house.”

original: sgra la 'chel ba kha cig dag na re byed pa po mi mthun pa la ste'i don yod pa ni rgyu'i don yin par sngon gyi slob dpon dag smra ba bya t'i so'u nag la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes zer ro //
analyzed: sgra la 'chel ba kha cig dag na re byed pa po mi mthun pa la ste'i don yod pa ni rgyu'i don yin par sngon gyi slob dpon dag smra ba bya t'i so'u nag la sogs pa lta bu'o zhes zer ro //
translated: Some, attached to words, say: “The locative case with a different agent has the meaning of cause, as in the expressions ‘in the wood’ and ‘in the house.’ The ancient masters say that the locative case with the same agent has the meaning of time, as in the expressions ‘in the morning’ and ‘in the evening.’

original: dus mthun par bya ba byed pa la yang mthong ste /
analyzed: dus mthun par bya ba byed pa la yang mthong ste /
translated: ” We see that the locative case also has the meaning of time with the same agent.

original: kha gdangs te nyal ba dang ; mig zlog ste nyal ba lta bu'o //
analyzed: kha gdangs te nyal ba dang ; mig zlog ste nyal ba lta bu'o //
translated: For example, “lying with the mouth open” and “lying with the eyes turned back.”

original: 'di ci zhe na /🔽kha gdangs pa'am mig zlog ste dus phyis nyal ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ci zhe na / kha gdangs pa'am mig zlog ste dus phyis nyal ba ma yin no //
translated: What is the meaning of these expressions?

original: sngar kha gdangs sam /
analyzed: sngar kha gdangs sam /
translated: It is not a matter of lying with the mouth open or with the eyes turned back after having been open or turned back.🔽It is a matter of lying with the mouth open or with the eyes turned back, having been so before falling asleep.

original: mig zlog ste phyis nyal ba de ltar ni 'dir don 'di rtogs par bya ba ma yin gyi /
analyzed: mig zlog ste phyis nyal ba de ltar ni 'dir don 'di rtogs par bya ba ma yin gyi /
translated: This is not the meaning of the expressions in question.

original: 'on kyang gnyid log pa nyid kha gdangs pa dang mig zlog par rtogs par bya'o ;
analyzed: 'on kyang gnyid log pa nyid kha gdangs pa dang mig zlog par rtogs par bya'o ;
translated: Rather, it is a matter of understanding that the mouth is open or the eyes are turned back while one is falling asleep.

original: / dus phyis bya ba byed pa la yang mthong ste rnga'i byed pa la brten te dbyu gu rdeg pa lta bu ste /
analyzed: / dus phyis bya ba byed pa la yang mthong ste rnga'i byed pa la brten te dbyu gu rdeg pa lta bu ste /
translated: It is also seen that the effect is produced later, as in the case of the striking of the drum.

original: rnga ni sngar byed la phyis dbyu gu rdeg pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rnga ni sngar byed la phyis dbyu gu rdeg pa ni ma yin no //
translated: The drum is produced first, and the striking of the drum is not produced later.

original: dus mnyam pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: dus mnyam pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it simultaneous,

original: sgra ni brdabs pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgra ni brdabs pa'i rgyu las byung ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the sound is produced from the cause of the striking.

original: de ltar ni pha rol dang tshu rol ba zhes zer ba pa ni ni bdag kyang 'dod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar ni pha rol dang tshu rol ba zhes zer ba pa ni ni bdag kyang 'dod pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the so-called “other side” and “this side” are not accepted by us.

original: kyang zhes bya ba ci'i phyir smos she na 'jig rten dang / bha ra ta dang sgra la 'chel ba bya t'i so'u na ga la sogs pas kyang bstan bcos 'di'i rjes su 'jug pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: kyang zhes bya ba ci'i phyir smos she na 'jig rten dang / bha ra ta dang sgra la 'chel ba bya t'i so'u na ga la sogs pas kyang bstan bcos 'di'i rjes su 'jug pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Why is the word “also” used? It is used because the worldly people, the followers of the Bharata, and the followers of the Sounakas, etc., do not accept this treatise.

original: de bas na de dag gis kyang nges pa kho nar 'di 'dod par bya dgos so //
analyzed: de bas na de dag gis kyang nges pa kho nar 'di 'dod par bya dgos so //
translated: Therefore, they must certainly accept it.

original: 'jig rten pa yang tha snyad byed pa'i tshe @59a * //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa yang tha snyad byed pa'i tshe @59a * //
translated: When worldly people use conventions,

original: sangs rgyas pa'i rjes su 'jug pa yin gyi /
analyzed: sangs rgyas pa'i rjes su 'jug pa yin gyi /
translated: they follow the Buddhists.

original: rig byed pa dag gi yang ma yin na rig byed kyi yan lag dang / by'a ka ra na pa dag gi lta ga la yin /
analyzed: rig byed pa dag gi yang ma yin na rig byed kyi yan lag dang / by'a ka ra na pa dag gi lta ga la yin /
translated: And if it is not even the case that the Vedas are the work of God, how could the Vedāṅgas and the Vyākaraṇa be the work of God?

original: sangs rgyas rnams ni de la gnas par mi byed de /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams ni de la gnas par mi byed de /
translated: The buddhas do not rely on that,

original: bsnyems pa dag gis byas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bsnyems pa dag gis byas pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is created by the proud.

original: de lta ma yin na sgra'i tshul bkod pa de dag kyang sangs rgyas kyi rjes su 'jug par bya dgos par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na sgra'i tshul bkod pa de dag kyang sangs rgyas kyi rjes su 'jug par bya dgos par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it were not so, then those who follow the Buddha would have to rely on the arrangement of the rules of grammar.

original: re zhig sgra la 'chel ba de dag la 'di 'dri bar bya ste /
analyzed: re zhig sgra la 'chel ba de dag la 'di 'dri bar bya ste /
translated: Those who are attached to words should be asked this:

original: chos kyi gnas skabs skye ba ci bdag nyid thob pa'am 'on te ma thob pa yin /
analyzed: chos kyi gnas skabs skye ba ci bdag nyid thob pa'am 'on te ma thob pa yin /
translated: Is the arising of the state of dharma obtained by itself or not?🔽If it is obtained by itself, then since it has already arisen, what function does arising perform?

original: gal te bdag nyid thob par yin na de skyes pa kho na yin pa'i phyir ci zhig bya ba byed na skye ba yin no zhes brjod 'on te bdag nyid ma thob pa yin na de'i tshe yod pa ma yin pas med pa yin na ji ltar byed🔽pa po nyid yin par 'grub /
analyzed: gal te bdag nyid thob par yin na de skyes pa kho na yin pa'i phyir ci zhig bya ba byed na skye ba yin no zhes brjod 'on te bdag nyid ma thob pa yin na de'i tshe yod pa ma yin pas med pa yin na ji ltar byed🔽pa po nyid yin par 'grub /
translated: But if it is not obtained by itself, then at that time it does not exist. If it does not exist, how can it be an agent?

original: 'on te med pa yang byed pa po nyid yin par brtag par bya na /
analyzed: 'on te med pa yang byed pa po nyid yin par brtag par bya na /
translated: But if you imagine that a non-existent is an agent,

original: gang sngar bstan nas phyis skye'o zhes bya bar skye ba'i snga rol na de yod pa ma yin no zhes ji ltar rtsod pa 'di byed ;
analyzed: gang sngar bstan nas phyis skye'o zhes bya bar skye ba'i snga rol na de yod pa ma yin no zhes ji ltar rtsod pa 'di byed ;
translated: then how can you argue that “prior to arising, it does not exist,” since you have already taught that it arises later?

original: 'di yang 'di la dri bar bya ste /
analyzed: 'di yang 'di la dri bar bya ste /
translated: You should be questioned about this:

original: 'byung zhes bya ba'i don gang yin /
analyzed: 'byung zhes bya ba'i don gang yin /
translated: What is the meaning of “arising”?

original: skye zhes pa'i don yin no //
analyzed: skye zhes pa'i don yin no //
translated: The meaning of “arising” is “coming into existence.”

original: skye ba gang yin pa de ci zhig byed na 'di ltar byed pa po zhes brjod /
analyzed: skye ba gang yin pa de ci zhig byed na 'di ltar byed pa po zhes brjod /
translated: What does that which arises do such that it is called an agent?

original: skye ba la byed do zhe na ni /
analyzed: skye ba la byed do zhe na ni /
translated: If you say that it is the agent of arising,

original: gal te skye zhes bya ba skye bzhin pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yin na ni ji ltar bdag nyid la byed par rung /
analyzed: gal te skye zhes bya ba skye bzhin pa'i bdag nyid du gyur pa yin na ni ji ltar bdag nyid la byed par rung /
translated: if that which is called “arising” is the self-existence of that which is in the process of arising, how could it be the agent of itself?

original: 'on te bdag nyid du gyur pa ma yin na ni de las gzhan du mi dmigs so //
analyzed: 'on te bdag nyid du gyur pa ma yin na ni de las gzhan du mi dmigs so //
translated: But if it is not the self-existence of that which is in the process of arising, it is not observed to be different from that.

original: byed ces bya ba'i don yang 'jig rten na rnam par mang du snang ste /
analyzed: byed ces bya ba'i don yang 'jig rten na rnam par mang du snang ste /
translated: The meaning of “to do” appears in many ways in the world.

original: bde ba byed do zhes bya ba ni skyed par byed do zhes bya bar mngon pa yin no //
analyzed: bde ba byed do zhes bya ba ni skyed par byed do zhes bya bar mngon pa yin no //

original: gal te skye bar byed pa yin no zhe na ni skye ba dag yang skye bar 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
analyzed: gal te skye bar byed pa yin no zhe na ni skye ba dag yang skye bar 'gyur ro zhes ston to //
translated: If you say that it is the producer, then production would be produced again.

original: de las kyang gzhan skye bar thal bar 'gyur bas thug pa @59b med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las kyang gzhan skye bar thal bar 'gyur bas thug pa @59b med par thal bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And since it would be produced from that, there would be an infinite regress.

original: de bas na bya ba byed pa med par yang bdag thob pa tsam la byed pa po bzhin du skye bar byed do zhes bstan to //
analyzed: de bas na bya ba byed pa med par yang bdag thob pa tsam la byed pa po bzhin du skye bar byed do zhes bstan to //
translated: Therefore, it is taught that even without the performance of action, just as the self is the experiencer in the mere attainment of the result, so it is the producer in the mere production of the effect.

original: rkyen yod pa tsam la yang rten te zhes bya ba yin gyi /
analyzed: rkyen yod pa tsam la yang rten te zhes bya ba yin gyi /
translated: It is said that “it occurs in dependence on the mere presence of conditions,”

original: 'di la bya ba byed pa ni gang yang med /
analyzed: 'di la bya ba byed pa ni gang yang med /
translated: but there is no performance of action at all.

original: byed pa po yang gang yang med na 'di gnyis byed pa po dang lhan cig pa lta ga la yod /
analyzed: byed pa po yang gang yang med na 'di gnyis byed pa po dang lhan cig pa lta ga la yod /
translated: And if there is no performer, how could there be a performance of action together with a performer?

original: de bas na rten te 'byung zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba 'di ni rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rten te 'byung zhes bya ba'i sbyor ba 'di ni rigs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, this application of the term “dependent origination” is correct.

original: 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni bar med cing ma chod pa zhes bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'brel par 'byung ba zhes bya ba ni bar med cing ma chod pa zhes bya ba yin no //
translated: “Conditioned origination” means “without interval or interruption.”

original: de lta yin dang 'das pa las gang yang skye ba med par bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: de lta yin dang 'das pa las gang yang skye ba med par bstan pa yin no //
translated: If that were the case, it would be taught that nothing is produced from the past.

original: gang yang mdo sde gzhan las gang 'dir chos nyid dang / chos gnas pa nyid dang ; chos nges pa nyid ces rgyas par byas nas 'di ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa la /
analyzed: gang yang mdo sde gzhan las gang 'dir chos nyid dang / chos gnas pa nyid dang ; chos nges pa nyid ces rgyas par byas nas 'di ni rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba zhes bya'o zhes gsungs pa la /
translated: “Here, the reality of phenomena, the stability of phenomena, and the certainty of phenomena are called dependent origination.”

original: chos nyid ces bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos nyid ces bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is reality?

original: gang chos rnams kyi bdag nyid kho na yin te /
analyzed: gang chos rnams kyi bdag nyid kho na yin te /
translated: It is the very nature of phenomena.

original: 'di yod na 'di 'byung 'di skyes pas 'di skye ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: 'di yod na 'di 'byung 'di skyes pas 'di skye ba zhes bya ba gang yin pa'o //
translated: When this exists, that arises; due to the arising of this, that arises.

original: skye ba zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi bdag nyid thob pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba zhes bya ba ni chos rnams kyi bdag nyid thob pa'o //
translated: Arising is the attainment of the very nature of phenomena.

original: chos nyid ji ltar skye ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: chos nyid ji ltar skye ba yin zhe na /
translated: How can reality arise?

original: chos de chos gzhan la brten nas bdag nyid thob pa'o //
analyzed: chos de chos gzhan la brten nas bdag nyid thob pa'o //
translated: That phenomenon attains its own nature in dependence on another phenomenon.

original: da ltar byung ba'i dus kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bstan pas dus gsum pa'i shes par bya ba'i phyir chos nyid bstan /
analyzed: da ltar byung ba'i dus kyi rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bstan pas dus gsum pa'i shes par bya ba'i phyir chos nyid bstan /
translated: The reality of phenomena is taught in order to understand the three times through the teaching of present dependent origination.

original: chos gnas pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos gnas pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the stability of phenomena?

original: chos nyid de nyid la bya'o //
analyzed: chos nyid de nyid la bya'o //
translated: It is that very reality.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is it so?

original: bcos ma ma yin pa'i don gyis te /
analyzed: bcos ma ma yin pa'i don gyis te /
translated: It is not fabricated,🔽As the Lord has said:

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni ngas byas ba ma yin gzhan gyis kyang byas pa ma yin gyi /
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong dag rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba ni ngas byas ba ma yin gzhan gyis kyang byas pa ma yin gyi /
translated: Monks, dependent origination is not made by me, nor by any other.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa byung yang rung ma byung yang rung /
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa byung yang rung ma byung yang rung /
translated: Whether Tathagatas arise or not,

original: chos nyid 'di ni ye nas gnas pa ste /
analyzed: chos nyid 'di ni ye nas gnas pa ste /
translated: this principle of Dharmahood remains.

original: chos gnas pa nyid dbyings yin no zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: chos gnas pa nyid dbyings yin no zhes gsungs so //
translated: The realm of Dharma is the realm of Dharmahood.

original: dbyings zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na /
analyzed: dbyings zhes bya ba 'di ci zhe na /
translated: What is this realm of Dharma?

original: bye brag gang gis gzhan dag gzhan gyi rgyur 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: bye brag gang gis gzhan dag gzhan gyi rgyur 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: It is the cause of other things, by virtue of its particularity.

original: nges pa'i tshig tu na 'dis rgyu nyid 'dzin pas dbyings zhes bya'o //
analyzed: nges pa'i tshig tu na 'dis rgyu nyid 'dzin pas dbyings zhes bya'o //
translated: Etymologically, it is called the realm because it holds the cause.

original: chos nyid nges pa nyid gang zhe na /
analyzed: chos nyid nges pa nyid gang zhe na /
translated: What is the certainty of Dharmahood?

original: chos nyid gang yin pa de nyid 'khrul pa med pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: chos nyid gang yin pa de nyid 'khrul pa med pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: It is the absence of error in that very Dharmahood.

original: de ltar na chos nyid kyi tshig gnyis kyis ni gtan du ba gang yin pa dang / gcig kho na ra nges pa nyid gang yin pa bsten to //
analyzed: de ltar na chos nyid kyi tshig gnyis kyis ni gtan du ba gang yin pa dang / gcig kho na ra nges pa nyid gang yin pa bsten to //
translated: Thus, the two phrases “reality” and “ultimate” indicate that which is eternal and that which is ascertained as one only.

original: de las gzhan ba'i tshig rnams ni rjes su 'brel bar 'chad pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan ba'i tshig rnams ni rjes su 'brel bar 'chad pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The other phrases should be understood as being related to these two.

original: yang na dum bu gsum pa'o //
analyzed: yang na dum bu gsum pa'o //
translated: Or else, there are three sections.

original: gal te rig pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs chos gzhan ma rig pa yin na 'di ltar nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa ste /🔽yi ge 'dri ba dang bstan bcos dang / bzo dang nad dang nad gzhi @60a * //
analyzed: gal te rig pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs chos gzhan ma rig pa yin na 'di ltar nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa ste / yi ge 'dri ba dang bstan bcos dang / bzo dang nad dang nad gzhi @60a * //
translated: If ignorance is a factor that is adverse to knowledge, then it is non-knowledge that is morally non-defined.🔽This is the non-knowledge of the letters, the treatises, the arts, the crafts, the diseases, the remedies, and so on, and the non-knowledge of the objects of the Buddhas.

original: dang ; sman la sogs pa dang sangs rgyas rnams kyi yul mi shes pa ni dgra bcom pa rnams la yang dngos su yod pa'o //🔽de dag ci shes pa de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs chos gzhan zhig yin nam /
analyzed: dang ; sman la sogs pa dang sangs rgyas rnams kyi yul mi shes pa ni dgra bcom pa rnams la yang dngos su yod pa'o // de dag ci shes pa de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs chos gzhan zhig yin nam /
translated: This is actually present in the Arhats.🔽Is this a factor that is adverse to that knowledge?

original: 'on te shes pa med pa tsam yin /
analyzed: 'on te shes pa med pa tsam yin /
translated: Or is it simply the absence of knowledge?

original: ci nyes gal te shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs chos gzhan zhig yin na /
analyzed: ci nyes gal te shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs chos gzhan zhig yin na /
translated: If ignorance is a dharma that is the opposite of knowledge,

original: de ci gcig po kho na shes pa de dag thams cad kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin nam /🔽'on te shes pa so so'i gzhan yin /
analyzed: de ci gcig po kho na shes pa de dag thams cad kyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin nam / 'on te shes pa so so'i gzhan yin /
translated: is it the opposite of all knowledge, or is it the opposite of each kind of knowledge?

original: gal te gcig kho na yin na ni gcig la shes pa skyes na thams cad la mi shes pa ci'i phyir ldog par mi 'gyur /
analyzed: gal te gcig kho na yin na ni gcig la shes pa skyes na thams cad la mi shes pa ci'i phyir ldog par mi 'gyur /
translated: If it is the opposite of all knowledge, then when one kind of knowledge arises, why does ignorance not cease in all of it?

original: 'on te shes pa so so'i gzhan yin na ni nges na sems gcig la mi shes pa mtha' med pa dang mtshungs par ldan par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on te shes pa so so'i gzhan yin na ni nges na sems gcig la mi shes pa mtha' med pa dang mtshungs par ldan par 'grub par 'gyur ro //
translated: If it is the opposite of each kind of knowledge, then it is established that ignorance is associated with one mind as being equivalent to an infinity of ignorance.

original: lhan cig tu ma rig pa du ma'i rdzas yod par rung ba ma yin te /
analyzed: lhan cig tu ma rig pa du ma'i rdzas yod par rung ba ma yin te /
translated: It is not possible for many substances of ignorance to exist simultaneously,

original: dper na tshor ba la sogs pa'i rdzas bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na tshor ba la sogs pa'i rdzas bzhin no //
translated: like the substances of feeling and so on.

original: rdzas mtha' yas pa de dag sems can gyi rgyud kyi skad cig ma gcig yin par yang rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: rdzas mtha' yas pa de dag sems can gyi rgyud kyi skad cig ma gcig yin par yang rigs pa yin no //
translated: It is also reasonable that those infinite substances are in one moment of the mindstream of a sentient being.

original: 'on te shes pa'i dngos po med pa tsam de mi shes pa shes pa yin na ni mi shes pa thams cad kyang de bzhin du ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
analyzed: 'on te shes pa'i dngos po med pa tsam de mi shes pa shes pa yin na ni mi shes pa thams cad kyang de bzhin du ci'i phyir mi 'dod /
translated: But if the mere non-existence of the thing known is knowledge, then why not accept that all non-knowledge is the same?

original: nyon mongs can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa de yang bdag gis ma shes te /
analyzed: nyon mongs can ma yin pa'i mi shes pa de yang bdag gis ma shes te /
translated: We do not know that non-knowledge is not afflicted.

original: de ltar byas so zhes yang ba ma spangs pa'i rgyu nyid yin par nye bar brtags pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar byas so zhes yang ba ma spangs pa'i rgyu nyid yin par nye bar brtags pa yin no //
translated: It is merely imagined that the cause of not abandoning the heavy is that.

original: nyon mongs pa can ma yin na ni mi shes pa ni ji ltar 'dod pa de bzhin du zhog / nyon mongs pa can gyi ma rig pa ni rig pa'i dngos po med pa tsam ma yin par de ltar sngar shes par byas zin to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa can ma yin na ni mi shes pa ni ji ltar 'dod pa de bzhin du zhog / nyon mongs pa can gyi ma rig pa ni rig pa'i dngos po med pa tsam ma yin par de ltar sngar shes par byas zin to //
translated: If it is not afflicted, then let non-knowledge be as you say it is. But afflicted ignorance is not merely the non-existence of knowledge, as was previously explained.

original: gang dag yang mi shes pa thams cad ni shes pa'i mthun pa'i phyogs chos gzhan yin zhes smra ba de dag ni ma rig pa ni rnam pa gnyis su smra ste /
analyzed: gang dag yang mi shes pa thams cad ni shes pa'i mthun pa'i phyogs chos gzhan yin zhes smra ba de dag ni ma rig pa ni rnam pa gnyis su smra ste /
translated: Those who say that all non-knowledge is a different phenomenon that is conducive to knowledge, say that ignorance is of two types:

original: rtag tu kun du 'byung bar smra ba dang yid la byed pa na kun du 'byung bar smra ba'o //
analyzed: rtag tu kun du 'byung bar smra ba dang yid la byed pa na kun du 'byung bar smra ba'o //
translated: It is called “always active” when it is spoken of as always active in all objects, and it is called “active when it occurs” when it is spoken of as active in a particular object that has occurred.🔽The first is ignorance alone,

original: de la dang po ni mi shes pa gcig kho na yin te /
analyzed: de la dang po ni mi shes pa gcig kho na yin te /
translated: because it is the cause of the other four.

original: shes bya thams cad la shes ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs skad cig re re la 'byung ba ni yin par 'jog go //
analyzed: shes bya thams cad la shes ba'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs skad cig re re la 'byung ba ni yin par 'jog go //
translated: It is posited as the cause of the occurrence of the opposite of knowledge in every moment with regard to all objects of knowledge.🔽Because of the proximity of the specific conditions, when knowledge arises with regard to a particular object, the latent impressions of that object increase.

original: rkyen gyi bye brag nye bar gyur ba'i phyir yul gang la shes pa skyes pa na de'i bag chags brtas pa yod pa'i phyir ji tsam du shes pa de med par ma gyur gyi bar du de las gzhan pa'i dngos po la khyab par byed pa'i mi shes🔽pa gzhan gcig cig 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rkyen gyi bye brag nye bar gyur ba'i phyir yul gang la shes pa skyes pa na de'i bag chags brtas pa yod pa'i phyir ji tsam du shes pa de med par ma gyur gyi bar du de las gzhan pa'i dngos po la khyab par byed pa'i mi shes pa gzhan gcig cig 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: As long as that knowledge does not cease, another ignorance that pervades other objects will not arise.

original: shes pa de med par gyur na yang sngon ji lta ba bzhin du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: shes pa de med par gyur na yang sngon ji lta ba bzhin du 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: But when that knowledge ceases, it will arise as before.

original: de bzhin du yul gang dang gang la shes pa skyes pa na ji srid du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma thob kyi bar du yul de dang de las gzhan pa'i shes bya la shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi shes @60b pa gcig 'byung bar 'gyur ro
analyzed: de bzhin du yul gang dang gang la shes pa skyes pa na ji srid du thams cad mkhyen pa nyid ma thob kyi bar du yul de dang de las gzhan pa'i shes bya la shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi shes @60b pa gcig 'byung bar 'gyur ro
translated: Likewise, whenever a cognition arises with respect to any object, until omniscience is attained, there will be a non-cognition, i.e., non-cognizing, of all other objects of knowledge.

original: // dper na khang mig gcig na mun rum yod pa'i nang du gzugs gcig cig yod na yul de thams cad kyi mun pa ni rang gi dang gis 'gags te /
analyzed: // dper na khang mig gcig na mun rum yod pa'i nang du gzugs gcig cig yod na yul de thams cad kyi mun pa ni rang gi dang gis 'gags te /
translated: For example, in a single room, in the darkness, if a form is present, the darkness of the entire room is naturally blocked.

original: 'du byed thams cad skad cig ma ni 'jig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad skad cig ma ni 'jig pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all compounded phenomena are momentary and perishable.

original: gzugs kyi ngos gang du rtsig pa'i 'og gi bu ga nas snang ba byung ba ni ji srid du snang ba med par ma gyur gyi bar du de las gzhan pa'i yul lhag ma de dag nyid du mun pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzugs kyi ngos gang du rtsig pa'i 'og gi bu ga nas snang ba byung ba ni ji srid du snang ba med par ma gyur gyi bar du de las gzhan pa'i yul lhag ma de dag nyid du mun pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In the part of the form where light appears through a hole in the wall, as long as the light does not disappear, darkness will appear in the rest of the room.

original: snang ba nub na yang dus mnyam du sngon ji lta ba de bzhin du yang mun pa 'byung bar 'gyur te 'di ni dpe tsam du zad do //
analyzed: snang ba nub na yang dus mnyam du sngon ji lta ba de bzhin du yang mun pa 'byung bar 'gyur te 'di ni dpe tsam du zad do //
translated: Even when light disappears, darkness would arise simultaneously, just as it did before. This is merely an example.

original: 'o na da mi shes pa'i rdzas gcig pu 'di ji ltar na nyon mongs pa can yin la /
analyzed: 'o na da mi shes pa'i rdzas gcig pu 'di ji ltar na nyon mongs pa can yin la /
translated: Now, how can this single substance of ignorance be afflicted

original: nyon mongs pa ma yin pa yang yin /🔽nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang yin la /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa ma yin pa yang yin / nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa yang yin la /
translated: and also not afflicted,🔽associated with affliction and

original: mtshungs par mi ldan pa yang yin /🔽mi dge ba yang yin la /
analyzed: mtshungs par mi ldan pa yang yin / mi dge ba yang yin la /
translated: not associated with affliction,🔽nonvirtuous and

original: mi dge ba ma yin pa yang yin /🔽mthong bas spang bar bya ba yang yin la /
analyzed: mi dge ba ma yin pa yang yin / mthong bas spang bar bya ba yang yin la /
translated: not nonvirtuous,🔽to be abandoned by the path of seeing and

original: des spang bar bya ba ma yin pa yang yin par rung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: des spang bar bya ba ma yin pa yang yin par rung bar 'gyur /
translated: not to be abandoned by the path of seeing?

original: ji ltar nyon mongs pa de'i gnyen po bden ba shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su 'dug pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rkyen du 'gyur ba de ltar nyon mongs pa yin par rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: ji ltar nyon mongs pa de'i gnyen po bden ba shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su 'dug pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rkyen du 'gyur ba de ltar nyon mongs pa yin par rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: It is tenable that it is an affliction because it is the opposite of the knowledge of the four truths, which is the antidote to that affliction, and it is the condition of the afflictions.

original: sems nyon mongs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems nyon mongs par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is an affliction because it afflicts the mind.

original: ji ltar de las gzhan pa'i shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su 'dug pa na nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rkyen du mi 'gyur pa de ltar nyon mongs pa yin par rnam par mi gzhag go //🔽dmigs pa gang la nyon mongs pa skye ba'i yul de la shes pa 'byung ba la sgrib pa'i dngos por 'dug pa ni nyon mongs pa dang yul mtshungs pa yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa mtshungs par ldan pa yin par gzhag go //
analyzed: ji ltar de las gzhan pa'i shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su 'dug pa na nyon mongs pa rnams kyi rkyen du mi 'gyur pa de ltar nyon mongs pa yin par rnam par mi gzhag go // dmigs pa gang la nyon mongs pa skye ba'i yul de la shes pa 'byung ba la sgrib pa'i dngos por 'dug pa ni nyon mongs pa dang yul mtshungs pa yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa mtshungs par ldan pa yin par gzhag go //
translated: Just as it is not posited as an affliction when it is not the condition of the afflictions because it is not the opposite of consciousness,🔽it is posited as an afflicted mental factor when it is the object of the afflictions because it is the object that is the basis of the arising of the afflictions and it is the basis of the arising of consciousness that is the opposite of the object of the afflictions.

original: yul de las gzhan la shes pa'i sgrib pa'i dngos por 'dug pa ni nyon mongs pa dang yul mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin par rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: yul de las gzhan la shes pa'i sgrib pa'i dngos por 'dug pa ni nyon mongs pa dang yul mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin pa'i phyir nyon mongs pa dang mtshungs par ldan pa ma yin par rnam par gzhag go //
translated: It is posited as a non-afflicted mental factor when it is not the object of the afflictions because it is not the object that is the basis of the arising of the afflictions and it is not the basis of the arising of consciousness that is the opposite of the object of the afflictions.

original: dge ba shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir mi dge ba yin par rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: dge ba shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir mi dge ba yin par rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: It is posited as non-virtuous because it is the opposite of virtuous consciousness.

original: de'i gnyen por shes pa thob par bya la gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por shes pa thob par bya la gus pa bskyed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The antidote to that is the attainment of knowledge, and it is in order to generate respect for that that this verse is stated.

original: de las gzhan pa la shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir mi dge ba yin par rnam par mi gzhag go //🔽mthong ba'i lam gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa la shes pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir mi dge ba yin par rnam par mi gzhag go // mthong ba'i lam gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir /
translated: But it is not posited as nonvirtuous because it is the opposite of knowledge.

original: mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no //
analyzed: mthong bas spang bar bya ba yin no //
translated: It is to be abandoned by the path of seeing because it is the opposite of the path of seeing.

original: bsgom pa'i lam gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no //🔽bsam @61a * //
analyzed: bsgom pa'i lam gyi mi mthun pa'i phyogs yin pa'i phyir bsgom pas spang bar bya ba yin no // bsam @61a * //
translated: It is to be abandoned by the path of meditation because it is the opposite of the path of meditation.

original: pa tha dad pa'i dbang gis rnam par gzhag pa na log par rnam par gzhag pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: pa tha dad pa'i dbang gis rnam par gzhag pa na log par rnam par gzhag pa yang ma yin te /
translated: It is not posited as a wrong view because it is posited by the power of a different intention.

original: dper na lus dang ngag g-yo ba dang / tha snyad gnyis bsam pa'i dbang gis dge ba dang / mi dge ba rnam par gzhag pa bzhin te /
analyzed: dper na lus dang ngag g-yo ba dang / tha snyad gnyis bsam pa'i dbang gis dge ba dang / mi dge ba rnam par gzhag pa bzhin te /
translated: For example, movement of body and speech and the conventional are posited as virtuous or nonvirtuous by the power of intention.

original: sgo de nas de kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems 'jug pa dang ldog bar kun du sbyor ba'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa dag so sor bshad cing /
analyzed: sgo de nas de kun nas slong bar byed pa'i sems 'jug pa dang ldog bar kun du sbyor ba'i phyir dang / sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa dag so sor bshad cing /
translated: and because it is the intention of the Buddha to explain emanations individually,

original: sangs rgyas nyid du rnam bar gzhag pa ni sangs rgyas yin par sems dbang bsgyur ba'i dgongs pa dang / sems can rnams kyi de'i sgo nas ji ltar sangs rgyas la gus pa kun du 'byung bar 'gyur ba snyam du dgongs pa yin pas 'di la nyes pa med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid du rnam bar gzhag pa ni sangs rgyas yin par sems dbang bsgyur ba'i dgongs pa dang / sems can rnams kyi de'i sgo nas ji ltar sangs rgyas la gus pa kun du 'byung bar 'gyur ba snyam du dgongs pa yin pas 'di la nyes pa med pa bzhin no //
translated: and because it is the intention of the Buddha to establish buddhahood as the mind that controls the mind, and because it is the intention of the Buddha to think that sentient beings will develop respect for buddhas through that, there is no fault in this.

original: ma rig pa gnyis pa smra ba yang shes bya gang yid la byed pa na shes pa mi skye ba der ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi shes pa kun du 'byung ba yin par rnam par gzhag ste /
analyzed: ma rig pa gnyis pa smra ba yang shes bya gang yid la byed pa na shes pa mi skye ba der ni de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs mi shes pa kun du 'byung ba yin par rnam par gzhag ste /
translated: The second ignorance is also stated because when any object of knowledge is brought to mind, if consciousness does not arise, then the opposite of that, ignorance, is said to occur.

original: rang gi phra rgyas 'jug pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi phra rgyas 'jug pa thob pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it obtains the entry of its own negative tendencies.

original: dus kun du yang ma yin yul thams cad du yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dus kun du yang ma yin yul thams cad du yang ma yin no //
translated: It does not occur at all times and in all objects.

original: nyon mongs pa gang dang mtshungs par ldan pa de nyid dang lhan cig skye zhing 'gag go //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa gang dang mtshungs par ldan pa de nyid dang lhan cig skye zhing 'gag go //
translated: It arises and ceases together with the defilement with which it is associated.

original: de ltar ni nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ltar ni nyes pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: There is no fault in this,

original: de bas na ma rig pa ni rig pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs chos gzhan zhig yin bar 'grub pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: de bas na ma rig pa ni rig pa'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs chos gzhan zhig yin bar 'grub pa 'di yin no //
translated: and thus ignorance is established as a separate factor, the opposite of knowledge.

original: rnam par shes pa lhag ma ni da dud ma bris so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa lhag ma ni da dud ma bris so //
translated: The other consciousnesses are not mentioned here.

original: 'di ni mya ngan 'das pa'i grong gi lam gcig pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni mya ngan 'das pa'i grong gi lam gcig pa'o //
translated: This is the only path to the city of nirvana.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gi nyi ma'i zer gsal ba //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gsung gi nyi ma'i zer gsal ba //
translated: The light of the sun of the Tathagata's teaching

original: 'phags pa stong snyed rnams kyis bgrod pa bdag med nyid /
analyzed: 'phags pa stong snyed rnams kyis bgrod pa bdag med nyid /
translated: is the selflessness traversed by thousands of noble ones.

original: mig rtul rnams kyis rnam par ma bkrol ba'ang bltas //
analyzed: mig rtul rnams kyis rnam par ma bkrol ba'ang bltas //
translated: I have seen it, though not clearly, because it is not revealed to those with weak eyes.

original: de don yul las byung ba'i bdag la gang yod pa //
analyzed: de don yul las byung ba'i bdag la gang yod pa //
translated: Whatever good I have gained from the object of that

original: de ni 'ang de yi dge bar de dag 'grub par shog //
analyzed: de ni 'ang de yi dge bar de dag 'grub par shog //
translated: may that also be accomplished for the good of those.🔽I have always followed the practices well performed by the Sage,

original: thub pas rab mdzad rnams la rtag tu 'jug pa dang // de yang grub bar bya phyir gang 'dir bdag gis bzung //
analyzed: thub pas rab mdzad rnams la rtag tu 'jug pa dang // de yang grub bar bya phyir gang 'dir bdag gis bzung //
translated: and I have taken up whatever is taught here in order to accomplish that.

original: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang po dang rnam par 'byed pa'i mdo sde rnam par 'grel pa slob dpon ba su ban dhus mdzad pa rdzogs so /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba dang po dang rnam par 'byed pa'i mdo sde rnam par 'grel pa slob dpon ba su ban dhus mdzad pa rdzogs so /
translated: The commentary on the sutra of dependent origination and the first and the analysis of the sutra of dependent origination composed by master Vasubandhu is complete.

original: // / li'i mkhan po su rendra ka ra pra bh'a dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba dge slong nam mkhas bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa 'o /
analyzed: // / li'i mkhan po su rendra ka ra pra bh'a dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba dge slong nam mkhas bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa 'o /
translated: The abbot of Li, Surendrabodhi, and the great editor, the monk Namkhai, translated, edited, and finalized this text.
